loans.name: Eulalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Eulalia A. es socia del banco comunal El Crédito y vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, también es muy rica en su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, Cuenca es cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas.

La Señora. Eulalia se dedica a la elaboración de dulces los que luego distribuye, lleva realizando esta actividad hace 42 años ya que este negocio lo aprendido de su abuelita, ella tenia 11 añitos y ahora tiene los clientes de su abuelita, trabaja todo el día en la realización de dulces para sus entregas y trabaja de lunes a viernes.

Doña Eulalia tiene 53 años, es divorciada  y tiene3 hijos quienes son  mayores de edad,  casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que arrienda.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por una muy buena amiga quien es socia activa, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la realización de sus dulces. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulalia A. is a member of the "El Crédito" (The Loan) community bank and lives in the Cuenca city center.  This city is known for the architectural beauty of its historic center.  It is also very rich in culture, tradition and gastronomy.  Cuenca is the birthplace of great poets and sports people.

Eulalia's business is making sweet treats which she then delivers.  She has been in this business for 42 years since she learned this business from her grandmother when she was 11 years old.  She now has her grandmother's customers.  Eulalia works all day long making her sweet treats to deliver and she works from Monday to Friday.

Eulalia is 53 years old, divorced and has 3 children who are grown up, married, and live independently.  She doesn't have her own home but rents instead.  She is in her fourth loan cycle with her community bank which she was invited to join by a good friend who is an active member.  She will invest her loan in buying raw materials for making her sweet treats.  Her goal is to grow further in her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making sweet treats

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel E. is from the village of Bago.  She is 57 years old.  Rachel is married and has two children, one of whom is married and the other works to support the family.  

Rachel's source of income is her business of selling baked food in the community.  She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month. In 2007, Rachel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Rachel is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials and ingredients for baking.  This will be her ninth loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate family members.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.  It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients for baking

loans.name: Rosa Nila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 46 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a ellos en el distrito de La Victoria, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rosa es profesora de profesión y desde muy joven se sintió comprometida con la educación de los niños, fue así que aprovechó una iniciativa del gobierno a nivel nacional e instaló en su vivienda un centro especializado en educación de niños de dos a cinco años de edad llamado PRONOEI. 

Los PRONOEI son entidades educativas que actúan financiadas por las municipalidades y los padres de familia, su publico objetivo son los niños que provienen de familias de escasos recursos y en ellos se brinda los conocimientos y herramientas necesarios para desarrollar en los niños su capacidad de aprendizaje.

El PRONOEI de Rosa no sólo les brinda conocimientos académicos, sino que también tiene contratados a dos profesores, uno de música y uno de danza. Actualmente ella desea realizar mejoras en uno de sus baños para poder brindar mayor comodidad a sus niños una vez que hayan iniciado las labores académicas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Caital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad ella pudo construir un aula adicional con lo cual pudo atender a más niños. Ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que a través de Kiva le ayudaron a brindar un mejor servicio en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old, separated, and has two children in her care.  She lives with them in La Victoria district, one of the most densely-populated districts in the region, five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosa is a teacher by profession and since she was very young she felt committed to children's education.  She took advantage of a nationwide government initiative and set up a specialized educational center for children aged two to five (PRONOEI) in her home.

PRONOEI are educational centers that are financed by municipalities and children's parents.  Their public aim is for children who come from poor families to gain the knowledge and tools they need to develop their learning capacity.

Rosa's PRONOEI center does not only provide children with academic knowledge.  She also has contracts with two teachers: a music teacher and a dance teacher.  Currently, Rosa would like to make some improvements to one of her bathrooms so that she can make the children in her school more comfortable once they start their school.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Rosa has already had a Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa and their seed money product.  On that occasion, she was able to build an additional classroom so that she could serve more children.  She is grateful to the people who, through Kiva, have helped her to provide a better service to her community.

loans.use: To carry out improvements in one of her bathrooms so that she can make her pupils more comfortable

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas U. is from the village of Nuesa. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Felicitas owns and operates a business making fermented rice and fish mixtures and dried fish for sale in the community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Felicitas joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felicitas from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Silveriano

texts.en:
Silveriano A. is from the village of District 4. He is 50 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Silveriano owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Silveriano has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Silveriano joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silveriano is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Silveriano from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer K. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory to and use as working capital. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Jehiner Ivan

texts.es:
Jehiner tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial y con bastante movimiento de transporte. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace cinco años se ha dedicado a brindar servicio de taxi en la ciudad donde reside. El brinda su servicio todos los dias en las principales zonas frecuentadas por los pobladores de la ciudad. el negocio se ha consolidado como su única fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante. los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos económicos.

Jehiner desea brindar mantenimiento a su vehículo y realizar algunas reparaciones para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento y así asegurarse el sustento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jehiner is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Chiclayo, an area with quite a bit of commercial and transport activity.  It is the capital of Lambayeque region.

Jehiner has been providing taxi services in his city for five years.  He provides his service every day in the main areas frequented by the city's residents.  His business has become his only source of income and so he works hard every day to get ahead.  He uses the income he makes from his business to cover his personal expenses and to help his family cover their financial expenses.

Jehiner would like to have some maintenance work and repairs done on his vehicle to ensure it runs correctly and thereby guarantee his ability to earn a living.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To have maintenance work and repairs done on his vehicle to ensure it runs correctly

loans.name: Jodie

texts.en: Jodie M. is from the village of District 4. He is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jodie raises crops. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jodie has been in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jodie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jodie is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use additional income to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon, 57, is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He is married and has five adult children. Three of his children are currently attending school. Zablon is a retired primary school teacher and depends on his pension to provide the basic needs for his family.  He has also been in the farming business for over twenty years and employs four farmhands. His farm produces maize, tea, and vegetables, which he sells to the local market. 

He has requested a loan of 45,000KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this investment will help in the education of his children. His primary challenges have been the lack of a steady market for milk and poor weather conditions that affect his production. However, he hopes that he will overcome the challenges and expand his dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
65-year-old Zakaria G. is a farmer in Nyamira town, western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for over 20 years and employs one farmhand. His main products are tea and milk, which he sells to the local market. He also owns and operates a kiosk in the same region. He is married with seven children who are all adults.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family. He plans to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring at least three quality dairy cows that will improve his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benecha

texts.en:
Benecha is 56 years old and married with 16 children who are now between the ages of 13 and 35 years old. Four of the children are currently attending school. He has a mixed farm in Nyamira town, western Kenya that produces tea and maize. He has been in the farming business for 30 years and sells his products to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to supply the basic needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will enable him to feed and educate his children without any problem. His biggest challenge has been hailstones, which affect his tea production. He hopes to acquire at least three dairy cows and dairy goats in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Suhayli

texts.ru: Асламов Сухайли житель города Куляб. Ему 26 лет. Женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Живет вместе с родителями. Мать работает уборщицей. Сам Cухайли занимается торговлей на рынке Саховат. У него собственная торговая точка. В основном он продает нижнее белье, платки и многое другое. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже два года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он намерен расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Suhayli A., 26, lives in Qulyab. He is married with one child. The young couple lives with his parents. His mother works as a cleaning lady. Suhayli has a retail stand at the Sahovat market where he sells underwear, handkerchiefs, and so forth. Having been in this business for two years, he is applying for a loan that would allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Yuvinalis

texts.en:
Yuvinalis is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 12 years and employs one farmhand. His mixed farm produces tea, maize, wheat and bananas, which are all sold locally. He solely depends on the income from his farming activities to supply the basic needs of his family.

Yuvinalis is 53 years old. He is married and has been blessed with six children who are between the ages of 14 and 32 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He plans to use the profits from this investment to pay school fees for his children. He would like to expand his dairy farming in future by acquiring five high-yielding dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ongau

texts.en:
O. is 84 years old and married with 14 children who are all adults. He has been farming for 40 years in Nyamira town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, tea, beans, tea, sugarcane and bananas, which are all sold locally. Farming is his only source of income.

He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Шарифхучаева Зулайхо проживает в районе Восеъ. Ей 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новой швейной машинки, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Zulaykho S., 46, lives in Vose. She has high school education and is married with 8 children. Zulaykho makes a living by making national dresses. She works from home. Having been in this business for seven years, she is applying for a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine to keep her business running.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carmelita Enomar Group

texts.en:
Carmelita E. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Carmelita is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member, if the other one is delinquent or defaults.

Carmelita is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.


In 2009, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred has been practicing mixed farming for five years in Kitale town in western Kenya. Her main products are milk, vegetables and maize which she sells to the local market. Her major challenges in this business have been diseases and lack of enough animal feed.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her family will then be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. In the future, she would like to expand her dairy farming and be the major supplier of milk to the local market.

Mildred is 33 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. All the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for three years now. He sells his milk, eggs and sugarcane to the local market. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business in the same area.

Francis is twenty-one years old and single.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve his livelihood and expand his business. He would like to acquire five more dairy cows and a chuff cutter in the next five years. He faces the challenge of the high cost of artificial insemination services for the cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Basguloy

texts.ru: Абирова Басгулой проживает в районе Восеъ. Ей 44 года. Вдова, имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается дома. К ней приходят девушки, чтобы научиться шить платья. У нее имеются ученики. Сейчас она нуждается в получении кредита. Кредит берет для покупки новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Basguloy A., 44,  lives in Vose. She is widowed with 3 children. Basguloy has high school education. For the past ten years she has been in the business of sewing national dresses. She works from home, where young women visit her in order to learn the trade. Basguloy is applying for a loan so that she can buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old, a widow, and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns a business providing transportation service to the local community. She's able to earn a monthly net income of 3,000 PHP from this business. She has been engaged in her business for more than six years.

In 2010, Josefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her first loan from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now. Her mixed farm, which is located in Kitale town in western Kenya, produces milk, eggs, vegetables and tomatoes, which are all sold locally.

She recently repaid her previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that thereby she will have acquired another asset, and that her family's livelihood will improve through the income from the sale of milk. She faces the challenge of the lack of clean water for her dairy cows. She plans to buy a water tank and acquire more dairy cows in the future.

Joyce is 61 years old. She is married with three children who are all adults.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is twenty-five years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 10, who both attend school. She has been in the farming business for five years now. She sells her milk, maize and wheat to the local market.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her family will then be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. In the next five years she plans to acquire three dairy cows, a chuff cutter and a posho mill (a machine that grinds maize into maize flour).

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leah Chepkiriu

texts.en:
Leah Chepkirui K., a 39-year-old single woman, has a five-year-old son who is in primary school. They live in Moi's Bridge in Kitale, where she operates a retail shop selling sugar, milk, rice, soap, etc. Leah has been in this business for six years now, earning a monthly income of five thousand shillings.

This will be Leah's first loan from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy two bags of sugar worth Ksh.6,000, and one-and-a-half bags of rice worth Kshs.4,000. Additional income arising from the loan will be put toward the purchase of a dairy cow whose milk will be sold.

In the future Leah would like to educate her child to the highest level and also own her own wholesale shop where she can sell goods to retailers.

loans.use: To buy more stock including sugar, rice, tea leaves, and milk for sale

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo C. is from the village of District 4. He is 45 years old. Domingo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Domingo owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Domingo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Domingo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Domingo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. She has been farming for six years now and employs one farmhand. Her main products are milk, vegetables and bananas which are sold locally.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through the Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Then, her family will be assured of enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help her in paying school fees for her children. Her major challenges have been diseases and lack of enough animal feed.

Alice is 24 years old and married with four school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Nenita is married and has three children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business in agricultural sector in raising crops. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Nenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now. She has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces maize, tea, bananas and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. 

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through the Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood.  She would like to expand her horticultural farming in the future to enable her to improve her income.

Pamela is 31 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 4 and 12. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne T. is 34 years old, married to Kennedy Mugushi, and together they are blessed with four beautiful children. They live in Kibomet in Kitale Town where she runs her business of selling used clothes. She has been in business for four years now and she gets a monthly income of about $125.

This will be Everlyne's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to buy one bale of used clothes for resale, and with the income she will earn she plans to pay back the loan and also save some money for future use. In the future she wants to be a wholesale dealer of used clothes, and also to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy one bale of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Alice Auma

texts.en:
Alice Auma O. is 33 years, married to Malachi Osewe, and together they have four children. They live in Bidii in Kitale town. Alice has three businesses: she has a stall where she sells used clothes, a saloon and a barber shop, but her primary business is the selling of clothes. She has been in these businesses for five years now and gets a monthly income of about $275.

This will be Alice's first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy one bale of used clothes for resale (for 11,000 KES) and materials for making clothes (for 9,000 KES). With the income she will get she plans to buy a plot of land in the near future. She also wants to educate her children and provide them with basic needs, like food, shelter and clothing.

loans.use: To buy used clothes and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 55 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger housing districts of the city. Narantsetseg and her husband are both retired and her husband helps her in her business. Narantsetseg’s two daughters live apart from her, in Selenge province in northern Mongolia. 

Narantsetseg supports her family by selling coal and firewood at Tsaiz, the largest outdoor firewood and coal market in Mongolia. 

In 1995, when she first began her business, she had 500,000 MNT in working capital. She purchases coal and firewood by truck from her suppliers and sells them in small bags.  Now her working capital is 1.5 million MNT.  Besides firewood and coal trading she also sells candies, bakery products, purified water, juices and other small foods from a small booth.

She is requesting a 1,000,000MNT loan to purchase a large amount of coal and firewood before the Mongolian Lunar New Year holiday. During this holiday, demand for her coal and firewood is very high and it is the best time to purchase coal and wood in large amounts from the suppliers.

Narantsetseg says that she want to grow her business with this loan and become a supplier of firewood and coal trading with her own truck.  Her goal is to improve her living by moving into an apartment so her family can unite with the two daughters in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of coal and firewood before the Mongolian Lunar New Year holiday

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Evelyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business running a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and married to Viola Kiptoo. They have eight children between the ages of 21 and 2. He runs a retail shop, and he has been in business for eight years. Right now his monthly income from the business is about $334. 

He is borrowing 35,000 KES which he intends to use to add more stock to the retail shop. This is his second loan. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He plans to use the anticipated profit to open a tailoring shop, 

Joseph's dreams and hopes are to expand the stock in his shop, to buy sewing machines to sell, to employ two people and to provide his children with a high level of education.

loans.use: To add stock to his store

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert G. is from the village of District 4. He is 40 years old. Albert is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Albert owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Albert has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Albert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Albert is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Albert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Everyline Kadenge

texts.en:
Everyline N., 34 years old, is married to William Kimeli, a farmer of 55 years old. They support three children aged 10, 8 and 6.  Everyline has been selling cereals at the Ndurio Trading Centre for 11 years and her monthly profits are 6,000 KES.  

Everyline has borrowed 20,000 KES for her first loan from KADET LTD and she intends to use this amount to purchase maize, beans and millet for resale. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a plot of land, build rental houses and meet the needs of her customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 57, is a farmer from Nyamira in western Kenya. She is married with 6 children between the ages of 15 and 35 years old. She has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now. Her main products are milk and vegetables, which she sells locally.

Joyce has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Kiva's partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take her children to better schools. She faces the challenges of diseases and lack of animal feed, especially during the dry season. However, she would like to expand her dairy farming in the future and be the major milk supplier to the local market.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo P. is from the village of District 4. He is 43 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Danilo plants and harvests rice for sale. Danilo has been engaged in his business for more than 22 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Danilo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danilo is requesting his first loan, for 25000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  Danilo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Penina Kazungu

texts.en:
Penina Kazungu K., 39 years old, is married to John and they have one child. Penina supports her family. She has been in the furniture making business for the last two years and the business is doing well.

This is her first loan from KADET and she has never borrowed from any other MFI. She plans to use the loan to purchase more timber for making furniture. From the anticipated profits, she plans to open another workshop. Her hope and dream is to succeed through KADET.

loans.use: to purchase more timber

loans.name: Samson Chengo

texts.en:
Samson Chengo N. is a 52-year old businessman from Voi, Taru. He is married to Vallentina and together they have 8 children.


Samson owns a butcher shop and has been in this business for the last 26 years. With this loan, he plans to buy goats to add meat stock since many of his customers like goat meat because of it's softness. He will also buy hides and skins for sale. 

The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. He hopes to succeed through subsequent KADET loans.

loans.use: To buy goats to add meat stock, and buy hides and skins for sale

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
Clemente A. is from the village of District 4. He is 47 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Clemente plants and harvests rice for sale. Clemente has been engaged in his business for more than 26 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Clemente joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clemente is requesting his first loan,  for 25000 PHP,  to be used to pay for services to increase crop yield.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 43 years old and married, with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Enhamgalan

texts.en:
Enhamgalan G.  is 40 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hentii province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger,  a traditional Mongolian  tent home. His oldest son attends a local high school and his wife helps him with the business. 

Enhamgalan operates a wood-products trading business in his town. He makes a variety of wooden products such as chairs, tables and doors for gers, depending on his customers' orders. He started his wood product-making business in 2001 after operating a iron/metal production business since 1991. In addition, he operates a construction business to supplement his earnings, building homes to customers' orders. 

Enhamgalan has built a stable base of operations for both businesses and his business earnings have increased greatly. With his earnings, he was able to purchase his own plot of land.  In the future, he plans to build his own house for his family. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his wood-products business.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza O. is a 62-year-old widow with four children. She worked as a nurse at the local hospital for 25 years and now she is on pension.  In order to find an additional means of subsistence, she decided to start her activities in cattle breeding and land cultivating with potatoes and wheat. Her success was achieved due to hard work and strong efforts.  Roza managed to increase the number of cattle to two milk cows and one bull. Also, she had 5 tons of potatoes to sell. 

Now Roza is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase one cow and two tons of potato seeds. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to pay for the education of her grandson. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and seeds

loans.name: Francis Nzenge

texts.en:
Francis, age 29, is married and has two sons; ages five and two. He operates a retail shop where he sells items like flour, detergent, tealeaves, cooking fat, and bread among other food items. He has been running this business for 3 years and finds it quite profitable. 

This is the second loan he is getting from KADET LTD and he intends to use it to buy more stock for the shop. If the loan improves the business, he hopes to open a business for his wife and educate his children.

In the future, Francis hopes to expand and have his business well-established so that he can give his family a better life.

loans.use: To buy flour, bar soap, and sugar

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles excellent essentiellement dans les activités de teinture  tel  AWA F.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de bazin, 20 kg de teinture.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso. Elle vend  ses habits teints à Sikasso dans son atelier et à domicile, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes .
 Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group named Danaya are married women who are on average 32 years old and they each have 2 children. They majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

In order to meet client demand they have requested their ninth group loan with the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner).  The previous loans were all successfully repaid. They excel in the business of dying fabric with Awa F..

With the new loan she plans on purchasing 10 pieces of bazin fabric, and 20 kg of fabric dye. She acquires her goods in the market in Sikasso. She resells the dyed garments in Sikasso from the workshop she has in her home. She completes her sales in cash and her clientele is made up of both men and women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 70.500 FCFA and a portion of this profit will be put away in savings and some will be used to fill the family's needs.  The remaining portion will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to dye fabric.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Давлятов Азам проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Сын работает учителем в средней школе. Сам Азам имеет средне - техническое образование, пожарник. По специальности проработал более 18 лет. Кроме того он занимается садоводством. При доме имеет небольшой сад, где сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и других расходов для посева. Он хочет получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Azam D., 50, lives in Vose and is married with five children. His son is a teacher. As for Azam, a trained firefighter, he has spent eighteen years fighting fires. Apart from that, he does gardening. Azam has a small orchard next to his house. He has been in the fruit business for ten years, and is now applying for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and to cover other expenses related to sowing. Azam would like to secure a good crop and sell the fruit.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and to cover other expenses related to sowing

loans.name: Dorligsuren

texts.en: Dorligsuren P. lives with his children in Mongolia. His oldest two sons attend school. Dorligsuren operates a food products trading business in his town with help of his wife. He sells a variety of food stuffs to the workers in the gold mines. He started his grocery trading business in 2007 after operating a car and motorcycle repair center since 2002. After years of hard work, he has built a stable operation and his earnings have enabled him to pay his children's tuition fees. For the future, Dorligsuren wants to expand his business and plans to plant a variety of vegetables in his own 5 hectare field. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to sell

loans.name: Stephen Kamau

texts.en:
Stephen is 22 years old. He lives in Waithaka, a small trading center in Kikuyu town. Stephen operates a small workshop where he offers welding services to his clients. He started this business about two years ago, and with this loan he wants to buy a welding machine. This will enable him to serve his customers better.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he hopes that his trade will expand well.

Stephen is a responsible and hardworking young man. He hopes to establish a big workshop and a hardware shop of his own.

loans.use: To buy a small welding machine

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont essentiellement des  femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA I  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur neuvième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été   correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait plusieurs activités telles la teinture  avec OUMOU D.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 15 pièces de bazin(riches et moins riches),  10 kg  de potasse, de différentes colories de teinture auprès des grossistes au grand marché  de Sikasso.
Elle vend dans son atelier et à domicile et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville, au comptant et quelques à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group named Jiguisseme are married women who are on average 30 years old and they each have 2 children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso, and the third administrative region of Mali. 

In order to meet client demand they have requested their ninth group loan from the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). The previous loans were successfully repaid. This group of women takes on various business activities, including dying fabric with Oumou D.. 

With their loan she plans on purchasing 15 pieces of bazin fabric (both thick and thin fabric), 10 kg of potassium, and different dyes from the wholesalers in the market in Sikasso. She makes her sales from her workshop at home and by traveling to the different quarters of the city.  She completes her sales in cash and sometimes on credit, selling to a clientele made up of both men and women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 65.000 FCFA, of which a portion will be put away in savings, a portion will be used to meet the family's needs, and the rest will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to dye fabric.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg L. is 40 year old and lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student and her youngest son attends high school. Her husband has been living and working in the USA for the past 6 years. 

Uranchimeg operates a bag trading business in the Sunday Plaza trade center. She sells a variety of quality products such as bags and towels that are imported from Bejin, China, out of a rented stall. She is a modest, well calculating and responsible woman. Uranchimeg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more varieties of bags.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of bags

loans.name: Francklin Kazungu

texts.en:
Francklin Kazungu C. is 32 years old, married to Esther and together they have two children. Francklin has been a retail shop owner for the last thirteen years.

He has never borrowed from any MFI, this being his first loan from KADET, he plans to purchase flour, sugar, cereals and cooking oil, so that to add more stock for the business which will enable him to serve his customers effectively. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the completion of his rental houses. His hopes and dreams are to succeed through subsequent KADET loans.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, cereals and cooking oil into his business

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  He operates a cafe in a rented space at the local market in his town. He opened his cafe in 2008 after moving from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After years of successful operation, his monthly net profit has increased to a level of 200,000 and 250,000 MNT. He hired one assistant worker who receives monthly salary of 100,000 MNT.For the future, he hopes to have hhis own restaurant. Munhbat is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve a large amount of beef for his cafe.

loans.use: To purchase and preserve a large amount of beef

loans.name: Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Development Group-Mityana

texts.en: 5o year old Mary K.  is affiliated with the Myanzi Tukolerewamu Women's Development Group- Mityana. It is now over 8 years since she began her Agro produce sales business in Myanzi. This happily married mother of 6 says she has been selling crops such as cassava, maize, beans, rice, cabbages and Pumpkins at a stall in Myanzi Food market. Mary says she started off as a subsistence farmer mostly growing crops for home consumption. Mary came to the realization that selling some of the crops she grew in her modest farming gardens would bring her some much needed income to sustain and provide better welfare for her family. Weekly this business generates her 30,000 shillings. Most of the clients to her business are wholesale sellers in and around Mityana Town. With this loan, Mary says she is going to improve her stall and also improve her farming gardens.

loans.use: For improvement costs to her stall and  to improve her farming gardens

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Tsolmon A. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local primary school. Her husband is a herder who also works as a preservationist of Bogd mountain and receives a monthly salary of 175000 MNT. 

Tsolmon currently operates a goods trading business. She travels thorough the countrysides to sell a variety of small household goods to the rural people. She gets livestock in return for her products. She started her business in 2001 and has since gained much experience. 

Her family now owns 247 head of livestock. She also makes and sells roast meat for tourists during the summer months. In addition, she works as a ticket clerk at the Bogd mountain national reserve to supplement her earnings. Her earnings have enabled her to fully redecorate her home. 

For the future, they plan to increase their livestock number. She is requesting a 2000000 MNT loan in order to expand her product line for her trading business.

loans.use: To expand her product line

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Сафаров Бахром проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 32 года. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец работает главным бухгалтером в строительном учреждении. Сам Бахром имеет высшее образование, биолог. Предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже два года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Bahrom S., 32, lives in Qulyab. He is married with three children and lives with his parents. His father is a chief accountant in a construction company. Bahrom is a university graduate in biology but he makes a living as a taxi driver. Having been in this business for two years, he is applying for a loan in order to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Audrey

texts.en:
Audrey is a married  of 36 years old and a mother of four children. Her husband's income adds to the family income. She operates a mobile phone and accessories shop in Buruburu estate which is a middle class estate. This is her primary business which she has been doing for the last two years.
 
With this loan, she plans to add more stock of the phones and their accessories so that she can increase her capital base.

She hopes to expand and grow her business so as to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy Mobile phones and phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Chubak

texts.en:
Chubak S. is a 40-year-old farmer. He has very tight-knit family with five children. His wife works as a nurse at the local hospital.
 
In order to support his family, Chubak decided to start his own business in cattle breeding and land cultivating with wheat, barley and alfalfa. Owing to his persistent, hardworking personality, Chubak, with starting capital of 10000 KGS, managed to multiply his investments and now earns about 3000 KGS in a month. Also, in seasons of harvesting, he works as a truck driver and helps his countrymen to gather their crops.
  
Chubak plans to use the loan of 100000 KGS to expand his farm by buying two colts and bull-calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to pay for the education of his children and broaden his business by purchasing more cattle. 

Chubak is an attentive father and makes every effort to make his dream come true: He wants to see his children become educated and cultured persons.
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife and one child. He cooperates earning the family income with his wife who owns a home maid office.  After having13 years of experience in the clothing field, he decided in 2009 to open a clothing store. He purchases his products from a local clothing center. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase supplementary products to increase his sales and therefore his family’s financial level.

loans.use: To purchase supplementary products

loans.name: Cecilia Wanjera

texts.en:
Cecilia Wanjera K. is 40 years old, married and she is a mother of three children aged between nineteen to four years old.

Cecilia is a salonist, and she has been doing this for the last ten years with good income. She learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be her third loan which she is planning to expand her business by employing another staff.  The salon is situated on a strategic point in Narok where she is able to attend to different customers. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business.

Her hopes and dream is to become a great business lady. Cecilia is a young, energetic and active lady who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to expand her beauty salon business by employing another helping hand in the business.

loans.name: Asomuddin

texts.ru: Нуров Асомуддин проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 62 года. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. Сыновья работают. Сам Асомуддин имеет среднее образование. Более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Asomuddin N., 62, lives in Qulyab. He is married with eight children. His sons work. Asomuddin himself has high school education. He spent twenty years planting crops. He owns a piece of land where he plants wheat. Asomuddin is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and to secure a good crop for sale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon, living with his wife and one child. He is the only income provider in the family. He has been working as a furniture carpenter and painter for 18 years. In 2002, he opened his own furniture store and started to do his own designs and paintings. He obtained his first Kiva loan and it showed very good results. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory of wood so he can produce more and therefore sell more as a result and increase his profits.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of wood

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his father and one cousin. He has been working so hard over the years to open a small computer shop in 2007. As is common in Lebanon, he helps his father with the family income. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by renovating the computers and adding some decoration for the shop so he can welcome the customers properly.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two school-age children. She has worked as a private teacher in her house since 2003 and in parallel she has worked as a teacher in a local school since 2008. She cooperates with her husband who works in the construction field to provide the family’s income. It’s frequent in Lebanon to have many jobs to be able to handle the high costs.

Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the teaching room and equip it with the needed tools to make to students feel comfortable while having their lessons.

loans.use: To improve the teaching room and equip it with the needed tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon. She lives on her own. She worked in a clothing store for more than four years and in 2008 started to work as a clothing seller from her house. She works hard day after day to be able to face the increasing costs of food, housing, and other personal expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her business and purchase more products. In the future, she is hoping to expand her business operation and open her own clothing store.

loans.use: To improve her business and purchase more products

loans.name: Kyosimba Onaanya Nambaale Group-Mityana

texts.en:
Florence N., 35, has been operating a retail shop in Nambaale-Mityana for the past five years. At her shop she is fully supported by her family members. This is the underlying factor that she says has been of paramount importance in her success. 

Florence, who is happily married with five children, says she began this business after she dropped out of school. Dropping out of school meant she had to do something to make ends meet since she had children. This business has enabled her give her children an education, albeit with some difficulty, as she has many other demanding tasks to shoulder such as the payment of rent and other business operation costs.  

Monthly, this business generates 780000 shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more general merchandise to resell. She belongs to Kyosimba Onaanya Nambaale group-Mityana.

loans.use: To purchase more general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and four siblings. He is from Lebanon. Despite his young age, he works as a freelance accountant and computer programmer at the same time. He provides accounting reports to members of his community and some local companies. It’s common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs to be able to cover the family’s expenses. He helps his father with the family’s income.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance for his car so he could make his transportation easier to his workplaces.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He represents the only income source for his family. He has worked as a gypsum specialist for 14 years and in 2001, he decided to open a small gypsum shop. He obtained a Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with punctual payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products and utensils for his shop so he can work in a more professional way to increase his sales and thus his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and utensils

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-age children. He helps his wife with the family's income. His wife works as a babysitter. He has worked as a freelance wall foliage specialist for 30 years. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he has been a reliable Ameen borrower with consistent, on-time repayments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and renew his tools. He is very positive about his future and willing to take on multiple construction projects.

loans.use: To improve his business and renew his tools

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide O. is a 55-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5000. 

Heide is  borrowing PHP 20000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Heide aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and four school-age children.  Twenty years ago, he got the idea of starting a new business regarding the needs of his town. He bought an electric generator to provide electricity to the region. He is the only one who distributes electricity in his town. Because of his old age, his young children help him from time to time to keep the family at a good financial stage. 
 
Today, his is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make the needed repairs on his generator so he can grant his clients non-stoppable electricity.

loans.use: To make the needed repairs on his generator

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who are attending school. He worked as a metal specialist for more than 18 years and in 2000, he bought an iron-cutting machine and started to do his own design work. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client. He is very satisfied with the results and he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to complete the needed maintenance for his machinery. This will allow him to continue his work, which represents his family's only income source.

loans.use: To complete the needed maintenance for his machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new barber chair

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste N. is 23 years old. He is married and has a 2-year-old child. 

Theoneste sells a variety of useful goods such as sugar, rice and cooking oil. He has three years of experience and the hours of his business are from 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m. 

Theoneste will use this loan to purchase a variety of goods for resale. With any profit he makes, he plans to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase variety of goods

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is 44 years old business lady in Kisimani. She is a widow and a mother of four children. She has been in the tailoring and boutique business for the last five years. 

This being her first loan from KADET, she plans to purchase more materials for making new clothes, and buy some new clothes for the boutique. The anticipated profits she will pay school fee for her children. Beatrice’s dreams and hopes for the future is to own a rental car company.

loans.use: purchase more materials and clothes into her business

loans.name: C4610 Dusabane Group

texts.en:
Irene U. is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are between 4 and 10 years old. She is the president of a group called “Dusabane,” which means sharing. Irene sells charcoal and has been doing so for three years. She is open from 6 am until 8 pm every day. She currently employs five people.

Irene and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for a purpose of buying more charcoal to sell. With this expansion, Irene hopes to start saving and to satisfy the basic needs of her family, including paying the school fees for her children, and to buy her own house.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Twekembe Kikooza Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Joyce N., 46, is happily married with six children who all go to school. 

She has been working in the rather lucrative charcoal sales business in and around Mukono town for the last decade. Charcoal is used by many households, not only in Mukono but all over Uganda, for cooking purposes. 

Joyce began this business under the auspices of her husband, who she says is a good-humored gentleman who has given her the latitude to freely go about her business, even if it means traveling long distances to sell her bags of charcoal. 

Joyce says what motivated her to work in this business were the high profits she was seeing her close friends making out of selling charcoal. Her profits total up to 80000 shillings a week. 

With this loan, Joyce says she is looking forward to purchasing more bags of charcoal to resell. She belongs to Twekembe Kikooza group-Mukono.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Rhodah Onindo

texts.en:
Rhodah Onindo O. is a woman of twenty eight years, married to Benard Wanjala who is a businessman in Kitale and supports the family.  Rhodah owns a barber shop in Kibomet where she lives with her family. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of four thousand shillings.

This will be Rhodah's first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy another shaving machine, and with the income she is going to get she wants to save and buy a photocopy machine so that she can diversify her business.

In future she wants to buy a plot and also educate her children and raise her family's standards of living.

loans.use: To buy shaving machine

loans.name: Kisembo

texts.en:
Kisembo is a 28-year-old married man with seven children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of paying school fees for his children and providing other basics.

He has a general merchandise shop and has been running it for nine years now. He started by selling local gin and saved to start his current business. He faces a challenge of bad debtors, but in the future he hopes to turn his business into a wholesale shop. 

He needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Ginazio

texts.en:
Ginazio is a 37-year-old married man with six children living in a semi-permanent house in Kibaale, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children up to university.

He has a business of trading in local brew, called waragi, and has been doing it for five years. He started by brewing local gin, then later started buying from other brewers. 

He faces a challenge of customers who default on payments, but in the future he hopes to expand his business to bigger markets. He wants the loan for buying alcohol for resale.

loans.use: To buy alcohol for resale

loans.name: Nader

texts.ar:
نادر في عمر 27 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في بيع الاحذية له في عمله نحو 6 سنوات يحب عمله ويسغى جاهدا على
تطوير نفسه وعمله فهو جدي نشيط ويحب التجديد في العمل لم يكن لديه صعوبات في عمله لأنها العمل الذي يحب
يحب الاستقلالية والتجديد يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تحسين ديكور المحل وتجديد البضائع
لأنه يلقى منافسة من محيطه العملي ما يميزه انه مثابر ويطمح الى ان يفتتح محل آخر له لكي يزيد من مدخوله
texts.en: Nader is 27 years old and has been working as a shoe salesman for the past six years. As someone who is very earnest and vigorous, he is perpetually seeking to develop himself and his work. Nader never has any trouble delving into his work since he loves it so much.
