Nader now would like to obtain a loan from Al Majmoua to spruce up the décor of his shop and purchase some new merchandise since he faces stiff competition in his area. Ultimately, he aspires to open up a second branch of his business to increase revenue.

loans.use: To spruce up decor of shop and purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Philip Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Philip, 26 years of age, has operated his office supplies and photocopy shop in Naivasha town for the last five years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 60,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to restock his shop with enough books and pens for sell.

In future, Philip hopes to run more branches around town selling office supplies and school materials.

loans.use: To restock his shop with books and pens for sell.

loans.name: Swafiya Ahmed

texts.en:
Swafiya Ahmed H. is a 48 years old lady. She is married to Joseph and they have eight children. Swafiya is a fish monger and she also sells fish. She has been in this business for the last three years.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase more fishing equipments. From the anticipated profits she plans to open a food Kiosk. Her hopes and dreams are to succeed through fishing and become a supplier.

loans.use: purchase more fishing equipments

loans.name: Naeim

texts.ar:
نعيم في عمر 41 سن متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عائلته ويعمل في بيع الحلوايات له في عمله نحو 20 سنة  يحب عائلته ويسعى
دائما الى تأمين العيش الكريم يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع للمحل مواد اولية لصنع الحلوايات
عائلته كل اهتمامه طموح يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضعه المادي فهو يحلم بفتح اكثر من محل له وتوسيع العمل
وتحسين نوعية العمل
texts.en: Naeim is a 41-year-old husband and father of four who wants nothing more than to secure a dignified life for his family. Having worked as a seller of confectionaries for the past twenty years, Naeim is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase ingredients to manufacture more candies. Naeim is very driven and dreams of improving the quality of his products and of expanding his business by opening more branches in the future.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to manufacture candies.

loans.name: Matendo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Mayimuna N., 31, is the married mother of two children. She has two businesses: charcoal sales and a grocery. On the side, she also has a small sugar cane sales business. The business she has been relying most on, however, is charcoal sales. These businesses are located in Nakifuma in Mukono district. 

Mayimuna, who makes common cause with Matendo Development group, has a niche clientele that consists mostly of low- and middle-income earners in and around her operating area. 

Mayimuna says all credit goes to her husband for helping her get established. Since then, she says, it's been hard work throughout in the quest to consolidate her gains. Monthly, these combined businesses generate 200000 shillings. 

With this loan, Mayimuna says she is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 40 سنة يعمل في بيع القهوة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته وعمله له في عمله 6 سنوات
يريد ان يطور عائلته ونفسه فهو يحب لعائلته تحسين وضعهم وتأمين عيش كريم لهم له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة
فقد كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته ومحيطه وكان له تأثير جيد على تحسين نوعية العمل
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة اكسبرس للقهوة لزيادة مدخوله في بيع القهوة والنسكافيه يحلم بأن 
يصبح صاحب محل حيث انه يبيع القهوة على متن سيارة خاصة له
texts.en: Hasan is a 40-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and wants to improve their lot and who in turn receives considerable support from them. Hasan has six years of experience selling coffee. His last loan from Al Majmoua had a noticeable impact upgrading the quality of his product. He would now like another loan to purchase an espresso machine. In general, Hasan hopes to one day purchase his own shop given that he now has to use his car as a shop front.

loans.use: To purchase espresso machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items for bathroom supplies business

loans.name: Mohammadi

texts.ar:
محمدي في عمر 26 سنة يعمل في نقل الخضار الى الاسواق متزوج يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضعه المادي والاجتماعي وخاصة انه 
في طور تامين مستقبله ما يميزه هي الدقة في العمل والالتزام يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة
الى شراء بيك اب جديد لنقل الخضار وتحسين وتوسيع رقعة العمل له يحلم دائما بتأمين العيش الجيد له ولزوجته
وعائلته وان يصبح من اصحاب العمل الخاص
texts.en: Mohammadi is 26 years old and dreams of securing a good future for his wife and family and of becoming self-employed. He is distinguished by his thoroughness and commitment in his work as a vegetable distributor. Mohammadi is now asking A. Majmoua for a loan to purchase a new pickup truck to expand his zone of distribution.

loans.use: To purchase new pickup truck for vegetable distribution business

loans.name: C6219 Abahujumugambi Group

texts.en:
Damascene H. is 44 years old and is married with two children aged 5 and 9. He also cares for two dependents who are 3 and 5 years old. Damascene is the leader of a group which is called  "Abahujumugambi," which means in English "Having the same goal." This group includes ten people: one man and nine women.

Damascene owns a small pub which sells beer. Damascene has four years experience. And his pub is open from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.  He employs three people.

Damascene and his team have requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company. He will use the loan to improve his pub.

loans.use: To improve his pub

loans.name: Anizia

texts.en:
Anizia is 28 years old and married with one child who is three years old. Anizia has her own store which contains different goods and food, such as bread, sugar, rice, cooking oil, soap, etc.  Anizia  has been in her business for one year. She employs two people.  She is open from 6am until 8pm every day.  

This loan will help her purchase a variety of goods to resell.  She would like to reinvest any profits she will make back into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing a variety of goods to resell.

loans.name: Donatien

texts.en:
Donatien is 45 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of eight and twenty. He sells beer, and employs eight other people to help him. He has been in the business for six years and the business is open from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturdays. 

Donatien will use this loan to increase his business. He plans to reinvest any profit he makes back into the business.

loans.use: To increase his business.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 44 years old and married with three children between the ages of six and twelve years old. He sells meat. He employs two people in the business and he has been in the business for four years. The hours of the business are from 7.30am until 3pm every day.

Pascal will use this loan to purchase more meat. He will reinvest any profits he makes back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Wisam

texts.ar:
وسام في عمر 40 سنة  متزوج وله اولاد يعمل في نقل الخضار الى الاسواق له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله كثيرا ويبرع
فيه فهو طموح مثابر ويريد تأمين العيش الكريم له ولعائلته متميز بعمله ما يميزه هي الدقة والصدق
له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد كان للقرض اثر جيد جدا له وكان يلقى الدعم من عائلته يريد من خلال 
طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع البيك الذي يملكه حتى يتمكن من تحسين نوعية عمله
texts.en: Wisam is a 40-year-old husband and father who wants to provide a dignified life for his family and who in turn is greatly supported by them. Wisam possesses ten years experience working in vegetable distribution. He is very driven and honest in his work, which he excels at. His last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive effect so Wisam is now asking for another loan to upgrade his pickup truck.

loans.use: To upgrade pickup truck

loans.name: Twesimye Nagalama Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 39-year-old Alice L. has been running her timber and firewood selling businesses for twelve years in Nagalama-Mukono. Both these businesses were given the start up push by her husband, with whom she has three kids. She says what spawned the growth of her business from its beginning was the growing demand from many people around Nagalama for timber products and firewood. Sensing this, Alice owed it to herself to work extremely hard to meet the demands of her clients. Before all this, Alice was involved in a local herb selling business. Alice is affiliated with the Twesimye Nagalama development group. Alice is requesting this loan to buy more timber to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to resell

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. She also cares for three adopted children. Francine sells bananas. She employs five other people to help her. Francine has been in the business for eight months and the hours of the business are from 6am to 9pm every day. 

Francine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es: Yonny, de  27 años, vive  en su casa que es propia en  compañía de su pequeño  hijo Johan, y juntos se esfuerzan por salir adelante en busca del progreso.Las dos  actividades a las que se dedica  son: la agricultura, y el trasporte público. Todas las mañanas moviliza  plátanos, naranja y cítricos con su camión propio; a las ciudades del interior del país. Se siente muy satisfecho  con el trabajo que está realizando, pues logro comprar su propio camión, que compró en varias cuotas, ya muy pronto terminará de completar lo que le falta. Además  se siente orgulloso de todo lo obtenido, ya que además de su negocio de trasporte, también tiene terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra café y plátanos, los que cosecha y comercializa, en diferentes ciudades, a buenos precios. Como es un hombre emprendedor tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una empresa de transporte que cubra las rutas de las diferentes ciudades del país hacia la selva central.Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmas”, y es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, desde entonces ha laborado con honestidad pues  trabaja únicamente con su banco comunal.Yonny afirma que para la campaña agrícola de café; necesitará proporcionar buenos granos, para ello tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono; también invertirá en el trasporte de frutas a las ciudades del interior del país.
texts.en:
Yonny is 27 years old.  He lives in his own home with his young son Johan.  Together they work hard to get ahead in life in search of progress.

The two businesses Yonny is engaged in are farming and public transport.  Every morning he transports bananas, oranges and citrus fruit, in his own truck, to towns in the country's interior.  He feels very satisfied with the work that he does since he has managed to buy his own truck which he bought in several instalments.  He will finish paying back what is left very soon.  Yonny also feels proud of everything he has obtained since, as well as his transport business, he also owns farmland where he grows coffee and bananas which he harvests and sells in different towns for a good price.

As he is an enterprising man, in the future Yonny plans to set up a transport company which will cover the routes from the different towns and cities in his country to the central jungle.

Yonny is a member of the "Las Palmas" community bank and this is the seventh loan that he has had from MFP.  He has always worked honestly and only works with his community bank.  Yonny tells us that he will need to provide good beans this coffee season and so he is planning to invest his money in buying several sacks of manure.  He will also invest in transporting fruit to the towns in the country's interior.

loans.use: To buy manure and to pay to transport goods

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de pan, la socia tiene una panadería, ella prepara diferentes tipos de pan y lo vende en la plaza de armas de Oropesa, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina manteca y azúcar para hacer el pan.       

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Yolanda is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling bread.  Yolanda has a bakery where she bakes different types of bread and sells them in the main square in Oropesa.  She serves from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  Yolanda would like to expand her bakery business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies such as flour, butter and sugar for making bread.

Yolanda is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as flour, butter and sugar, for making bread

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de pan, ella tiene una panificadora donde vende diferentes tipos de pan, la socia también vende panes en la plaza de armas de oropesa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Rosario is 62 years old, married, and has 7 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling bread.  She has a bakery where she sells different types of bread.  She also sells bread in the main square in Oropesa.  She would like to expand and improve her bread-selling business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Rosario is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 38 años, es madre soltera, y vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de su hijo, madre y  hermana; con quienes se esfuerza por salir adelante.Desde hace 8 años, se dedica  a la elaboración de  trabajos didácticos, en un  ambiente de su casa, pues es un lugar con mucha iluminación. Trabaja con la ayuda de su madre, quien es la encargada de resaltar las líneas de los dibujos con  plumón grueso; una vez que  ella ha dibujado con el apoyo de sus plantillas. Pero lo que si le gusta mucho, es armar las siluetas didácticas y cuanto más grandes son  sus trabajos; mejores ganancias obtiene de las ventas. En la actualidad con los años de experiencia; ya tiene convenios con profesoras de los colegios  particulares, y son quienes le generan mayores demandas. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un taller apropiado, para la elaboración de sus trabajos y también donde pueda atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y  se ha comprometido en  pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere  acceder posteriores ayudas para continuar progresando.Mary tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita como pegamentos, cartulinas, corruspum, pinceles y plumones, que necesita para continuar en su negocio sin problemas.
texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in her parents' home with her child, mother and sister.  She works hard every day to get ahead in life.

For 8 years, Mary has worked making educational materials in an area of her home that has a lot of light.  She works with her mother's help.  Her mother is in charge of highlighting the lines of the drawings with a thick felt-tip pen once Mary has drawn them with the support of her staff.  What Mary likes a lot is making the educational shapes and the bigger her works are the more profits she makes when she sells them.

Mary has years of experience in this work and already has contracts with teachers in private schools.  These teachers are her biggest customers.  In the future, Mary is planning to set up a proper workshop where she can make her products and also where she can more comfortably serve her customers.

This is Mary's 13th loan with MFP and she has pledged to make her repayments on time as she would like to be able to access further loans so that she can continue making progress.  Mary plans to invest her money in buying materials that she needs such as adhesive, card, corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic), paintbrushes and pens that she needs to continue running her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luzmila; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de pan, ella es propietaria de una panificadora y vende  diferentes clases de panes, uno de los panes se llama pan chuta que es un nombre típico del distrito de Oropesa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, manteca y azúcar.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Luzmila is 55 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling bread.  She owns her own bakery and sells different types of bread.  One of the breads she makes is called 'pan chuta' which is a traditional name in Oropesa district.  Luzmila would like to expand and improve her bread-selling business.  She is requesting this loan to buy flour, butter and sugar.

Luzmila is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and sugar

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clara; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta de pan, ella es propietaria de un horno donde prepara diferentes tipos de pan y después lo vende en la plaza de armas desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, manteca y azúcar para hacer pan.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Virgen Asunta de Oropesa" community bank. The bank is in the district of Oropesa, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Clara. She is 51, married and has 3 children. She shares her daily activities with a bread sales business. She owns an oven where she makes different kinds of bread, and then sells it in the Plaza de Armas from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to expand her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase flour, butter and sugar to bake bread. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to purchase flour, butter and sugar for baking bread.

loans.name: Sanyu Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Hard work and determination have been 47-year-old Joseph M.'s stock in trade as he oversees and operates his pharmacy business in Kirinya-Mukono. This business has been in existence for the last eight years. Joseph, a married man with six kids, says he began his pharmacy business after finishing medical school. Weekly this business generates him about $26. Joseph, who belongs to the Sanyu development group, says he is going to use this loan to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to resell

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes mariées qui vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Timbabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage, elles font le commerce de bétail, de condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des chèvres, des moutons, des condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                    
NAH BAH C. compte s’approvisionner en bétail avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et pendant les jours de foires, au marché de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are married women who live in traditional families with their husbands and children. They average 33 years of age and two children each. They live in the village of Timbabougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They sell cattle, condiments and tubers.

This is the first group loan for the members of Badenya. They will use it to buy goats, sheep, condiments and tubers.

NAH BAH C. plans to purchase livestock from local breeders. She  carries out her sales locally, and also at the Dioïla market on fair days, for cash and credit to a clientele of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and pay for healthcare, food, and tuition, the remainder to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Hortencia Simona

texts.es: La Sra. Hortencia es una cliente que recién esta trabajando con emprender en el poco tiempo que trabaja con nosotros demostró ser una cliente puntual y responsable en sus pagos, la Sra.  Hortencia vive en la casa de sus padres, tienen dos hijos pequeños una de diez años y un pequeño de año y medio, trabaja en las casas de la zona cocinando y lavando ropa es así como ayuda  en el mantenimiento de  la casa, Su esposo el Sr. Ricardo  es transportista desde hace dos años don Ricardo también trabaja además como ayudante de construcción con su primo,  La Sra. Hortencia y el Sr. Ricardo trabajan desde la mañana y están incursionando en la venta de poleras en Copacabana, el crédito que están solicitando es para realizar el mantenimiento de la movilidad y compra de llantas ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un mejor trabajo, son una pareja muy unida y muy trabajadora y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a new client of Emprender.  During the short time that she has been working with us, she has shown herself to be a client who is punctual and responsible in making her loan repayments.

Hortencia lives in her parents' home.  She has two young children: a 10 year old and an 18 month old.  She works in local houses cooking and washing clothes.  This is how she helps support her household.  Her husband, Ricardo, has been a driver for two years.  He also works as an assistant builder with his cousin.

Hortencia and Ricardo work from early in the morning and they are starting to break into the market selling t-shirts in Copacabana.  The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance work on her husband's vehicle and to buy spare tires since the vehicle has some mechanical problems which prevents him from doing a better job.  Hortencia and Ricardo are a very close couple and very hard working.  They are grateful to the institution for the support that they have been offered.

loans.use: To buy new tires and to pay for maintenance work on her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de venta y preparación de pan, ella prepara diferentes tipos de pan y luego lo vende en la plaza de armas de Oropesa, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el pan.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department

Alejandra is 54 years old, widowed, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She makes different types of bread which she sells in the main square in Oropesa.  She would like to expand and improve her bread-selling business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Alejandra is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de 8 femmes toutes mariées qui vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Timbabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, des céréales et de volailles.                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                                    
MAGNINI C., qui est un ses membres du groupe,  s’approvisionne en volailles avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village et pendant les jours de foires au marché de Dioïla,  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 8 women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families in the village of Timbabougou, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 42, an average of 4 children and all know each other through family and neighbourhood ties. Their business is in cattle, cereals and poultry.
The women of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso.
Magnini C., one of the group members, sources her poultry from farmers in the village and the surrounding areas. She makes her sales in the village and, on fair days at the market in Dioïla, she sells for cash and credit to customers made up of retailers and consumers.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 25,000 XOF, which she will use to repay the loan, to cover healthcare and school expenses and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su joven hijo Carlos y juntos  luchan por salir adelante.Desde muy niña ayudaba a su madre a vender comidas, y  lo continuo realizando hasta hace algunos años; pero dejo el negocio debido a que el alquiler del local era muy costoso. Desde hace 4 años cambio de rubro, y en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de polos para damas, y lo realiza en sociedad  con su amiga, en un puesto ubicado dentro de un mercado muy concurrido. Y de vez en cuando sale a comprar mercadería y deja su puesto con su socia y de esta manera no tienen perdida. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que el mercado es muy concurrido y las ventas son muy rápidas, y tiene buenas ganancias. En el futuro tiene planeado ampliar  su negocio e instalar una tienda de venta de prendas de vestir; pues  en este rubro no tiene perdida.Es el 24avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, para acceder a posteriores créditos pues quiere continuar progresando.Carmen tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  polos ligeros, para la estación de verano, y de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old.  She lives in her own home with her young son Carlos.  Together they work hard to get ahead in life.

Since she was a little girl, Carmen helped her mother sell meals and she continued in this line of work until a few years ago.  She left the business because the premises she was renting were very expensive.  Four years ago she changed her business and she currently sells women's tops, together with a friend, from a stall located in a very busy market.

From time to time Carmen goes out to buy merchandise and leaves her stall with her business partner.  In this way, they don't lose any sales.  What Carmen most likes about her business is that the market is very busy and she makes a lot of sales and good profits.  In the future, she is planning to expand her business and set up a store where she can sell clothes.

This is Carmen's 24th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time so that she can access further loans in order to continue making progress.  Carmen plans to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of light tops for the summer season and, in this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy tops to improve her business

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eliana; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de crianza de cerdo, ella cría pequeños cerdos y luego los hace engordar y crecer y los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Oropesa, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de crianza de cerdos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los cerdos.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eliana is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Eliana is 32 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business raising pigs.  She raises young pigs, fattens them and then sells them in the different markets in Oropesa district.  Through this business she gets her children ahead in life.  Eliana would like to expand her pig business.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her pigs.

Eliana is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yiriwa sont des femmes mariées, elles vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans le village de Timbabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage, elles font le commerce de bétails, volailles, des céréales, des savons, des habillements et des articles divers.                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, du savon, des bétails, volaille, des céréales, des habillements et des articles divers.                                                                                    
SITAN C. s’approvisionne en  draps de lit avec les grossistes de Dioïla. Elle effectue sa vente sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the Yiriwa group are all married, and live with a husband and children in traditional families. With an average age of 41 and an average of 6 children each, they all live in the village of Timbabougou, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali). 

Having met through family and neighborhood connections, the women sell cattle, poultry, cereals, soap, clothes and miscellaneous articles. This is their first group loan, and it will be used to buy these items. 

Group member Sitan C. obtains sheets from wholesalers in Dioïla. She sells locally in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay back the loan, to meet healthcare- and school-related expenses, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy sheets

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Simeona; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, la socia vende en la ciudad de Cusco, ella prepara en el distrito de Oropesa los panes porque es propietaria de una panificadora, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Simeona is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Simeona is 49 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She sells her products in the city of Cusco and makes them in Oropesa district because she owns her own bakery.  Simeona would like to improve and expand her bread-selling business and is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Simeona is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de huit femmes toutes mariées,ayant en moyenne 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de condiments et de galettes.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso                                                                 
MAMOU T. s’approvisionne en condiments auprès des grossistes presque hebdomadairement au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi is the name of a group which is made up of 8 married women who are 38 years old on average. They each have 5 children and live in traditional families in the village of  Djekenobougou, a prefecture of Dioila in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region  of the Republic of Mali). 

They have businesses where they sell various merchandise, condiments, and cookies. 

The women of the Benkadi group request their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). 

Mamou T. acquires her condiments from wholesalers on a weekly basis in the market in Dioila.  She carries out her sales from her home and she completes them in cash or credit. Her clientele is mostly women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 30 000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover health care expenses, and the remainder will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase condiments for resale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María es una pequeña  comerciante  venta de frutas y verduras que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución tiene quince años de haber establecido su negocio, iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería, hoy en día con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus productos.
También los fines de semana hace ricas sopas el cual vende en su casa de habitación. Con este nuevo crédito comprara verduras y un caballo que ayude al acarreo de las compras como de las ventas ambulantes que falta le hace.
 Este sería su segundo caballo el que ayude a facilitar el acarreo de las compra de frutas y verduras espera comprar más cantidad para comprar a un precio accesible ya que están caras y el cliente compra menos lo que espera mejorar para captar nuevamente su clientela.
texts.en:
María is a small businesswoman who sells fruit and vegetables.  Her business has grown thanks to her tenacity and the support of AFODENIC.  She has been in her business for fifteen years.  She started out buying small amounts of merchandise.  Now, with the help of AFODENIC, her sales levels have increased and she offers a greater variety of products.  On weekends, María also makes rich soups which she sells from her home.  

María will use this loan to buy vegetables and a horse which will help her carry her purchases and the products that she sells as an itinerant street vendor.  This will be her second horse to help her carry her fruit and vegetables.  She hopes to buy a larger quantity of products so that she can buy at an affordable price since they are expensive and she can't buy much.  She hopes to improve this situation so that she can re-attract customers.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables as well as a horse which will help her carry her purchases and the products she sells

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Es grupo D. 8 personas que se conocen muy bien por que un 70% del grupo se dedica a la venta calzados, es por eso que son muy unidas se ven todos los días; el único varón del grupo se dedica a la venta D. celulares.	
La presidenta es la Sra. Manami vive en casa propia por la urbanización los olivos, vive junto a su  su esposo y sus 3 hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar, la señora es muy buena líder por este motivo la eligieron como presidenta, también por su solidaridad y responsabilidad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. calzados D. una prestigiosa empresa ,  también venD. ropa y joyas D. plata D. forma ambulante por toda la ciudad D. Cochabamba, visitando oficinas privadas y publicas, con el dinero del crédito comprara zapatos en cantidad para un pedido que tiene que entregar, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
This is a group with 8 members who know each other very well because 70% of the group sell footwear.  They are a very united group because they see each other every day.  The only man in the group works selling cell phones.

The group's president is Manami who lives in her own home in the Los Olivos housing development.  She lives with her husband and three school-age daughters.  Manami is a very good leader which is why she was elected as the group's president.  She is also very supportive and responsible.  Her business is buying and selling footwear maD. by a prestigious company.  She also sells clothes and silver jewelry as an itinerant street vendor throughout the city of Cochabamba, visiting private and public offices.  She will use her loan money to buy a quantity of shoes for an order that she has.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy shoes by the dozen

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnankouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, des poissons, d’articles divers, de condiments et des tubercules                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt.                                                                
SITAN T. s’approvisionne en poissons auprès des pécheurs du village presque quotidiennement. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F  CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are married and are 42 years of age on average. They each have 4 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Gnankouma, in the prefecture of Dioila. It is located in the region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They are known through family and as neighbors. They sell livestock, fish, assorted merchandise, condiments, and tubers. 

The women members of the Benkadi group request their first loan. 

Sitan T. acquires fish from the fishermen in the village every day. She makes her sales from her home and completes them in cash and on credit. Her clientele is made up of women and men. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 20000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover health care expenses, and to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, con  los que trabaja arduamente para salir adelante.Desde hace varios años, está laboriosa mujer se dedicaba a las costura, y motivada por sus hijos en la actualidad confecciona  billeteras, que realiza en su casa con la ayuda de ellos. Es un negocio muy exitoso,  además ya cuenta con herramientas que facilitan el trabajo, y puede proporcionar un buen acabado a las billeteras. Además  obtiene buenas ganancias de las ventas, pues sus  trabajos son tan impecables y de buen acabado, que son distribuidos en los diversos mercados de la ciudad, y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado terminar de construir su casa, y de esa manera espera instalar  un taller apropiado en donde reciba a sus clientes.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito que necesita le será muy beneficioso  para continuar ampliando su negocio,  por ello se compromete en pagar a tiempo sus cuotas.Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ventanas con sus respectivos marcos, pues de esa manera espera brindar mayor iluminación a su taller de confecciones, y así quiere continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and four children with whom she works hard to get ahead in life.

This hard-working woman has been in the sewing business for several years.  Motivated by her children, she currently makes wallets in her home with her children's help.  This is a very successful business.  Alicia also has tools which make her work easier and she is able to finish off the wallets well. She makes good profits on her sales because her products are impeccable and well finished.  They are distributed to several markets in the city.  As Alicia is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to finish building her home and she hopes to install a suitable workshop where she can receive her customers.

This is Alicia's 13th loan from MFP and she knows that the loan she needs will be very helpful to her in continuing to expand her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  Alicia plans to invest her money in buying windows and window frames so that she can provide her sewing workshop with better light.  In this way, she hopes to continue getting ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy windows to improve her workshop

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hermelinda; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, la socia tiene una panificadora donde vende pasteles y panes, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan como harina, mantecas y azúcar al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hermelinda belongs to the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Hermelinda is 32 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She owns her own bakery where she sells cakes and bread.  She works from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  She would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale.

Hermelinda is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 22 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnankouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce d’articles de boutique, de condiments et des céréales.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                             
MARIAM C. s’approvisionne en céréales avec les producteurs du village et les revendeurs pendant les jours de foires au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F  CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Benkola are all married and on average they are 22 years old.  They each have 2 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Gnankouma, in the prefecture of Dioila. It is locate din the Region of Koulikoro, the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and as neighbors. They sell grocery store products, condiments, and cereal grains. 

The women of the Benkola group have requested their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). 

Mariam C. acquires her cereal grains from the producers in the village and from the retailers during the fairs in the market tin Dioila. She carries out her sales from her home, completing the sales in cash and credit. Her clientele is made up of both women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 50 000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to  cover health care expenses, to pay for schooling expenses, and to reinvest back into the  business.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Dalmecio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Dalmecio; el tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de panes, el socio tiene una panificadora que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de panes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar el pan.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Dalmecio is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department

Dalmecio is 55 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling bread.  He owns his own bakery where he works from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  He would like to improve and expand his business and is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Dalmecio is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Isolda Graciela

texts.es:
Isolda es una pequeña comerciante, madre de tres hijos, dedicada al negocio para el apoyo familiar. 
Su negocio es un cyber en donde ofreces servicios de internet, llamadas nacionales e internacionales a un precio accesible.
Atraves de los préstamos ha logrado mejores equipos para un mejor servicio al cliente con compra de más equipo de computadora y sus accesorios, siendo ocho ciclos que ha venido trabajando para un mejor funcionamiento. 
Ahora con este nuevo préstamo hará un anexo  a su cuarto, en donde estará en mejores condiciones de espacio, para esto comprara materiales de construcción: piedra, arena, bloques, hierro, cemento, madera, láminas de zinc, perlines entre otros para comenzar la obra. Siendo Afodenic quien ha proporcionado estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Isolda is a small businesswoman and the mother of three children.  She carries out her business to support her family.

Isolda's business is an Internet café where she offers Internet services, national and international calls at an affordable price.  Through her loans, she has managed to acquire better equipment with which she can provide her customers with a better service.  She has bought more computers and accessories and has been working with Afodenic for eight loan cycles.

Isolda will use this loan to build an extension on one of her rooms which will give her more space.  She will buy building supplies such as: stone, sand, blocks, iron, cement, wood, sheets of corrugated metal and beams, etc. so that she can begin the work.  It is Afodenic who have provided these improvements.

loans.use: To buy building supplies to build an extension on one of her rooms so that she is more comfortable

loans.name: Laîdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Djekonobougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers, de condiments alimentaires et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                 
SATA D.  compte s’approvisionne en articles divers de boutique (thé, chewing-gum, biscuits, cigarettes, lait en poudre, sucre, etc.) auprès des grossistes presque hebdomadairement au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Laidou are married and they are 28 years old on average. They each have 2 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Djekonobougou, a prefecture of Dioila, located in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They sell various merchandise, condiments, and peanuts. 

The women of the Laidou group have requested their first loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). 

Sata D. acquires her general store products (tea, chewing gum, cookies, cigarettes, powdered milk, sugar, etc.) from the wholesalers on a weekly basis in the market in Dioila. She sells the products from her home, completing the sale in both cash and credit. Her clientele is made up of both women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 25000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase general store merchandise.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnankouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, de condiments, de poissons et d’articles divers                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Yeredeme sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU C. s’approvisionne en bétail avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et au marché de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Yeredeme are all married and on average they are 43 years old. They each have 4 children and they live in large traditional families in the village of Gnankouma, a prefecture of Dioila within the Region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and as neighbors. They sell livestock, condiments, fish, and assorted merchandise. 

The women of the group Yeredeme have requested their first loan. 

Kadiatou C. acquires cattle from the farmers in the village and surrounding areas. She sells from her home and in the market in Dioila. She completes her sales in cash and credit, to a clientele made up of both women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 20000FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to cover health care expenses, to purchase food, and to pay for schooling fees. The remaining portion will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Nestor Cecilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nestor Cecilio; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de radio, el tiene una emisora de radio en el distrito de Oropesa donde narra las diferentes noticias que pasa en el distrito de Oropesa y también en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar la emisora de radio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar la cabina de radio como comprar mesas y radio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nestor Cecilio is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Nestor Cecilio is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his radio business.  He has a radio station in Oropesa district where he reads the news from Oropesa district and the city of Cusco.  He would like to improve and expand his radio station.  He is requesting this loan to set up a radio booth and to buy tables and radio.

Nestor is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To set up a radio booth and to buy tables and radio

loans.name: Siguitemasson Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguitemasson, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnankouma, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de bétail, de condiments, de poissons et d’articles divers                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Siguitemasson sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du bétail, des condiments, des poissons et d’articles divers.                                                                 
AMINATA D. s’approvisionne en condiments auprès des grossistes presque hebdomadairement au marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F  CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Siguitemasson Group are all married. On average, they are 39 years old and have four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Gnankouma, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood.

They sell cattle, food condiments, fish and various articles. This is the first solidarity loan for the women of Siguitemasson Group. They will use it to buy cattle, condiments, fish and various articles.

Aminata D. gets her supplies of condiments nearly every week from the wholesalers at the market in Dioïla. She retails the condiments at the same market, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

She expects to make an average profit of 30,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay the installments of the loan as well as health services, food and school fees. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Maïmouna Bah

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna Bah D. est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mère d’une fille et elle vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux dans le quartier Millionking de la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Madame Maïmouna Bah D. est titulaire d’un C.A.P. (Certificat d’Aptitude Professionnel) et dans le souci de s’intégrer dans le tissus économique et subvenir à ses besoins, décida de s’initier au commerce notamment à l’achat vente des produits d’alimentation. Avec des années d’expérience, elle est très sollicitée et appréciée à Fana. Elle vient de commencer avec l’institution et est à son premier individuel.
Elle se propose de payer avec ce prêt: des paquets de biscuits, des sacs de sucre, des cartons de l’eau potable, des confitures et des casiers de boissons sucrerie à Bamako. Elle revend, en détail, au comptant dans sa boutique sise aux abords de l’artère principale qui relie Bamako à Ségou et qui d’un accès très facile, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs Maïmouna Bah Diarro is 27 years old and the mother of a daughter. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the neighborhood of Millionking in the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro in the Republic of Mali. Mrs Maïmouna Bah Diarro holds a degree of a vocational training school. Her wish to become integrated into the economic life and provide for her needs led her to learn trade skills, in particular running a grocery store. After several years of experience her business is in high demand and appreciated in Fana. She recently joined our institution and this is her first individual loan.

She intends to use her loan to buy packages of cookies, sacks of sugar, boxes of drinking water, jam and racks of sweetened drinks in Bamako. She retails the goods for cash in her easily accessible store located on the main road from Bamako to Ségou to a clientele made up of women and men.

She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay the installments of the loan as well as health services, food and school fees. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Yanet; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, ella es propietaria de una panificadora y prepara diferentes tipos de pan, la socia vende en la plaza de armas de Oropesa, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Yanet is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She owns her own bakery and makes different types of bread which she sells in the main square in Oropesa.  She works from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  Yanet would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Yanet is pleased to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía D. su esposo y sus siete jóvenes hijos.Norma teje chompas, buzos, chalecos D. lana y todas sus producciones las realiza  con su máquina D. tejer, en el sótano D. su casa. Las prendas que elabora son muy solicitadas para la temporada D. invierno, y  las comercializa  en los diversos mercados D. su zona. Ella tiene varios clientes que son los comerciantes ambulantes, que saben D. la calidad D. sus trabajos y no dudan en realizarle cantidad D. pedidos con frecuencia. Es por esta razón que a pesar D. ingresar a la temporada D. verano continua tejiendo chompas, para hacerse D. un stock para la abastecerse durante la temporada D. invierno ya que  tiene bastante demanda. D. esta manera trabaja 12 años y le gusta mucho su labor, pero piensa que su labor pueD. ser más  rentable todos los meses; si es que tejiera polos D. hilos, y para ello en adelante piensa comprar una máquina para realizar estos trabajos sin problemas.Es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos: en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable  y preocupado por el bienestar D. su grupo.Norma tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. lanas, al por mayor, para continuar realizando sus tejidos, y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and seven young children.

Norma's business is knitting sweaters, sleeveless sweaters and tops from yarn.  She makes all of her garments with a knitting machine, in her basement.  The clothes she makes are very much in demand during the winter season and she sells them in different markets in her area.  She has several customers who are itinerant street vendors who know the quality of her work and don't hesitate to make a lot of frequent orders.  For this reason, in spite of the fact that the summer season is starting, she will continue knitting sweaters so that she can build up a stock which she can sell during the winter season since she has a quite a lot of demand then.

Norma has been in this business for 12 years and she likes her work a lot.  However, she believes that her work could be more profitable year round if she were to knit polo shirts with thread.  For this reason, in the future she plans to buy a machine to make these clothes without problems.

This is Norma's 13th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time as she would like to take new loans in the future.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank who cares for the well-being of her group.  Norma plans to invest this loan in buying yarn wholesale, to continue knitting her garments and to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy yarn for her business

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Aura es una mujer de edad ya avanzada de 59 años de edad, con una familia de nueve hijos, ya mayores y casados.
Su oficio que ejerce desde joven es la costura, el cual aprendió y ha sido su medio para cubrir los gastos básicos y personales. En donde a través de los años ah adquirido  experiencia y clientela.
Con este nuevo crédito será para la terminacion de un cuarto, en donde comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, perlines, laminas de zinc, golosos entre otros.Todo estas mejoras lo ha logrado a traves de los  financiamiento, siendo cinco ciclos trabajando con  Afodenic
texts.en:
Aura is a 59 year-old woman.  She has nine children who are all now grown up and married.  Aura has been in the sewing business since she was young and learned how to sew.  Through this business she has managed to cover her basic and personal expenses.  Over the years she has gained experience and customers.

Aura will use this new loan to finish building a room.  She will buy building supplies such as: cement, sand, beams, metal sheets, bolts, etc.  She has achieved all these improvements through loans.  She has been through five loan cycles with Afodenic.

loans.use: To finish building a room that is nearly completed

loans.name: Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento Rosa D. Guadalupe es la Sra. Vilma, casada tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, realiza el servicio D.  lavado D. autos , junto a su esposo, viven en la zona D. Huayllani  en anticrético, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. un motor para el lavado D. autos, para que así le sea mas fácil el lavado D. autos, y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por vecinas D. la zona  que viven hace varios años en la misma zona, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan D. lunes a viernes, se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación D. 2 varones D. igual manera son muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad .es un banco muy organizado dinámicos muy solidario.
texts.en:
The president of the Rosa D. Guadalupe Enterprising Bank is Vilma, who is married with 3 school-aged children.  She has a car wash, and together with her husband, lives in the Huayllani zone in a rental house.  Money from this loan will be used to purchase a motor for washing cars, making the job easier and offering better service to their customers.

The Bank is composed of neighbors who have lived for various years in the same zone.  Each of them has an independent work activity, working from Monday to Friday. They know each other very well. Among the group are 2 men who also are well known in their respective activities. The bank is very organized and dynamic, with much solidarity.

loans.use: TO BUY A MOTOR FOR A CAR WASH

loans.name: Abesiga Mukama Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 39 year old B. Harriet pleads a cause with Abesiga Mukama Development group-Mukono. Self interest and a belief in her own worth is what pushed her on the road to owning and running her current fruits and vegetable sells business in Namuyenje-Mukono. The business which has on many occasions called for hard work, time, devotion and constant planning has been in existence for the past 6 years. The fruits and vegetables she sells are particularly in high favor with many students and kids around her operating area. B. who is happily married with two kids says savings from her teaching job were very helpful in getting her business off its feet. Weekly this business generates her shillings 80,000.  With this loan, Harriet says she is going to buy more vegetables, jack fruits, oranges and passion fruits to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more vegetables, jack fruit, oranges and passion fruits to resell

loans.name: Juntas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: Es grupo D. personas muy trabajadoras viven en la zona D. Oroncota, la representante  es la Sra. María tiene su tienda D. barrio, es casada,  el préstamo lo utilizara en la compra D. mercadería, como ser refrescos, galletas, abarrotes, dulces, helados, aceite, etc. para surtir su tienda y así incrementar capital D. trabajo, es una persona muy responsable y dinámica, todas las personas del grupo son muy trabajadoras con actividad propia y el préstamo les ayudara a obtener mas ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en: This group of very hard-working people live in Oroncota neighborhood.  The group's representative is María who is married and owns a neighborhood store.   She will use her loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, cookies, groceries, candy, ice cream, oil, etc. to stock her store and thereby increase her working capital.  She is a very responsible and dynamic person.  All the members of this group are very hard working and have their own business activity.  The loan will help them to make more profits and to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Aleyda

texts.es:
Desde hace 17 meses Maria Aleyda y a sus 34 años, deleita con sus comidas rápidas a los habitantes del Municipio de Caldas, en la Vereda la Clara. Espacio  muy reconocido porque es cerca de la Reserva Ecológica Alto de San Miguel o más conocido como el nacimiento del Rio Medellín. “por acá viene mucho turista y debo ampliar mi negocio para así salir adelante con mis tres hijos”, según palabras de Maria Aleyda.

“Mi meta con el negocio es ponerlo bonito, y así vender más para poder brindarle estudio a mis tres hijos, el cual no tienen por el momento” puntualiza Maria. 

La idea de Maria Aleyda con el crédito adquirido es comprar surtido para esta época de vacaciones y hacer unas adecuaciones al kiosco y así empezar muy bien el año.
texts.en:
Maria Aleyda is 34 years old.  For 17 months she has been delighting the residents of Vereda la Clara, in the town of Caldas, with her delicious fast food.  Her business is very well known because it is near the Alto de San Miguel nature reserve which is better known as the source of the River Medellín "lots of tourists come here and I must expand my business so that I can get myself and my three children ahead in life" says Maria Aleyda.

"My goal for the business is to make it look nice so that I can sell more and thereby provide my three children with an education that they don't have right now", María states.

María Aleyda plans to use her loan to stock her business for the holiday period and to do some remodelling work on her kiosk so that she can start the new year well.

loans.use: To stock her business and expand her premises

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise (sneakers)

loans.name: Katia Diana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Katia Diana; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de tienda de multiservicios, ella realiza fotocopias, tipeos y vende útiles de escritorio, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio ahorra para que pueda estudiar alguna carrera profesional, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de multiservicios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  papel y útiles de escritorio al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Katia Diana is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Katia Diana is 25 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business which is running a store offering multiple services.  She makes photocopies, types documents and sells stationery products.   She works from 9.00am to 6.00pm.  Through her business she is able to save so that she can study for a professional degree.  She would like to expand and improve her business.

Katia Diana is requesting this loan to buy paper and stationery products wholesale.   She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy paper and stationery products wholesale.

loans.name: Ynocencia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ynocencia; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de armas del distrito de Oropesa, la socia prepara diferentes tipos de pan, ella atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  insumos para preparar el pan como harina, mantequilla, manteca y azúcar al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ynocencia is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Ynocencia is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She sells her bread as an itinerant street vendor in the main square in Oropesa.  She makes different types of bread and works from 5.00am to 7.00pm.  Ynocencia would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread, such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale.

Ynocencia is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread, such as flour, butter and sugar, wholesale

loans.name: Djekafo (Ayons Le Même Langage) Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et co-épouses. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Les membres du groupe Djekafo font l’achat et la vente de produits alimentaires et la vente des  condiments de toutes sortes. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, elles ont leur premier prêt de groupe.
 Chata Koné  qui est un des membres  de ce groupe fait la restauration  dans une gargote aménagée devant sa concession qui fait face au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend du riz sous toutes ses formes : gras ou avec sauces du poulet rôti, de la soupe de poissons etc. Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments et  d’ingrédients pour la restauration, au fur et à mesure. Elle ses mets  dans sa gargote au  grand marché de Koutiala, au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée.
