Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Chata Koné,  compte réaliser 70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’agrandir d’avantages  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Djekafo Group ("let's speak with the same voice") is a group of women living all in the first neighborhood of Koutiala in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and cowives. On average they are 40 years old, they are married and have each at least three children.

The members of Djekafo Group trade with grocery products and all kinds of food condiments. To expand their businesses the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Chata Koné, one of the members, works in catering. Her business is located in a refurbished food stall facing the great market of Koutiala. She sells of kinds of rice (with fat or sauce), roast chicken, fish soup, etc. Her products are in high demand due to the excellent location of her stall. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments and ingredients for her dishes as soon as she needs them. She sells her dishes in her food stall at the great market of Koutiala for cash to a diversified clientele.

While the other members of Djekafo Group each expect to make an average profit of 65,000 CFA francs throughout the loan cycle, Chata Koné expects to earn 70,000 CFA francs. They will use their income to pay the installments of the loan and for the daily household expenses.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to further expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Badenya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent ensemble dans le village de Cinzana Gare chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles  se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et font le petit commerce de tubercules (pomme de terre, patate et igname), de condiments alimentaires (poudres de gombo et de baobab) et de céréales (riz et mil). 
Dans le  souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire. Tous les trois prêt précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame Nènè  Konaté est une vendeuse de céréales à Cinzana Gare, en l’occurrence  le riz étuvé. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 6 sacs de riz paddy dans les villages environnants. 
Elle débarrasse  le paddy de ses impuretés par le vannage, le fait tremper dans l’eau pendant une journée au moins, l’étuve au feu, l’étale au soleil pour le sécher et le décortiquer ensuite, pour avoir les grains destinés à la vente.  
La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché de Cinzana Gare à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Nènè  Konaté espère réaliser avec ce prêt, un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins de condiments du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women of the Badenya group are married, most of them in monogamous families. They are all around 37 and have about 4 kids each. They live together in the village of Cinzana Gare, chief town of a rural region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali).
They met each other through family or extended family, and are in the business of tubers (potato, sweet potato, and yam), condiments (okra and baobab powders) and cereals (rice and millet).
In order to increase their business, the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution from which they are borrowing for the 4th time. They successfully repaid all three previous loans.
Mrs. Nènè Konaté sells cereals in Cinzana Gare; parboiled rice, to be specific.
She plans on buying 6 bags of paddy rice in the surrounding villages.
To get the grain that will be sold, paddy rice is winnowed to remove impurities, dipped in water for at least a day, steamed, spread to dry in the sun, and husked.
They sell the rice to a mixed clientele, in cash or on credit, directly in their houses as well as at the Cinzana Gare market.
With this loan, Mrs. Nènè Konaté hopes to reach an average monthly profit of 35 000 FCFA which will be reinvested in the business and used to meet her family's need for condiments.

loans.use: Buying rice

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: La señora Amelia tiene 20 años y vive en la zona M, ella convive y tiene una hija D. tres años, es nueva en el grupo “Señor D. Muruhuay” la cual está conformado D. 10 amigas vecinas que pusieron el nombre al grupo debido a la devoción que tienen por esta virgen. Amelia venD. miel desD. hace 4 meses para ayudar a mantener su hogar y ah logrado poner una pequeña tienda D. miel, con el ultimo prestamos desea invertir y expandir su negocio y junto a su pareja, que es chofer D. transporte público, poder sacar adelante su hogar y para esto necesita las habilitaciones D. Edaprospo así como trabajar arduamente.
texts.en:
Amelia is 20 years old and lives in M. neighborhood.  She lives with her partner and her 3 year-old daughter.  She is a new member of the “Señor D. Muruhuay” group.  This group has 10 members who are all friends and neighbors.  They gave their group this name because of the devotion that they have for this virgin.

Amelia has been selling honey for four months to help support her household and she has managed to set up a small store selling honey.  With this loan she would like to invest in her business and expand it and, together with her husband who is a public transport driver, get her household ahead.  To achieve this she needs loans from Edaprospo and to work hard.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Gema Mylu

texts.es:
Gema es una joven de 26 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijo, hoy en día trabaja como recepcionista, y venta de cosméticos en donde lleva cuatro años en este negocio, aprovechando su medio de trabajo para sus  ventas en donde vende por catálogos productos Avon,  a si como productos variados para ofertar, ya que son accesibles, y de buena calidad.
Iniciando con pocos productos, y aumentando su inventario atreves de Afodenic.
Con este nuevo préstamo será invertido en productos de cosmético para aumentar los niveles de venta, y lograr a poyar a su familia, ya que todo está ah altos costos y tiene que cubrir alimentación, medicina, vestimenta el cual se esfuerza y esmera por amor a su familia.
texts.en:
Gema is a young woman of 26.  She is married and has three children.  She currently works as a receptionist and sells cosmetics.  She has been in this business for four years, taking advantage of her work to make sales with her catalogs.  She sells Avon products and other products which are affordable and good quality.  She started out with only a few products and has increased her inventory with Afodenic's help. 

Gema will invest this new loan in buying cosmetics to increase her sales levels and support her family as everything costs a lot and she has to cover food, medicine and clothing costs.  She works hard and takes great care in doing all this because of her love for her family.

loans.use: To invest in buying ladies' and men's cosmetics so that she can improve her sales and profits

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 49 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus dos menores  hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 12 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica al comercio de artículos de uso médico como jeringas, guantes quirúrgicos, fármacos, entre otros. Sus ventas las realiza personalmente y  ofrece estos productos a hospitales, farmacias, consultorios médicos de la zona. Además vende al por mayor, y su jornada diaria de trabajo la realiza durante todo el día, de lunes a viernes, pues solo  descansa los fines de semana. Como es una mujer de negocios y a la vez debe cumplir con sus labores de madre, no descuida la atención de sus hijos,  es por esta razón que distribuye su horario para pasar tiempo con su familia. Ana manifiesta que  tiene un negocio muy rentable y una buena fuente de ingresos ya que cuenta con los contactos necesarios para sus ventas  por lo que se ha proyectado a futuro ser una gran abastecedora de productos médicos de la zona donde vive.Es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contenta pues tiene el apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Además  agradece  a las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo ya que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Ana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and two dependent children in her own home.

For 12 years, this enterprising woman has been selling medical supplies such as syringes, surgical gloves, medicines, etc.  She makes her sales personally and offers her products for sale to hospitals, pharmacies and local medical practices.  She also sells wholesale.  Ana works all day long, from Monday to Friday.  She only rests on weekends.

Ana is a businesswoman who also has motherly duties to fulfil and she makes sure she does not neglect her children.  This is why she distributes her hours so that she can spend time with her family.  Ana says that she has a very profitable business and a good source of income since she has the contacts she needs to make her sales.  In the future, she plans to be a big supplier of medical products in her area.

This is Ana's eighth loan with MFP and she is very happy to have financial support.  She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments.  She enjoys being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She would like to thank the people who made this loan possible as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Ana plans to invest her money in acquiring a larger quantity of merchandise as she has several pending orders to fill.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Pinina Armandina

texts.es: Pinina es una señora muy alegre, trabajadora es positiva y emprendedora. Ella a sus 34 años de edad está logrando sus objetivos poco a poco. Tiene una pequeña bodeguita en su casa desde hace 10 años, con los ingresos de este pequeño negocio logró mejorar el ambiente de su bodega, parte de estos ingresos lo utiliza para pagar los gastos de la casa  y la educación de sus dos hijos quienes aún son menores de edad. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar más mercadería (arroz, azúcar, leche, pollo, verduras) para su bodega. A Pinina le gustaría comprarse una combi para transporte público y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pinina is a very cheerful, hard-working, positive and enterprising lady.  She is 34 years old and is gradually achieving her goals in life.

Pinina has a small grocery store in her home which she has had for 10 years.  She has used the profits from this small business to improve the store's environment.  She uses part of her profits to cover her household expenses and to pay for the education of her two children who are still dependent on her.

Pinina requested this loan from EDAPROSPO to buy more merchandise (rice, sugar, milk, chicken, vegetables) for her store.  She would like to buy a van for providing public transport and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, chicken and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es la presidenta del grupo “Mujeres Forjadoras” desde hace 6 meses, el grupo está conformado por 9 vecinas que llevan trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año. Rosa a sus 50 años, conviviendo y con 4 hijos, se dedica a vender polos desde hace medio año, además de hacer servicios para gamarra desde hace 1 año y ah logrado apoyar los estudios de sus hijos hasta el momento, indica que de tener un buen capital pondría su propio Stand comercial en gamarra, pero para llegar a lograr esta meta sabe que deberá trabajar duro y recibir la ayuda de Edaprospo con sus habilitaciones.

Les acompaña la hermana de la Sra. Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been the president of the "Mujeres Forjadoras" group for six months.  This group is made up of 9 neighbors who have been working with Edaprospo for one year.

Rosa is 50 years old.  She lives with her partner and has four children.  For six months she has been selling polo shirts.  She has also been working for the City of Gamarra for one year and has managed to support her children in their studies.  She says that if she had good capital she would set up her own sales stand in Gamarra but in order to achieve this goal she knows that she will have to work hard and receive help in the form of loans from Edaprospo.  The group members are accompanied by Rosa's sister.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de  su esposo y sus dos menores hijas.Desde hace 21 años, comercializa comida y su negocio esta ubicado en la puerta de su casa, en el lugar atiende por las mañanas y  tardes. Su esposo la apoya  en trasladar objetos muy pesados, en las noches empieza con la preparación de sus platillos  y también de los utensilios, que ofrecerá al día siguiente a sus comensales. Recién ha empezado a ofrecer su servicio de bufetes para algunos eventos sociales, y el negocio  tiene bastante salida, pues  su puesto de ventas se ubica en una avenida muy transitada de la ciudad. Por las ventas exitosas de sus diversas comidas, tiene planeado para el futuro mejorar su negocio con  un local de ventas más presentable.Es su octavo crédito con MFP, y  esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero pues siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, además esta muy agradecida con todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le permitirá continuar progresando.Delia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de ingredientes, al por mayor, que necesita para continuar ofreciéndoles los mejores platillos a sus clientes, y así espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Delia is 61 years old; she lives in her own home in the company of her husband and their two young children. For the past 21 years she has been selling prepared foods and she runs her business from the front door of her house. She is open in the mornings and afternoon. Her husband helps her carry heavy objects and in the evenings she prepares the food and utensils for the following day. 

Recently she has started to offer catering services for social events and this new business has had great success. Her stand is located on a busy street in the city. In the future she plans to improve her business by opening a more comfortable restaurant to support the excellent sales of the various foods. 

This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner0 and she is very happy to know she has access to this financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. She is also grateful to her community bank and to all those who have made this loan possible. It will permit her to keep advancing. Delia's plan is to invest the requested loan in the purchase of large quantities of ingredients acquired in wholesale. She needs this to keep up the sale of her best dishes to her clients. This way she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: San Juanito Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Juanito se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlayacapan, en el estado de Morelos, México. está conformado por 7 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son Florida G. Martínez va a comprar con su crédito catálogos y compra de mercancía que ya le pidieron para esta temporada y sus, la señora Rosenda Díaz M. va a comprar tintes de varios colores, marca, maginel, magic color, plancha para el cabello, fijador,  La señora Patricia O. V. va a comprar quemador y tanque de gas, tina para poner a hervir sus elotes y poderlos vender, la señora Alejandra F. Álvarez va a comprar un triciclo, un brasero para vender sus elotes, la señora María Félix Chávez Santamaría a comprar F. rosas, crisantemos, margaritas, herbera, clavo para vender y va a comprar bases, la señora Elizabeth Chávez Santamaría va a comprar bases de cristal, espuma, gladiolas, crisantemo, rosas, Acapulco, lelis, etc., la señora Isabel Santamaría N. va a comprar pintura, leña, refrescos para darle mantenimiento a su negocio. La señora Alejandra F. Álvarez es integrante del grupo, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella vive en unión libre su esposo trabaja en el campo de peón y tiene dos hijos Cándido de 8 años de edad estudia la primaria, Sergio tiene 2 años,  ella tiene su negocio de venta de elotes, esquites, chile atole y tlascales y va a comprar con su préstamo un triciclo para poder vender sus productos, va a comprar un brasero, un tanque de gas y mercancía mayonesa, palos, ella ofrece a sus clientes elotes hervidos, esquites, chile atole y tlascales, la señora Alejandra inicio su negocio hace 8 años ella por iniciativa y porque la motivo su tía que vendía elotes pero dejo de vender su tía le regalo las tinas y el palo que tenia y su mama le presto para compra los elotes y le prestó un brasero, la señora Alejandra ya sabía guisar el chile atole, los esquites y los tlascales su mama le enseño, ella vende toda la semana va ofreciendo en una carretilla sus productos  de 5:00 a 7:30 de la tarde en las calles de Tlayacapan, su negocio es ambulante anda en las calles del pueblo ofreciendo sus productos. Su negocio es importante porque le da para ayudarla económicamente cuando su esposo no trabaja de ahí toma para la comida, a ella le gusta preparar los elotes y venderlos y se siente orgullosa porque las personas ya conoce como preparamos los tlascales y el chile atole y están sabrosos porque si los prepara bien y termina toda su mercancía, ella atiende a mas de 50 clientes  al día, su negocio es popular porque las personas ya saben lo que lleva y le hacen sus pedidos, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son que en tiempo de calor bajan las ventas y también la competencia  ya que cuando comenzó vendía ella únicamente y ahora ya son varias personas que venden elotes, esquites, chile atole, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para volver a comprar, para pagar algunas deudas que tiene, para pagar el préstamo, sus planes son buscar un lugarcito donde vender  su mercancía para ya no andar subiendo y bajando y ya estar establecidos. Tlayacapan es un Pueblo Turístico vienen muchos visitantes por el ex convento de las momias y venden muchos artículos de ollas, cazuelas piezas muy bonitas de ornato y hay una banda grande de Tlayacapan se llama Santa María toca muy bonito, Su negocio si le ha ayudado a su familia cuando alguno se enferma y también de ahí pudo hacer su casita con la ayuda también de su esposo que también participo en los gastos y las mejoras que desea hacer son sus baños de su propiedad, los planes y esperanzas para sus hijos son darles estudio a sus hijos. La señora Alejandra está muy contenta con este préstamo que le dieron para establecer su negocio como ella quiere y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias y ojala siempre nos siguieran prestando y que confíen en nosotras, ya que es un beneficio para nosotras para que crezcan nuestros negocios
texts.en:
The name of this group is San Juanito and it is located in the community of Tlayacapan in the state of Morelos, Mexico. It is made up of 7 women members who all know each other and are neighbors. 

Florida G. M. will invest her loan in the purchase of catalogues and merchandise to fill orders that have already been placed this season. 

Rosenda D. Munoz will purchase hair dyes in various shades and of the Maginel and Magic Color brand names. She will also purchase a curling iron, and hair spray. 

Patricia O. V. will purchase a stove and a tank of gas, as well as a tub to cook corn on the cob.

Alejandra F. A. will purchase a tricycle and a stove from where to sell corn on the cob.

Maria Feliz C. S. will purchase dried roses, chrysanthemums, daisies, greens, cloves and vases. 

Elizabeth C. S. will purchase glass vases, florists foam, gladiolas, chrysanthemums, roses, Acapulco flowers, lilacs, etc.

Isabel S. N. will purchase paint, firewood, and soft drinks to improve her business.

Alejandra F. A. is a member of the group. She is 27 years old and she has a grade 9 education. She lives with her boyfriend, a farmhand, and they have 2 children together: Candido is 8 years old and is in primary school, and Sergio is 2. She has a stand from where she sells corn on the cob, prepared corn, corn drinks, and baked corn cakes. 

With her loan she wishes to purchase a tricycle to sells her products, a stove and a tank of gas, as well as mayonnaise, and popsicle sticks.  She sells corn on the cob, prepared corn, corn drinks, and corn cakes. 

Alejandra started her business 8 years ago following her aunts retirement from her business. She gave her the cooking tubs and sticks that she had and her mother loaned her some money to purchase corn and she also loaned her a stove.  Alejandra knew how to make corn drinks, prepared corn and corn cakes, as her mother taught her. She sells every day of the week from a wheelbarrow from 5pm to 7:30pm every evening through the streets of Tlayacapan.  She travels through all the streets of her town to sell her products. 

Her business is important because it helps her financially, especially when her husband is out of work and she is still able to buy food. She enjoys preparing the corn for sale and she is very proud because she is well known, especially for her corn cakes and corn drinks. They are very tasty and she always sells out. She tends to more than 50 customers every day. Her business is popular because everyone knows her cooking and they place orders. 

She faces a challenge when the hot weather approaches and the sales drop. She also finds the competition a challenge. When she first started out she was the only one in the business and today there are many people who sell corn, prepared corn, and corn drinks. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in business, to pay off some debts, and to repay this loan. Her plan is to find a store from where she can be settled in to sell her product to avoid running the streets. 

Tlayacapan is a tourist area that is visited by many travelers who wish to see the old convent and the mummies. They sell terra cotta pottery, and very ornate pots. There is also a very popular musical group named Santa Maria. 

Her business has helped her family when someone falls ill and she was also able to build a house with the help of her husband, who also contributed to the expenses and improvements. Her plans and dream for her children are to provide them with an education. Alejandra is very happy to receive this loan to establish her business as she dreams.  She will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

The members of this group wish to convey to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner) "Thank you very much and we hope to keep accessing loans while we keep your trust. They are a great help to us in advancing our businesses".

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle, a stove, a tank of gas, and ingredients.

loans.name: Radiant Sun Of Huaycan Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario vive en la zona c, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, forma parte del grupo “Sol Radiante de Huaycan” desde hace 2 años y el grupo está conformado por nueve vecinas amigas. Ella trabaja desde hace 15 años en la bodega que puso en su casa para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, esto es un logro para ella ya que la mayoría de sus hijos han logrado completar sus estudios, mas ella aun tiene la meta de obtener un terreno donde construir su casa y para esto desea que Edaprospo siga ayudándole con las habilitaciones.
texts.en: Rosario lives in Zone C, she is married and she has four children. She has been a member of the group named "Radiant Sun of Huaycan" for the past 2 years. The group is made up of nine neighbors and friends. For the past 15 years she has had a convenience store located in her home. Her goal is to support her children in their schooling. It has been a personal success for her to see the majority of her children finish their studies. She has a personal goal now of acquiring a piece of land where to build a house. She has approached Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) for continued help with her housing.

loans.use: To purchse products and ingredients.

loans.name: Jesuscristo Es La Puerta 1, 4 Group

texts.en:
Oliva is the coordinator of her group Jesucristo es L. puerta 1 & 4 (Jesus Christ 1 & 4). She is married and has six children. Her most difficult challenges are giving her family what they need, including clothing, school, and housing.  Oliva is taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She has had her business for four years, which she started with her own capital. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothing for men, women, and children. She will use the profits to save and if possible, to invest.

Oliva began with Esperanza because she wants to invest in her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.  Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, where the sugar cane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El sr. Pedro tiene 51 años de edad y tiene una familia muy unida que son su esposa y sus cuatro hijos viven por la zona de la colorada son propietarios de casa y además cuentan con un vehículo al cual lo hacen trabajar como taxi el dinero lo necesita para la compra de llantas y algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar , el sr. Pedro indica  estar feliz con la vida que lleva y que a veces el dinero falta pero con trabajo y esfuerzo todo lo que a deseado y querido lo ha logrado y todo gracias al apoyo que siempre tuvo de su esposa esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Pedro is 51 years old and he has a very close family. He and his wife and their four children live in the La Colorada region. They own their own home and they have a car that they use as a taxi. The loan is needed to purchase tires and appliances for their home. Pedro states that he is happy with the life he has and eventhough sometimes they don't have enough money, with work and effort, he has always achieved what he has set out to do. This has been possible only with the support of his wife. He is very grateful to the organization for the support they provide.

loans.use: To purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Flor D. Coral, tiene 53 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. dos hijos, ambos viven con ella. Isabel tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa ubicada a 7 horas en las afueras D. Ayacucho. Cada dos semanas viaja a Ayacucho para asistir a sus reuniones D. los bancos y comprar nuevos productos para su tienda D. abarrotes. Ella usará su próximo préstamo para comprar arroz y azúcar. Isabel ha sido miembro D. FINCA Perú por un año. El año pasado fue capaz D. ampliar su negocio y ahora también venD. cerdos. También aprendió a ahorrar dinero, el cual invierte en su negocio. Isabel sufre D. diabetes y gracias a los medicamentos que toma se siente mejor.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the "Flor D. Coral" community bank.  She is 53 years old, married, and has two children who both live with her.

Isabel has a grocery store in her home which is located on the outskirts of Ayacucho.  Every two weeks she travels to Ayacucho to attend her community bank's meetings and to buy new products for her grocery store.

Isabel will use this loan to buy rice and sugar.  She has been a member of FINCA Perú for one year.  Last year she was able to expand her business and now she sells pigs too.  She also learned to save money which she invests in her business.  Isabel suffers from diabetes but thanks to the medicines that she takes she feels better.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Flor de Coral, tiene 33 años y tiene tres hijos, de 3, 15 y 17 años de edad. Victoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres. Ella también es propietaria de dos mototaxis, que utilizan para prestar servicios de transporte privado. Ha sido miembro de FINCA Perú durante 5 años, y en este tiempo muchas cosas en su vida han cambiado. Ella aprendió a ahorrar y con sus ahorros y crédito ha podido comprar sus mototaxis, un refrigerador para su tienda y un pedazo de tierra en Ayacucho. Victoria y su familia viven en la casa de sus padres, pero desea construir una casa para ella y su familia. Victoria hará uso de su próximo préstamo para invertir en la construcción de una casa y comprar los productos para su tienda porque la demanda es mayor durante las vacaciones. A ella le gusta trabajar con FINCA Perú porque le ayuda mucho. De las sesiones de formación previstas, Victoria ha aprendido sobre el empoderamiento de la mujer y la familia. Victoria sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Flor de Coral" community bank.  She is 33 years old and has three children aged 3, 15 and 17.

Victoria has a grocery store in her parents' home.  She is also the owner of two 'mototaxis' (auto rickshaws) which are used to provide private transport services.  Victoria has been a member of FINCA Perú for 5 years and, during this time, many things have changed in her life.  She has learned to save and, with her savings and her loans, she has been able to buy her 'mototaxis', a refrigerator for her store and a piece of land in Ayacucho.

Victoria and her family live in her parents' home but she would like to build a house for herself and her family.  Victoria will use her loan to invest in building her house and in buying products for her store because demand is higher during the holidays.  She likes working with FINCA Perú because it helps her a lot.  Victoria has learned about empowering women and the family from our training sessions.  She dreams of her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: To buy products for her store

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Celestina, tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 5 hijos, sólo uno D. ellos vive con ella, ya que la mayoría D. sus hijos son adultos. Celestina y su familia viven en una casa alquilada en la Comunidad D. Compañía, ubicada a 30 minutos a las afueras D. Ayacucho. Celestina utiliza su crédito para comprar materiales, tales como la leña y Cley, que ella necesita para hacer ladrillos. El negocio es lento en este momento porque la lluvia destruye parte D. los ladrillos. Ella cubre sus ladrillos con plástico, pero lamentablemente eso no es suficiente. Celestina es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 4 años, esto le ha permitido pagar la educación D. sus hijos y continuar con su negocio. Celestina disfruta D. las reuniones quincenales D. su Banco Comunal, donD. reciben charlas. A partir D. estas capacitacion ha aprendido más sobre cómo dirigir un hogar y sobre la importancia del ahorro. Celestina solicita un préstamo para invertir en la construcción D. la casa, tambien hara uso D. sus ahorros. Celestina quiere empezar un nuevo negocio. Sus metas es comprar un auto para que pueda vender papas en Lima.
texts.en:
Celestina is 52 years old, married, and has 5 children.  Only one of her children still lives with her since most of her children are grown up.  Celestina and her family live in a rental house in Compañía community, 30 minutes outsiD. Ayacucho.

Celestina will uses her loan money to buy materials such as firewood and clay that she needs to make bricks.  Her business is slow at the moment because the rain is destroying some of the bricks.  She covers her bricks with plastic but, unfortunately, that isn't enough.

Celestina has been a member of FINCA Perú for 4 years.  This has allowed her to pay for her children's education and to continue in her business.  Celestina enjoys the fortnightly meetings of her community bank where they receive talks.  From these training sessions, she has learned more about how to run a household and about the importance of saving.  Celestina is requesting this loan to invest in building her house.  She will also use her savings.  Celestina would like to start a new business.  Her goal is to buy a car so that she can sell potatoes in Lima.

loans.use: To build her house

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, D. 51 años, vive con su hija pequeña en su casa que es propia.DesD. hace 4 años, se dedica a varios negocios, ligados al comercio, entre los que se encuentran la venta D.  cerveza y también paralelamente mercería. En la búsqueda D. nuevas oportunidades ha decidido implementar un nuevo negocio, y así hace unos días comercializa  comida aprovechando la ubicación D. su casa que esta ubicada en una avenida muy transitada. Ella ofrece almuerzos y su pequeña hija la ayuda en la atención D. las mesas cuando realizan los pedidos, y esta muy satisfecha pues estas actividades le permiten sostener los gastos D. su hogar. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un puesto D. venta D. prendas D. vestir.Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a todas  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.Isabel tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito  en la compra D.  mercadería en víveres y también gaseosas pues necesita abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel is 51 years old.  She lives with her young daughter in her own home.  She has been working in several sales-related business activities for 4 years.  These businesses incluD. selling beer and also sewing supplies.  Seeking new opportunities, Isabel has decided to set up a new business and so she has just started selling meals, taking advantage of the fact that her house is located on a very busy avenue.  She offers breakfasts and her young daughter helps her to serve at the tables when people make their orders.  She is very satisfied because these activities allow her to cover her household expenses.  In the future, she is planning to set up a sales location to sell clothes.

This is Isabel's fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her repayments and she likes being a member of her community bank because the members are all responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She thanks all the people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  Isabel is planning to use her loan money to buy foodstuffs and soda as she needs to stock her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and soda for her business

loans.name: Michell Alexandra

texts.en:
Michell is a 19 year old entrepreneur. She lives with her parents in a house made of concrete in an area called “Suburbio” in the city of Guayaquil. The area is called suburbio because most of its inhabitants are small business owners. 

Michell likes sales and two years ago she started a small store of her own. Her mother attends to the customers in the mornings when Michell is at the university and Michell takes over in the afternoons. 

She tries to sell a variety of products: personal hygiene and milk products but also food like ham.  She plans to use her loan to buy more milk products and sodas. 

In the future she hopes to increase the variety of products offered at her store. She hopes to include clothing items as well. Her biggest fear is that she and her mom would both get sick and there would be no one to attend to the store. She hopes her parents will stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy milk products and sodas to sell

loans.name: Las Responsables 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables 4 & 5 (The Responsible). She makes her home here in a simple structure with four children and her mother. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her children alone being both mother and father in her home.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook and visit friends.

Altagracia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 7 months, starting with her Esperanza's first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes. She will use the profits to buy some present for her children and to save the rest. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to have a business and she was needing the capital to start one. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia es cliente antigua de emprender, ella vive en casa propia en la zona se santa fe, lugar ubicado en una rinconada de la zona sur, tiene dos hijos menores que se encuentran a su cuidado, ella viaja al desaguadero a comprar su productos como tunta, chuño, ají amarillo, rojo, condimentos, etc., su esposo trabaja de albañil por las distintas zonas de la zona sur, la señora es cumplida y responsable en sus pagos, al margen de sus ventas, ella tiene un kiosco en una  parada de mini bus, que atiende dos veces por semana, ya que no tiene mucha afluencia de transportes de esa línea, por lo tanto se solicita la atención como cliente kiva. El crédito que ella solicita invertirá en su capital de trabajo en la  compra de chuño, ajíes, etc. y parte en compra de material de construcción, ya que ella esta amurallando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is a long-standing client of Emprender.  She lives in her own home in Santa Fe district which is located in a corner of the southern part of the city.  She has two dependent children in her care.

Lucia travels to Desaguadero to buy her products such as 'chuño' (a freeze-dried potato product), 'tunta' (white 'chuño'), yellow chili peppers, red chili peppers, condiments, etc.  Her husband works as a construction worker in different areas in the south of the city.

Lucia is punctual and responsible in making her loan repayments.  She has a kiosk at a mini bus stop where she works twice a week since there isn't a lot of transport on that line.  However, she is requesting attention as a Kiva client.  Part of the loan she is requesting will be invested as working capital, buying 'chuño', chili peppers, etc. and part will be used to buy building supplies since she is building a wall around her house.

loans.use: To buy white 'chuño' (freeze-dried potato product), chili peppers, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, vive en la meseta D. Achumani y vive con sus dos hijos ya profesionales, uno D. ellos viaja constantemente, ella se dedica a la repostería, elaboración D. galletas, donas tortas,  hace mas D. 20 años, elabora queques, tortas y humintas, que reparte en las confiterías D. la zona central y zona sur, es una cliente que trabaja con Emprender desD. el año 2002 , es una cliente muy responsable, y trabajadora, ya que al margen D. esa actividad se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y abarrotes, con el dinero del crédito comprara harina, levadura, etc. para la elaboración D. sus galletas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in Meseta D. Achumani with her two children who are professionals.  One of her children travels constantly.

Beatriz's business is making confectionery.  She makes cookies, doughnuts and cakes.  She has been in this business for more than twenty years.  She makes sponge cakes, gateaus and 'humintas' (small cakes maD. from corn and sugar).  She sells her products to cake shops in the central and southern zones.

Beatriz has been a client of Emprender since 2002.  She is a responsible and hard-working client since, as well as carrying out this business activity, she also works selling soft drinks and groceries.

Beatriz will use the money from this loan to buy flour, yeast, etc. to make her cookies.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making cookies

loans.name: Pacaycasa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pacaycasa inicia su ciclo 22 con 16 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios.
Carmen Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comida los días domingos en Orcasitas. solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la preparacion de comidad como son: arroz, papa, condimentos y carne.
Carmen Rosa no sólo se dedica a la venta de alimentos, sino también al acopio y venta de Cochinilla, tara y tuna pero solo lo hace por temporadas.  
A Carmen Rosa le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, porque se practica mucho los valores, le dan préstamos y puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda de abarrotes en general y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Pacaycasa community bank is beginning its 22nd loan cycle with 16 members.  All of the women have different businesses.

Carmen Rosa is a member of the community bank.  She is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 4.  She sells meals on Sundays in Orcasitas.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies to make meals such as: rice, potatoes, condiments and meat.  Carmen Rosa doesn't just sell food.  She also works storing and selling goods in Cochinilla, Tara and Tuna.  However, that work is seasonal.

Carmen Rosa enjoys her community bank's meetings because they promote values, they provide loans and she is able to save.  Her dream is to open a grocery store and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes and meat

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna, de 27 años, vive al lado de sus padres en su casa que es propia.Desde hace dos años, empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, y ha instalado su negocio de venta de comida en un local alquilado. Su madre la apoya en la atención, y ella atiende en su negocio durante todos los días incluyendo los domingos, para vender en mayor cantidad ha desarrollado la estrategia de  hacerles probar a sus clientes las diversas variedades de platillos que ofrece. En las mañanas se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para  los almuerzos, y una vez terminada la jornada lava todos los platos y cubiertos  para el día siguiente. Manifiesta  que aunque el trabajo es algo agotador, lo considera una distracción y tiene la satisfacción de establecer un negocio con local propio, y ya ha empezado a mejorar la imagen de su local.Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada formar  parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son responsables y solidarias, además agradece  a todas las  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo solicitado ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Jovanna tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  mejora de su negocio y quiere comprar mesas y gaseosas; además otra parte la invertirá en la adquisición de ingredientes no perecibles al por mayor que siempre utiliza en la preparación de sus comidas, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Jovanna, age 27, lives with her parents in their own house.  Two years ago she started working in an independent manner.  She established her business of selling food at a rented site.  Her mother helps her wait on customers.  She tends to her business every day, including Sundays.  She does this in order to sell more.  She has developed the strategy of having her customers taste the variety of dishes that she sells.

In the mornings she stocks up on the ingredients needed for the lunches.  When she has finished her work day, she washes all of the plates and the cutlery for the next day.  She says that even though the work is somewhat tiring, she feels that it is interesting.  She has the satisfaction of establishing a business at her own site.  She has started to improve the image of her site.

This is her sixth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments.  Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  She is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful to the progress of her business.

Jovanna plans to use the requested money to improve her business.  She wants to buy tables and soft drinks.  She wants to use part of the loan to get non-perishable ingredients wholesale.  She always uses them in her food preparation.  This is the way she plans to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and chairs to improve her business

loans.name: Fredy Jacinto

texts.en:
58 year old Fredy lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil (an urban zone where the majority of its inhabitants are informal merchants). He has two grown children.

Fredy always wanted to have his own business and his wife had a great place available so they decided to start a restaurant. Together with his wife he works from 10am until 14:30pm. They sell lunches for $1.50.

At the moment he does not experience any problem with his business. He plans to use his loan to buy a showcase ($100), a stove ($150), a fridge ($400) and the rest he will spend on ingredients for the lunches and sodas to sell.

In the future he hopes to open another business in the center of town.

loans.use: To buy a showcase, stove and fridge for restaurant

loans.name: Jessica Mercedes

texts.es:
Jessica de 29 años, es una mujer divorciada que tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años a su cargo. Ella siempre quiso trabajar desde la casa para poder cuidar a sus hijos y tener dinero suficiente para darle lo que ellos necesiten.  

Comenzó a trabajar viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas como comerciante informal. Después de algún tiempo ella obtuvo su pequeño local en donde vende papelería, artículos de bazar etc. Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende juguetes, cuadernos, plumas, etc. 

Quiere en el futuro continuar con su negocio y agrandarlo mas por eso quiere comenzar comprando mas mercadería con el préstamo tales como juguetes, papelería, cuadernos.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 29, is divorced and has two children under her care.  The children are 14 and 8 years old.  She always wanted to work from her house in order to take care of her children and to have enough money to give them what they need.

She started to work as an informal merchant living in an urban zone called Orquídeas.  After some time, she got a small place where she sells stationery and bazaar items, etc.  She works from 8:30 a.m. until 10:00 pm. every day.  She sells toys, notebooks, and pens, etc.

In the future she wants to continue with her business and expand it.  To do so, she wants use the loan to start buying things like toys, stationery, and notebooks.

loans.use: Toys and stationery

loans.name: Julia Nora

texts.es:
Julia es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio hace varios años a trabajar para apoyar  a su familia. Tiene una pulpería con ochos años en ventas, comenzó ah invertir lo que logro el objetivo de atracción de clientela. 
Su esposo la apoya quien es vendedor de eskimo y acarreo, juntos han logrado ir construyendo su vivienda de concreto.
Para  la ampliación de su inventario, recurre al financiamiento y logra comprar más productos de consumo, logrando el objetivo.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en cuatro quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, caja de jabón, maíz, entre otros productos como: cola, aro, brillo de labios, trabas entre otros para generar mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Julia is a small merchant.  She started out working several years ago to support her family.  She has had a grocery store for eight years.  She started to invest and this led to her acquiring a steady customer base.  Her husband helps her by selling ice cream and doing hauling.  Together they’ve managed to build their concrete house.

To expand her inventory she is requesting a loan to buy more products thus reaching her goal.

Today, with this new loan, she will buy four quintals of rice, beans, sugar, a large jug of oil, a case of soap and corn among other products like: glue, earrings, lipsticks and hair clips among others to generate higher profits.

loans.use: She will buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, a large jug of oil and costume trinkets to increase sales.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, de  37 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas en una casa arrendada; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.Desde hace 12 años este trabajador hombre brinda el servicio de transporte con su movilidad que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Labora  todos los días recorriendo los diferentes puntos de la ciudad cercanos a donde vive  y con la experiencia se desempeña en la actualidad de manera eficiente logrando las ganancias que requiere  para el sustento de su familia.  A pesar que el alza de combustible en algunas temporadas le afecta en sus ganancias ha aprendido ha soportar  estas temporadas difíciles por lo que esta pensando en el  futuro adquirir una nueva movilidad de transporte.Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contento de  contar con el  apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo, pues le  será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Freddy tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de repuestos para su movilidad y también quiere inscribirlo en la recategorización para sacar una  nueva  licencia de conducir, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Freddy, age 37, lives with his wife and their three daughters in a rented house.  They work hard each day in order to get ahead.  For 12 years this hard-working man has been providing transportation service.  He does this with his vehicle, which is his primary work tool.  He works every day traveling to different places in the cities close to where he lives.  

He now works with experience in an efficient way, and he manages to get the income needed to support his family.  In spite of the rise in gas prices that affects his earnings at times, he has learned how to withstand these difficult times.  He is planning to get a new vehicle for transportation in the future.

This is his third loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support. He has always demonstrated himself to be responsible with his payments. He is pleased to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. He is grateful to all of the people who will be the lenders of the loan he is requesting. It will be very useful to the progress of his business.

Freddy plans to use the requested money to buy replacement parts for his vehicle.  He also wants to register it and pay for reclassification of his driver’s license.  This is the way he plans to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy replacement parts and to get a new driver's license

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar Alberto S. H. vive junto a su esposa e hijo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio de Sacta. Trabaja como obrero de campo hace 3 años en parcelas agricolas. Actualmente se encuentra realizando mejoras a su vivienda motivo por el cual requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño segun nos comenta es terminar de construir su vivienda y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Cesar está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Cesar Alberto S. H. lives together with his wife and son.  He has his own home which is located in the village of Sacta.

Cesar has been working on plots of farmland as a laborer for 3 years.  He is currently making improvements to his home and needs a loan to finish building his home.  He tells us that his dream is to finish building his home so that he can give his family a better quality of life.  Cesar is very grateful for the support that we can offer him through this loan.

loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Lucy Paquita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a Lucy. Tiene 39 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Está en el  Banco Comunal ya por dos años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer, además porque le han ayudado mucho para mantener su negocio.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su mama le ayuda en la atención de los clientes, también vende helados y artículos de bazar, los productos los recibe en su local, nos cuenta que tiene su tienda ya por 10 años y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '11 de Septiembre' (September 11th) community bank meets in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Lucy.  She is 39 years old, single, and lives in her parents' home.  She has been a member of the community bank for two years and she likes it because the loan repayments are easy to make and also because they have helped her a lot in supporting her business.

Lucy has a store where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oils and detergents.  She works in her store every day from 6.00am to 9.00pm and sometimes until even later.  Her mom helps her to serve her customers.  They also sell frozen treats and general market-place items.  Her products are delivered to her premises.  She tells us that she has had her store for 10 years and, thanks to God, it has done very well.

Lucy will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other household essentials.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and for her store to keep growing every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other household essentials

loans.name: Shalom 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Teolinda is one of the members of the “Shalom 5, 6, 7” group, located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. In this town, as in many others, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants. Her principal economic activities are the sale of clothing. Teolinda is the mother of five children, four or whom live with her and their father. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is having sufficient money to cover the needs of her family and her favorite activity is serving in her business.

Teolinda is very moved by receiving her ninth loan from E. Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She has had her business for around four years. She set up her business when she saved enough money to started a business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of a different cloths for kids, women and men, also she sell shoes and cosmetics. She plans to use her profits to save. Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Narcisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a Carmen. Tiene 42 años de edad, está soltera y vive en la casa de una tía, estudio en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí y obtuvo el título de Lic. En Filosofía Y Letras. Está en el  Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además también vende pastillas y artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 19h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su tía le ayuda en su tienda, los productos  compra en Portoviejo y la mayoría los  recibe en su local, nos cuenta que tiene su tienda ya por 22 años y que gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Sus sueños son realizar una maestría en el futuro.
texts.en: The 11 De Septiembre ["September 11th"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the Charapoto city. This location is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes away from the province's best beaches, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente. Here we meet Carmen. She is 42, single, and lives in the home of an aunt. She studied at the Universidad Técnica De Manabí [Technical University of Manabi] and obtained a Bachelor of Arts. She has been part of this Community Bank for three cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are very low. She has a grocery store with food items such as rice, sugar, oils, and detergents. She also sells lozenges and other items. She works every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm and sometimes later. Her aunt helps her in the store. She buys her products in Portoviejo, and sells the majority of them in her store. She tells us that she has had her store for 22 years, and that it has gone very well thanks to God. She will use this loan to stock her store more. She will purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other basic staples. Her dream is to be a teacher in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and more basic staples.

loans.name: Karina Ivonne

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Karina es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Tiene 23 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa  de los padres. Estudió en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí y obtuvo el título de Lic. En Ciencias De la Educacion.

Tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas y bar, en el vende todo tipo de bebidas desde cervezas, colas, jugos, entre otros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 14h00 y los fines de semana todo el dia. Nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por dos años y que con uno de los créditos fue como pudo comenzar su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar, cervezas, colas, frutas para los jugos, entre otros. Sus metas son tener un nombramiento en una escuela o colegio.
texts.en: The 11 de Septiembre ['September 11th'] Community Bank meets in the city of Charapoto every fifteen days. This location is known for its traditional culture and for being minutes away from the province's best beaches, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente. Karina is a founding member of the Community Bank and she likes it for the additional benefits that the institute offers, and because she has made many friends in the group. She is 23, single, and lives in her parents' home. She studied in the Universidad Técnica De Manabí [Technical University of Manabi] and obtained a Bachelor's of Education Sciences. She has a drinks sales business and a bar in which she sells all types of drinks, such as beers, colas, juices and others. She works every day from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm, and all day on weekends. She tells us that she has had this business for two years and used one of her loans to start the business. This loan is to purchase beer, colas, and fruit for juice, among other items. Her goal is to have an appointment in a school or university.

loans.use: to purchase beer, cola, fruit for juice, water, etc.

loans.name: Glivid Ecuador

texts.es:
Glivid de 37 años, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años. El y su esposo han sido muy unidos por eso cuando trabajaban en la camaronera decidieron retirarse para conseguir nuevas oportunidades con un negocio propio. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana con una casa de ladrillos han trabajado durante estos años repartiendo comida a sus conocidos y vecinos. Poco a poco han incrementado la lista de cliente que tienen. Ellos se levantan en la mañana a preparar la comida en la cocina de la casa y las reparten en la tarde cuando les comienzan a pedir los clientes almuerzos.  

Tienen muchas aspiraciones con el negocio por eso quieren continuar repartiendo comida para poder seguir quiere comprar con el préstamo víveres como aceite, arroz, azúcar para hacer mas comida. En el futuro quiere tener un local para tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Glivid is 37 years old.  He is married and has two children aged 7 and 3.  He and his wife have always been very united.  For this reason, when they were working in the shrimp industry, they decided to quit their jobs and follow new opportunities with their own business.

Glivid lives in a peri-urban area in a brick house.  He and his wife work delivering meals to their acquaintances and neighbors.  They have gradually increased their customer base.  They get up in the morning to prepare food in their kitchen which they then deliver in the afternoon when their customers start ordering lunches.  They have a lot of aspirations for their business.  They would like to continue delivering food.  Glivid is requesting this loan to buy food products such as oil, rice and sugar so that they can make more meals.  In the future he would like to have premises so that they can serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Martha Evangelista

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y 1 años, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ceviches en la ciudad de Charapoto, venden todo tipo de ceviches de camarón, pescado, conchas, etc. trabaja  los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 6h00 hasta las 13h00, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo, nos cuenta que llevan en su negocio por dos años, y que fue por la necesidad de tener algo propio que decidió poner este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar colas, aguas, pescado, camarón y otros productos necesarios para la preparación de estos platos deliciosos, es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la forma de trabajo que tiene la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en: The 11 De Septiembre ["September 11th"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This location is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from the best beaches of the province, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente. Here we meet Mrs Martha. She is 31 and in a common-law marriage, a relationship from which she has three children, aged 8, 6 and 1. The two oldest children are in school. Her husband is a merchant. She has a ceviche [seafood dish] business in Charapoto city. She sells all types of ceviches with shrimp, fish, conches, etc. She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm. Her husband helps her with this work. She tells us that she has had this business for two years, and that she decided to start it out of the necessity to have something of her own. This loan is to purchase colas, water, fish, shrimp and other necessary products for making these delicious dishes. She is a founding member of the Community bank and she likes it because of the work structure of the institution. Her dream is to have her own home as the home in which they currently live is rented.

loans.use: to purchase cola, water, fish, shrimp, conches and other items for preparing cebiches [a popular seafood dish]

loans.name: Sinceridad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sinceridad, incia su cuarto ciclo con 17 socias, las cuales tiene diversoso negocios, como es el caso D. Maria, tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. Maria tiene un carpintería con su esposo, confeccionan: puertas, ventanas, balcones, atienD. pedidos, el año pasado le fue bien hizo trabajos para L. instituciones públicas D. L. región. Solicita un prestamo apra L. compra D. thiner, goma y laca. 
A Maria le gustan las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal porque se práctica el compañerismo entre las socias del Banco Comunal, aprenD. mucho D. las capacitaciones que recibe D. su promotora.
Su sueño es ahorrar para comprar máquinas para implementar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: The Sinceridad ["Sincerity"] Community Bank is starting its fourth cycle with 17 members who have diverse businesses. Maria, age 41, is married and has 4 children. Maria has a carpenter's shop with her husband. They make: doors, windows and balconies. They take orders. Last year they maD. orders for local public institutions. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of thinner, rubber and lacquer. Maria likes her Community Bank meetings because the members are friends. She learns a lot from the training that she receives from the captain. Her dream is to save to purchase machines for her business, and for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: the purchase of thinner, rubber and lacquer

loans.name: Rosa Benilda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta  relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, legumbres en el mercado. Trabaja los días domingos  desde las 4am hasta las 14h00, trabaja sola pero en el mismo mercado también su marido trabaja vendiendo plátano, los productos los compran  a agricultores que llevan sus productos a entregar a los comerciantes al por mayor. Ella además de vender los domingos en el resto de la semana se dedica a lavar ropa ajena.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar legumbres y plátano para el negocio del esposo. Su sueño es tener una gran tienda en su casa y por sobre todo salud.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '11 de Septiembre' (September 11th) community bank meets in the town of Carapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also because it is only a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Rosa is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it for the benefits that Fundación Espoir provide.  Rosa is 62 years old.  She lives with her partner and has six children who are now grown up, although two still live with her.  Her husband is a salesman.

Rosa sells vegetables in the market.  She works on Sundays from 4.00am to 2.00pm.  She works alone but her husband also works in the same market selling bananas.  They buy their products from farmers who bring their products to deliver to salespeople wholesale.  As well as selling in the market on Sundays, during the rest of the week she washes other people's clothes.

Rosa will use this new loan to buy vegetables and also bananas for her husband's business.  Her dream is to have a large store in her home and, above all, to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and bananas

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Enaida Q.  tiene 44 años vive en el distrito de los olivos  Lima Perú  ella es separada del padre de sus hijos,  ambos comparten un negocio debido a  que el  trabajo durante 20 años en una fabrica  de maquinas panificadoras,  al renunciar  ambos decidieron iniciar su propio taller y fabricar maquinas por su propia cuenta el negocio es de los dos la Sra. Enaida realiza las labores de administración  manteniendo todo en orden, el negocio marcha bien a pesar de algunas dificultades que han tenido últimamente debido al alza de la harina,y el combustible pocos se arriesgan a emprender el negocio de panadería es por eso que ahora están invirtiendo en la compra de maquinas de segunda (usadas) a las que le brindan mantenimiento y las renuevan para venderlas a menor costo, para darle facilidades a sus clientes su mayor inversión es haber avanzado la construcción de su casa, Enaida también tiene un negocio adicional que es la venta de cubrecamas, sabanas  y toallas, es para esto que invertirá su préstamo  la época de verano es propicia para este tipo de negocio y ella tiene muchos clientes para colocar estos productos , por otro lado ella es  secretaria del grupo “ SANTA ROSA DE LIMA “ son 10 socias trabajadoras y emprendedoras.

 *La Sra, Enaida es la cuarta de la derecha la (paradas).
texts.en:
Enaida Q. is 44 years old and lives in Los Olivos district in Lima, Perú.  She is separated from her children's father.  They both share a business owing to the fact that he worked for 20 years in a factory making bread machines.  When he gave up his job, they both decided to set up their own workshop and make machines themselves.  The business belongs to both of them.  Enaida does the administrative work, keeping everything in order.  The business is going well in spite of some difficulties that they have had recently because of the rise in the price of flour and fuel.  Few people dare take the risk of starting out in the bakery business right now.  For this reason, they are now investing in buying second-hand machines which they will repair and renovate so that they can sell them cheaply to give their customers a chance.  Enaida's biggest investment is having made progress in building her house.

Enaida has another business which is selling bedspreads, sheets and towels.  She will invest her loan in this business.  The summer season is good for this type of business and she has many customers for her products.  Enaida is also secretary of the "SANTA ROSA DE LIMA" group which is made up of 10 hard-working and enterprising women.

* Enaida is the fourth woman from the right (standing up)

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets and towels

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo, y sus cinco  hijos, los cuales aún estudian en el colegio.Desde hace 5 años, esta laboriosa mujer, se dedica  a la venta de juguetes, pero realizando esta labor descubrió un taller de  producción de zapatillas de buenas marcas. Es así que ingresa a la venta de zapatillas de marcas,  en un puesto ambulante en  las periferias de un  mercado muy concurrido  de su ciudad. En esta labor  ya lleva  siete  años y le va muy bien por lo que se siente contenta, pero se siente muy fastidiada porque con frecuencia debe cambiar de ubicación, pues los trabajadores  de la municipalidad no dejan que permanezca en un mismo sitio mucho tiempo . Como es una mujer emprendedora para  más adelante anhela comprarse un puesto en el  mercado donde vende, pues no quiere perder a sus clientes.Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Sandra tiene planeado invertir el dinero  del préstamo en la compra de zapatillas y sandalias pues quiere comercializarlas durante la temporada de verano, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 41 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and five children who are still studying in school.

This hard-working woman has been selling toys for five years.  However, in carrying out her work she discovered a workshop which makes brand-name sneakers.  Now she sells brand-name sneakers as a street vendor on the outskirts of a very busy market in the city.  She has been in this business for seven years and it is doing very well which makes her feel happy.  However, she also feels very annoyed because she frequently has to change location as the people who work for the city don't allow her to stay in the same place for long.

As Sandra is an enterprising woman, in the future she would like to buy a stall in the market where she can sell her products as she doesn't want to lose her customers.

This is Sandra's tenth loan from MFP and she pledges to be responsible in making her repayments as she doesn't want to let down the people who have made it possible for her to receive the money that will allow her to keep working.  Sandra plans to invest her loan money in buying sneakers and sandals as she would like to sell them during the summer season.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy sneakers and sandals to sell

loans.name: Tanya Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Tanya es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta todo del Banco. Tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 14 y12 años, todos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es profesor de escuela.

Tiene un local donde es papelería y además es un centro de servicios informáticos. Allí también vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta 19h00, lleva dos años en este negocio y que lo ido implementando poco a poco con los créditos del Banco.

Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, hojas, y otros artículos de papelería. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que el que tiene es arrendado y este se le lleva parte de su ganancia.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the 11 of September Communal Bank meets every 15 days.  The locality is known for its traditional culture and, also, for ts location, just a few minutes from 2 of the province's main beaches, namely San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Tanya is the founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes everything about the bank. She is 39 year of age, married, and she has 3 children from this union, aged 16, 14  and 12.  They all study in school. Her husband is a school teacher.

Tanya has a shop that sells paper and, in addition, is a center of computer science services.  Here, also, she sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). Tanya works every day from 8:30 am until 7:00 pm. She has had this business for 2 years, expanding it little by little with loans from the Bank.

The present loan is to buy creams, perfumes, paper, and other articles for a stationers. Her dream is to own her shop, since she rents the one she has and this costs her part of her earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY CREAMS, PERFUMES, PACKETS OF PAPER, AND MORE ARTICLES FOR HER STATIONERS SHOP

loans.name: Esmerilda Patricia

texts.en:
46-year-old Esmerilda lives in Guayaquil’s Las Orquídeas area (an urban zone named for the orchids that were there when it was discovered). Esmerilda has two children (10 and 15) who go to public school.

She first started her business by selling notebooks in her neighborhood. As soon as she had enough capital she decided to open a variety store. Some products she sells the most are shampoo (buys for $.80 and sells for $1.10), sandals (buys for $2.50 and sells for $4) and little toys (buys for $2.50 and sells for $4).

Esmerilda works alone at the store from 9am until 9pm. The biggest problem she deals with is delinquency in the area. She plans to invest her $1,000 loan in more merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for variety store

loans.name: María Gabriela

texts.es:
