En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años. El marido es comerciante de venta de mariscos.
 
Tiene un negocio de venta de toda variedad de mariscos en su casa, en el vende pescado, camarón, langostinos, pulpo, entre otros, trabaja en la atención de sus clientes todos los días desde las 7h00hasta las 15h00 o hasta más tarde ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa, compran sus productos en San Jacinto lugar hasta donde llegan los pescadores.

Este crédito es para comprar camarón, pescado, ostiones, etc. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en él ha encontrado mucha ayuda para su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The 11 de Septiembre communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This place is known for its traditional culture and for being just minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we find María, 27.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 4 and 2 years of age.  Her husband is a fish merchant.  All kinds of sea food is sold in her house.  She sells fish, shrimp, prawns and octopus, among others.  She tends to customers every day from 7am until 3pm or later since the business is in her house.  They buy their products in San Jacinto which is the place the fishermen come to.

This loan is to buy shrimp, fish, oysters, etc.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she has found much help for her business in it.  Her dream is to own her own house because she currently rents.

loans.use: To buy shrimp, fish, oysters, octopus, prawns, etc.

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Sandra es del grupo “LA FORTALEZA”  ella es la presidenta , todas viven en laderas de chillón al norte de Lima, Sandra es divorciada y tiene 03 hijos es con su trabajo que ella puede  brindarles una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida, durante mucho tiempo ella alquilaba un puesto de comida allí trabajaba junto a su madre debido al fallecimiento de ella dejo el negocio que  además era costoso por el pago del alquiler y las ganancias no eran suficientes, por eso traslado su negocio a su propia casa además de atender clientes ahí  también  una hermana que trabaja en una fabrica la contacto para vender menú ( almuerzos) a los trabajadores del lugar,  es así que diariamente reparte aproximadamente 20 raciones de comida, su trabajo la ayuda  a pagar la academia de una de sus hijas ahora ella esta pensando buscar un mejor lugar donde la fluidez de gente sea mayor para abrir su negocio o mejor aun poner un restaurante en su propia casa es para eso que usara su préstamo para avanzar la construcción de su casa y concretar su proyecto muy pronto.
 
* Sandra C. es la sexta de las paradas
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the “LA FORTALEZA”  (Strength) group.  She is the group's president.  All the members of this group live on the hillsides of Chillón, to the north of Lima.  Sandra is divorced and has 3 children.  Through her work she is able to provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life.

For a long time, Sandra used to rent a food stall.  She worked there together with her mom but when her mom died she left the business.  The business was very expensive because of the high rent and her profits weren't sufficient.  For this reason, she moved her business to her own home.  As well as serving customers in her home, her sister, who works in a factory, contacted her about selling meals (lunches) to the workers in her factory.  Every day Sandra delivers approximately 20 meals.  Her work helps her to pay one of her daughter's school fees.  She is now thinking of looking for a better place where the flow of people is greater to open her business or, better still, set up a restaurant in her own home.  For this reason, Sandra will use her loan to make progress in building her home and will fulfil her project very soon.

* Sandra is the sixth person along amongst the people standing up

loans.use: To finish building her future restaurant

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 44 años, vive con su esposo  Efraín (45) y sus tres  hijos que aún estudian en el colegio; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.Desde hace 17 años, está laboriosa madre de familia se dedica a la costura, y  trabaja con el apoyo de su hermana; quien le ayuda a coser los forros de los muebles, camisas y polares porque sabe bastante de este rubro; mientras María busca más pedidos por realizar. De esta manera ella y su hermana son muy eficientes en los trabajos que realizan; por lo que adquirieron la  confianza de los clientes de su barrio y de otros comerciantes ambulantes que les hacen pedidos con regular frecuencia. En la actualidad su negocio le  permite captar buenas utilidades de los trabajos que le mandan, y disfruta mucho de su labor, pues como la realiza en  casa se siente tranquila. En los últimos tiempos le ha faltado capital y en adelante tiene planeado  ampliar  su negocio, para mejorar sus ganancias.Es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues desea contar con posteriores ayudas que le permitan continuar progresando.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero del crédito en la  compra de  telas delgadas y decoradas, y también cueros  al por mayor, para continuar realizando sus servicios, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en:
María, 44, lives with her husband, Efraín, 45, and their three children who are still in school.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.

For the last 17 years this hard working mother has been a seamstress; her sister helps her sew furniture covers, shirts and quilted jackets because she knows quite a bit about this occupation.  María is looking for more orders to fill.  This way she and her sister are very efficient in the work each does.  This led to their gaining the trust of the customers from their neighborhood as well as other traveling merchants that place regular orders with them.  Currently the business is producing good profits from the jobs they get and she enjoys her work very much.  For later on she plans to expand the business to improve profits.

This is her 16th loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she’d like to get future loans that will allow her to continue making progress.

María plans to use the money from the loan to buy thin, decorated fabric and leathers at wholesale to continue doing her work expecting thus to continue getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy fabric and leather to stock her business.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es: El Sr. Juanito es dueño taxi que trabaja en una línea de radiotaxi,  el esta casado y tiene  una hija, la esposa trabaja como empleada del hogar juntamente con su pequeña de 3 años, ellos viven  por la Zona de Cota Cota, en la casa de sus padres, este cliente anteriormente fue cliente Kiva, tiene un historial bueno, por temporadas de fiestas el se dedica a tocar en una banda de músicos tocando trompeta, quien por otra parte viaja a Desaguadero de donde compra los instrumentos, en esta ocasión el crédito destinara a la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su transporte ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y no le permite brindar un mejor servicio, esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juanito owns a taxi that he operates in a radio dispatched taxi service.  He’s married and has a daughter.  His wife works as a domestic employee with her three-year-old.  They live in the Cota Cota area in his parents’ house.  

He was a Kiva client previously; he has a good history.  During festivals he plays trumpet in a band of musicians and he goes to Desaguadero to buy musical instruments.

This time the loan will be used to buy tires and for vehicle maintenance because it’s starting to show some problems that prevent him from providing the best service.

He’s grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

La señora Ligia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, además se desempeña como presidenta del mismo función que desempeña con mucha responsabilidad y agrado. Tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante de carne.

Ella es consultora de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además vende calzados de las marcas Azalea y Dicaza, trabaja todos los días desde las 13h30 hasta las 19h00, ya que en las mañanas tiene que atender a su esposo que está muy delicado de salud. Su trabajo consiste en estar a cargo de surtir a 12 vendedoras que están a su cargo a quienes tiene que tomarles los pedidos y entregarles los productos. Lo que es la línea de zapatos los compra en Quito.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: zapatos de ambas marcas y productos Yanbal para sus ventas personales. Sus sueños son ser directora de Yanbal. .
texts.en:
The members of Avenida del Ejército communal bank meet every two weeks in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known since many years ago as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Ligia is a founding member of the bank.  She also is the group President, a job she does with much responsibility and pleasure.  She is 57 years old, married and has four adult, independent children.  Her husband is a meat merchant.

She is a Yanbal consultant (beauty supplies, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She also sells shoes of the Azalea and Dicaza brands.  She works every day from 1:30pm until 7pm because during the mornings she has to take care of her husband who is in delicate health.

Her work consists in stocking 12 sellers she’s in charge of and from whom she takes orders and delivers their products.  She buys the line of shoes in Quito.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: shoes of both brands and Yanbal products for her personal sales.  Her dream is to become a Yanbal director.

loans.use: To buy shoes and Yanbal brand products.

loans.name: Margarita Bella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

Para la señora Margarita este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 41 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos de 23, 22 y 14 años, el menor de ellos estudia en escuela y es quien vive en su casa.

Es una gran ama de casa que para solventar los gastos de su casa y los de su hijo trabaja vendiendo productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además también vende ropa de todo tipo.  Trabaja tres días a la semana, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa en el centro en una distribuidora.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, pantalones, camisetas, blusas, entre otros. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Av. Del Ejército" meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí. The city has been known for years for its Royal Tamarind trees.
 
This is Margarita's second loan with the communal bank, which she likes because of the way the bank works with her in helping her acquire the loans. She is 41 years old and is a single mother of three children ages, 14, 22 and 23. The youngest lives at home and is still in school.
 
Margarita is a great homemaker. To cover living costs and her sons expenses, she works selling Avon products (beauty products, makeup, perfumes and women's accessories). She also sells several types of clothing. She works three days a week selling her products door to door. Clients place orders and she collects payments either weekly or biweekly, depending on the customer's preference. The Avon products are delivered to her home and she picks up the clothing from a distributor located in the downtown area.

She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, creams, makeup, pants, shirts, blouses and other related goods.  Margarita currently lives with her parents but she dreams of one day owning her own home.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, makeup, pants, shirts, blouses etc.

loans.name: Nora Cleofe

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

La señora Nora es nacida en la Provincia de Esmeraldas pero hace 8 años se vino a vivir a esta ciudad, tiene 39 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 15 años todos viven en su casa, tres de ello estudian en Universidad y el menor esta en colegio. El marido es comerciante.

Tiene un puesto en las calles Alajuela y 1 de Enero donde vende empanadas, corviches y colas trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00 pero en las tardes también se dedica  a elaborar adornos y manualidades.

Este crédito es para comprar colas, plátano, maní, aceite y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de sus platos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años  y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia y un bazar para poder vender sus manualidades.
texts.en:
The city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi province, has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  In this city, the members of the communal bank " Av. Del Ejército" meet every 15 days.

Nora was born in Esmeraldas province, but 8 years ago she came to this city.  She is 39 years old, and is in a common-law marriage which has produced 4 children aged 21,19,17 and 15.  The children all live in her home; three of them study at the University and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a post in the Alajuela and 1 de Enero streets where she sells empanadas, corviches (banana dough with a seafood filling), and colas.  She works from Mondays through Saturdays from 3pm until 7pm, but in the evenings she also works making decorations and crafts.

This loan will be used to buy colas, bananas, peanuts, cooking oil and other ingredients to make her dishes.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 6 years, and she likes it because of the easy payment terms on the loans.  Her dreams are to have her own home and to have a store where she could sell her crafts.

loans.use: to buy colas, bananas, peanuts, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, tiene 37 años, vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos, ellos viven en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

David se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, él vende sus animales y productos agrícolas en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal, Anta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. David espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar semillas, animales críos y muchas cosas más.

David pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
David, 37, lives with his wife and three children in Anta province which is in Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

David is a farmer and cattleman.  He sells his animals and farm products at the community of Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city, Anta.

He has been in this line of work for several years and does excellently thanks to the effort he puts into it.  He hopes to get 1500 new soles in the loan and he will buy seed, newborn animals and many other things.

David is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is well managed by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy seed, newborn animals and many other things.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKAQ MAQUI”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Iscuchaka, provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Alicia; La socia tiene 24 años de edad, la socia  es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra y vende animales menores, la socia vende chanchos, cuyes, gallinas, pollos; La socia también trabaja en chakra, ella junto a su conyugue siembran y cosechan los productos de maíz que el terreno de agricultura les ofrece, la socia también se dedica  a la venta de maiz. La socia ofrece sus productos en la sferias semanales de su pueblo. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animales menores para la reproducción y venta final.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Alicia, 24, is a member of the “LLANKAQ MAQUI” communal bank which is located in Iscuchaka district, Anta province, Cusco department.

She is 24 years old, married and has two children.  She is a retailer.  She buys small farm animals for subsequent resale.  She sells pigs, guinea pigs, chickens and chicks.   She also works her fields with her husband; they grow corn on their farmland that she also sells at her town’s weekly market.

She is asking for the loan to buy small farm animals to breed for subsequent resale.

She is happy with the loan granted and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals to breed for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Edgar Edilberto

texts.es:
Edgar, tiene 21 años, vive en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Edgar se dedica a la ganadería, él vende sus animales en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Edgar espera recibir de S/. 800 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar ganado como por ejemplo vacas, ovejas, muchas animales más. 

Edgar pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Edgar, 21, lives in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Edgar is a cattleman.  He sells his animals at Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is a community located 15 minutes from the main city of Anta.  He has been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort he puts into the work.  Edgar hopes to receive an 800 new sol loan to buy cattle like cows, sheep and many other animals.

Edgar is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been operating for a year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy livestock like: cows, sheep and many other animals.

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada  pero en la actualidad está separada, de esa relación tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, con ella vive una nieta de 10 años que es su vida y que estudia en escuela. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años y le gusta la forma como se trabaja en el Banco.

Tiene una carreta en la cual vende alitas de pollos asadas, cueritos y fritadas, también vende bolos, colas y tostadas trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 9h00 frente a una escuela  y desde las 15h00 hasta las 18h00 en su casa, nos cuenta que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad y que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar productos necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Av. Del Ejército" community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees".

Here we meet 51 year-old Rosa.  Rosa is married but currently separated.  She has four children who are already grown up.  She lives with a 10 year-old grandchild who is her life and who is studying at elementary school.  Rosa has been a member of her community bank for five years and she likes the way it works.

Rosa has a cart from which she sells roasted chicken wings, fried pork rinds and 'fritadas' (a traditional fried pork dish).  She also sells cakes, colas and 'tostadas' (fried tortillas).  She works every day from 6.30am to 9.00am opposite a school, then from 3.00pm to 6.00pm from her home.  She tells us that she has been in this business for several years and she has a lot of customers.

Rosa will use this loan to buy the products she needs to make her food.  Her dreams are to own her own home since she currently rents.

loans.use: To buy chicken, pork, oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo, tiene 29 años, vive junto con su esposa y sus tres hijos, ellos viven en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Teofilo se dedica a la agricultura, él vende sus productos como por ejemplo papa, zanahorias y maíz en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Teofilo espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar semillas, abono y muchas cosas más.

Teofilo pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 29, lives with his wife and three children in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Teófilo is a farmer.  He sells his products, potatoes, carrots and corn, at Iquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Iquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city of Anta.  He has been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  Teófilo hopes to get a 1500 new sol loan to buy seeds, manure and many more things.

Teófilo is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and many more things.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VLLANKAQ MAQUI”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Iscuchaka, provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia tiene un pequeño terreno y se dedica a la compra y venta de productos secos y papa, la socia también cría animales menores y los vende en las ferias grandes o envía a la ciudad del Cusco. La socia vende dentro de los productos secos, quinua, habas, trigo y otros. ella desea invertir su nuevo crédito en la compra de productos secos como maíz al por mayor y en diferentes variedades. La socia solcita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para la venta.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmen, 30, is a member of the “VLLANKAQ MAQUI” communal bank located in Iscuchaka, Anta province, Cusco department.

She has a life partner and a son.  She has a small plot of land and she is a dry goods and potato merchant.  She also raises small farm animals that she sells at the large livestock markets or sends to the city of Cusco.  Among the dry goods she sells are: quinoa, lima beans, wheat and others.

She wants to invest the money from her new loan to buy dry goods, like corn, at wholesale and in different varieties.  She is asking for the loan to buy dry goods to sell.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Marleg España

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Av. Del Ejército.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Marleg, tiene 50 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene 4 hijos dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad, tiene una hija de 17 años y el menor tiene 14 años que estudia en colegio los dos viven con ella.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además también vende útiles escolares y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Avenida del Ejército” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

This is where we met Marleg, 50.  She is separated but has four children.  Two of them are already adults.  She has a 17 year old daughter and her youngest is 14 and still in school; both live with her.  

She has a foodstuffs store.  She sells rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.  She also sells school supplies and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, women’s accessories).  She works every day from 6am until 10pm and sometimes even later.  Her children help her with her work.  She buys her products in downtown Portoviejo although most of them are delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 years and she likes it because she has made friendships in the group.  Her goals are to continue forward in her business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada, tiene 54 años y tiene 5 hijos, ellos viven en la provincia D. Anta distrito D. Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Francisca se dedica a la ganadería, él venD. sus animales en la feria D. la comunidad D. Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad D. Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos D. ciudad principal D. Anta.  Francisca que espera recibir D. S/. 800 nuevos soles D. crédito y va comprar ganado como por ejemplo vacas, ovejas, chanchos y muchas animales más. 

Francisca pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” D. la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año D. funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Francisca, 54, is married and has five children.  They all live in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Francisca raises cattle.  She sells her animals in Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city in Anta. Francisca expects to get an 800 new sol loan to buy livestock like cows, sheep, pigs and many other animals.

Francisca is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been operating for a year and is well administered by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy livestock like: cattle, sheep, pigs and many other animals.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora, D. 50 años, vive al lado D.  esposo y sus dos jóvenes hijos, en su casa que es propia.Después D. haberse dedicado varios años a la atención  en  su tienda D.  comestibles, tuvo que cerrar el negocio; pues ya no le era  rentable. DesD. entonces, empezó con la comercialización  D. frutas, y en la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado D. su zona, y le va muy bien y para dinamizar el comercio D. su negocio compra su mercadería D. los mismos productores, que venden en sus camiones, pues los ofrecen a precios muy asequibles. D. ese modo pueD. aumentar el precio D. las frutas que ofrece  en el puesto ambulante que tiene en el  contorno del mercado D. su zona. Lo que mas le gusta del negocio es que le es muy rentable, y le permite captar buenas utilidades, pero lo que no le gusta es la polvareda que debe soportar en su puesto. Leonora está pensando en el  futuro alquilar un puesto dentro  del mercado, para que su negocio alcance el desarrollo.Es el 16avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y como es una socia antiguo D. su banco comunal se siente agradecido por todo el apoyo que recibe D. parte D. los integrantes, y también agradece a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando sin problemas.Leonora tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D.  mayor cantidad D. frutas, que tienen bastante salida durante la temporada D. verano, D. esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Leonora is 50 years old.  She lives with her husband and two young children in her own home.

After having spent several years working in her own grocery store, Leonora had to close her business because it was no longer profitable.  She then started selling fruit and she currently has a sales stall in her local market.  Her business is going very well and, in order to energize her business, she buys her merchandise from the producers themselves, who sell from their trucks, since they offer her very affordable prices.  In this way, she can increase the price of the fruit that she sells from the mobile stall that she has on the outskirts of her local market.

What Leonora most likes about her business is that it is very profitable and allows her to make a good incomes.  However, what she doesn't like are the dust clouds that she must put up with on her stall.  Leonora is thinking, in the future, of renting a stall insiD. the market itself so that she can make progress in her business.

This is Leonora's 16th loan with MFP and, as a long-standing member of her community bank, she feels grateful for all the support that she receives from the other members.  She would also like to thank the people who maD. her loan possible as it will allow her to continue working without problems.

Leonora is planning to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of fruit which are quite popular during the summer season.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (fruit) to stock her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es casada, tiene 42 años y tiene 5 hijos, ellos viven en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Rosa se dedica a la ganadería, ella vende sus animales menores en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta.  Rosa que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos, gaganado como por ejemplo vacas, gallinas y muchas animales más. 

Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is married and has five children.  They live in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Rosa raises small farm animals that she sells at Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city in Anta.  Rosa hopes to get a 1500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs and chickens and cattle like cows, chickens and many other animals.

Rosa is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is being well run by its governing board.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals like: guine pigs and chickens and cattle like cows, chickens and many other animals.

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
Mario es soltero, tiene 21 años y vive en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Mario se dedica a la agricultura, él se dedica a la compra y venta de productos agrícolas como por ejemplo papas, maíz, trigo, cebada y muchos más, él vende en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta.  Mario que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar semillas y muchos productos más. 

Mario pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Mario is 21, single, and lives in Anta province, Anta department of Cusco, about 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

He works in agriculture, buying and selling products such as potatoes, corn, wheat, barley and much more.  He sells them in the community market  “Tablada”, in Inquilpata which is 15 minutes from the main city of Anta.  He hopes to receive 1500 new sols with this loan and with them he will buy seeds and many other products.

Mario belongs to the Llankaq Maqui communal bank of the Arariwa Association.  The communal bank has been functioning for a year and is well administered by the board.

loans.use: To buy seeds and many other products.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny es conviviente, tiene 24 años y vive en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Yenny se dedica a la agricultura, ella se dedica a la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores, ella vende en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta.  Yenny que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos, patos y muchos productos más. 

Yenny pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Yenny, 24, has a live in partner.  They live in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Yenny is a farmer and raises small farm animals that she sells at Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is located 15 minutes from the main city in Anta.  Yenny hopes to get a 1500 new sol loan that she’ll use to buy small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens, chicks, ducks and many other products.

Yenny is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been in operation for a year and is being well run by its governing board.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals like; guinea pigs, chickens, chicks, ducks and many other products.

loans.name: Carmen Annabell

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años. El marido es comerciante. Está en el Banco Comunal por más de 6 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos a podido dia a dia seguir incrementando su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta,  también vende en su  casa hasta donde sus clientes llegan a comprar sus productos. Trabaja tres días en la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer. Sus sueños son terminar su casa que aun la tiene en construcción.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal in Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a very commercial zone well known for its traditional festival of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where we found Carmen, 24.  She is in a common law relationship and has four children.  Her husband is a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for over 6 years and she likes it because thanks to the loans he’s been able to expand her business day by day.

She sells all kinds of clothes door to door.  She also sells from home where her customers come by to buy her products.  She works three days a week.  She provides her goods on credit and collects biweekly.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or monthly depending on need.

This loan is to buy more clothes, especially women’s clothes.  Her dream is to finish building her house that’s still under construction.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 9, 6 años y el menor de 6 meses, los dos mayores están en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar en algo a los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, el cual tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad de Portoviejo en el que vende legumbres y frutas, trabaja de martes a domingo desde las 3h00 hasta las 13h00, sus productos los comprar en el mercado de mayoristas en la misma ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Ella lleva 8 años en el banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar en algo en la carga de la familia, ella se desempeña como secretaria del Banco. Sus sueños son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal in Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a very commercial zone well known for its traditional festival of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where we found Rosa, 35.  She is married and has three children who are 9, 6 and 6 months of age.  The two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who, wanting to help out with household expenses, is taking out a loan for her husband’s business.  He has a stall in the city of Portoviejo’s market where he sells fruit and vegetables.  He works from Tuesday through Sunday from 3am until 1pm.  He buys his products at the city’s wholesale market.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables and leafy green vegetables.  She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and likes it because the loans have helped her somewhat to meet household expenses.  She is the bank’s Secretary.  Her dream is to have a store in her house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Maricela Del Consuelo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Maricela lleva seis años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque siempre han estado para ayudarla tanto sus compañeras como también la institución. Tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una linda niña de 5 años la cual está en jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante. Ella estudia Ing. En  sistemas.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar en algo a los gastos del hogar realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo, el cual es vendedor mayorista de boletos de lotería, el esposo entrega los boletos de lotería en su casa a comerciantes minoristas que  a su vez los venden a las personas por las calles de la ciudad, trabaja los jueves, sabados y domingos. Realiza semanalmente los pedidos a la matriz en Guayaquil.
 
Este crédito es para comprar boletos de lotería ya que él tiene que cancelar allá al contado y entrega a crédito hasta por una semana. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
The Comunal bank "El Pedregal" holds meetings every 15 days in the Picoaza parish in Portoviejo. Portoviejo is known for being a very commercial area as well as for it's traditional "fiestas" in honor of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and the happiness of its people.
 
Maricela has been a member of the communal bank for six years.  She likes the bank because, both its members and the institution as a whole, have always been there to support her. She is 24 years old, married and has a five year old daughter who is now in kindergarten. Her husband works as a merchant. Maricela is studying Systems Engineering.
 
Maricela is a homemaker and she wishes to help with the household expenses by requesting the loan to invest her husband's business. Her husband sells wholesale lottery tickets, which he orders weekly from Guayaquil. Retailers pick up the tickets from their home and then sell them to people in the streets of the city. He works on Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays.
 
Maricela is requesting the loan so she can purchase lottery tickets given that her husband needs to pay for them in cash but allows up to a week to receive payments from customers. Maricela dreams of finishing college.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las charlas más que todas las educativas y también por los créditos, ya que a través de ello ha ido haciendo su casa poco a poco. Tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 6 años, todos  estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todos los días domingo.  Lo que más vende son desodorantes y cosméticos. Sus productos los recibe en su casa, además también su esposo vende ropa la cual la va a vender al Oriente.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa para que su esposo lleve a vender.  Sus sueños son tener su casa bien terminada.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal, Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

María is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because of the presentations, especially the educational ones, and also because of the loans because she has been able to build her house little by little thanks to them.  She is 38 years old, married and has three children who are 19, 15 and 6 years of age.  They are in the university, high school and school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).   She works three days a week.  She sells on credit and collects on Sundays.  What she sells the most are deodorants and cosmetics.  She receives her products at home and her husband also goes to sell clothes in the East.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes so that her husband can take to sell.  Her dream is to completely finish her house.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the mother of four children. She lives in a compound with her children and her longterm partner. Maria is one of the members of the Union y Desarrollo 1 & 2 (Unite and Development) group located in the town of Hato Mayor whose economy depends on farming. It is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. In this town, as in many others, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants.

Maria has been selling clothing and accessories for around ten years. She started her business with her own savings. She is receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional after having paid off her previous loans satisfactorily and thereby having taken a step towards the growth of her business. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of different clothes and accessories. Maria tells us that her most difficult challenge is to work hard and move forward for her children’s sake, yet she says her favorite activity is working in her business.

Maria plans to use her profits to save and invest in her house by making it more comfortable. Her dream is to be able to see her children graduate from university and to be able to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: To buy clothing and accessories to sell

loans.name: Jeniffer Pamela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal que se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jeniffer, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 4 años la misma que estudian en jardín de infantes. El marido es comerciante. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos en relación a otros bancos.

Ella es un ama de casa que realiza los créditos para el negocio del esposo, el cual es vendedor de carcasas y accesorios de teléfono, su forma de venta es ambulante en las calles de Manta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 17h00, sus productos los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le deja a buen precio.
 
Este crédito es para comprar carcasas y accesorios de teléfono. Sus sueños son tener una casa bien construida ya que la que tiene es de caña.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal communal bank meets every two weeks in El Pedregal, Picoaza parish, city of Portoviejo.  This is a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We found Jeniffer, 25, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has a 4 year old daughter who goes to kindergarten.  Her husband is a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 cycles and she likes it because the interest rates are low compared to other banks.

She is a housewife who manages the loans for her husband’s business which consists in the sale of telephone cases and accessories.  He sells along Manta’s streets every day from 8:30am until 5pm.  He buys his products in Portoviejo from a distributorship that sells at good prices.

This loan is to buy cases and phone accessories.  Her dream is to have a well built house since the one she has now is made from sugar cane stalks.

loans.use: To buy cases and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie L.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Rosie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rosie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Sylvia has a grocery business, which she has had for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for her store. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her store

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Anthony has a furniture shop business, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Anthony has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Anthony hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Anthony hopes to be the best in his town at making chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Atiiba

texts.en:
Atiiba N. is 51 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. Atiiba has a retail shop business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Atiiba has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Atiiba hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Atiiba hopes to expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and store food for restaurant

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence K. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are currently in school. Florence has a maize produce business, which she has run for less than a year.         
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize and beans which she sells to restaurants and hotels. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees. In the future, Florence hopes to open more branches of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Wycliff

texts.en:
Wycliff E. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Wycliff has a business of a grocery, which he has had for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Wycliff has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items for his store .  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Wycliff hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Wycliff hopes to see his children complete their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses D. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Moses has a grocery business, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Moses hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more items for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Beatrice has a boutique business, which she has run for less than a year.
To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Beatrice hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Beatrice hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Bakali

texts.en:
Bakali M. is 43 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Bakali has a grocery store business, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Bakali has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Bakali hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Bakali hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Badiru

texts.en:
Badiru R. is 44 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Badiru has a grocery store business, which he has run for less than a year.
To help expand his business, Badiru has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for his store. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Badiru hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Badiru hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Nsasa  Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
For the past seven years, 33-year-old  N. Gorette has been successfully overseeing her dairy and pig husbandry businesses in
Nsasa-Mukono. Gorette, whose affiliation is with Nsasa development group, says it was inspiration from her husband that motivated her to set forth. She and her husband are happily married and have two children who both go to school. Prior to starting these businesses she was running a grocery business. She cites hard work and prayers as reasons for her success. These businesses generate 150,000 UGX weekly. With this loan she says she is going to buy a Friesian cow that she anticipates will give her more milk to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mbalwa Development Group- Mukono

texts.en: Ruth N. is a 38-year-old happily married mother of four who has been in charge of a flourishing grocery store in Mbalwa-Mukono for the past ten years. From the statement, one may be deluded to think she is dead, but the statement is in perspective. Ruth, a courteous, welcoming and lively woman, says that close friends motivated her to start this business where she mostly has been selling mineral water and foodstuffs of all kinds. Her first business was a canteen in a neighboring school. This grocery business generates about $86 a week for her. Ruth is a member of Mbalwa Development group and she says that with this loan she is going to restock her grocery store with more foodstuffs to resell. She says that this will, at length, help her a great deal in terms of improved sales profits. She says this will be the first step towards expanding her grocery.

loans.use: The purchase of more foodstuffs to resell at her grocery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of more fish to resell

loans.name: Bumu Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 56-year-old Resty N. has been in the used clothing sales business for the last ten years in Kirinya-Mukono. The happily married mother of twelve says the need for self reliance motivated her to try her hand at this business. Since she began she has never looked back. With this business she has been able to provide for her family in many ways, principally the education of her kids. Resty says this business brings in about $43 a week. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell. Resty belongs to the Bumu Development Group.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of used clothing for resell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de profesión agricultor y comerciante. Con el apoyo de su familia en los siembros para brindar constantemente el mantenimiento del ciclo de la cosecha, obteniendo una mejor produción. Dentro de sus proyectos para el futuro es mejorar su vivienda. 
Durante este tiempo se le ha presentado dificultades como es el problema de robo de cosecha, Por tal razón el clíente vigila constante su producto.  Inicio a raíz que la familia de su esposa se desempeñaba Como agricultor y le dierón la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio. El plan principal es mejorar la finca con trabajo de fertelización y mejorar la cosecha. Con el préstamo que solicita será invertido en la comprar de fertelizante y fungil para aplicar a la cosecha. Generandole frutos de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is a farmer and a salesman.  With the support of his family, he provides constant care for his crops during the harvest cycle, which means that his crops produce better.  One of the projects Manuel has planned for the future is to improve his home.  He has had some difficulties in his work such as people stealing his harvest.  For this reason, he constantly keeps an eye on his produce.

Manuel started in this business as his wife's family members worked as farmers and they gave him the opportunity to set up his own business. Manuel's main plan is to improve his farm by fertilizing it.  This will improve his harvest.  He will invest his loan in buying fertilizer and fungicides to apply to his crops.  This will help him produce better-quality fruit.

loans.use: To buy treatments for his crops

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
La Sra. Ema tiene 22 años oriunda de Santa Cruz vive en la provincia de el Torno su actividad es la venta de sandalias en el mercado de el torno  cuenta con su negocio hace 2 años y como segunda actividad venta de juguetes para la época navideña actividad que es solo de temporada y donde le va muy bien.    
Su Estado civil  convive con el señor Daniel hace 4 años de actividad es la de dragero( Actividad que se dedica a sacar arena, ripio y piedra del rio para la construcción) en el la zona de Santa Rita los señores cuentan con 1 hijo pequeño, El Destino del crédito: para aumentar capital de trabajo comprando zapatos y sandalias para las fiestas navideñas.  La señora se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindando.
texts.en:
Ema is 22 years old and originally from Santa Cruz.  She lives in El Torno province and her business is selling sandals in El Torno market.  She has had her business for 2 years.  Ema has an additional business activity which is selling toys for the Christmas period.  This activity is only seasonal but does well.

Ema lives with her partner Daniel who has been working for four years in Santa Rita as a 'dragero' (a job which involves extracting sand, gravel and stones from rivers to be used in construction work).  The couple have one young child.

Ema will use her loan to increase her working capital, buying shoes and sandals for the Christmas season.  She is very happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy sandals wholesale

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Luisa C. H., es una persona de 65 años de edad,  divorciada con un hijo dependiente con 13 años de edad, vive en la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, trabaja como independiente en un puesto por las mañanas de venta de salteñas y algunos productos para la limpieza del hogar, este puesto de venta es ambulante en carrito muy cerca del mercado que existe en la zona y donde hay movimiento de tiendas y colegio.  Asimismo se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir los dìas domingos en el mercado central.  Ella vive en una vivienda alquilada y quiere crecer en su actividad para poder comprar un lote de terreno para realizar su sueño de construir su casita, está en esta actividad hacen 8 años.  

El crédito será utilizado para comprar mercadería para diversificar su oferta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa C. H. is 65 years old, and is divorced with a 13-year-old son. She lives in the Western part of the city of Cochabamba, and works independently in a stand in the mornings, selling empanadas (meat pies) and cleaning products for the home. Her stand moves on a cart, so she can travel to sell her products very close to the market, where there are many stores and a school. She also sells clothes on Sundays in the central market. She rents her home, and wants to grow her business so that she can buy land to achieve her dream of building her own house. She has been pursuing this business for 8 years.

The loans will be used to buy merchandise to diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase her capital

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela vende condimentos; ajinomoto (condimento para dar sabor a las comidas), aji en vaina ( para moler en batan y dar color y picante en los jigotes), también tuntas (papa deshidratada), chuños (papa deshidratada que acompaña a diferentes platos típicos de La Paz), ajo; trae también duraznos secos que se utiliza para hacer frescos de kisa y frazadas de plaza y media  como de dos plazas,  ella viaja todos los viernes por sus productos al Desaguadero frontera con el Perú es una feria concurrida por muchos comerciantes tanto como del Perú y Bolivia. Los productos que ella trae  los vende por mayor y al detalle en El Alto como en los diferentes mercados de La Paz.   Vive en Alto Miraflores Barrio Ferroviario  su casa es propia. La Sra. Ángela no tiene hijos vive con su esposo es una persona muy responsable con muchos deseos de superación, trabajadora, se lleva bien con sus vecinos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción para la culminación de la obra fina de su cocina, esta agradecida con la institución por el poyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Ángela sells seasoning. For example, she offers MSG (to flavor foods) and chiles (to grind and give color and spice to minced meat), as well as freeze-dried potatoes, dried potatoes, which accompany different traditional dishes in La Paz, and garlic. She also brings dried peaches that she uses to make soft drinks and blankets to central squares to sell. She travels every Friday to sell her products at a fair in Desaguadero, which is a town on the border with Perú. Many vendors come to this fair from both Perú and Bolivia. She sells her products wholesale, and as retail merchandise in El Alto and in different markets in La Paz. She lives in Alto Miraflores Barrio Ferroviario (her neighborhood) in her own home. Mrs. Ángela does not have any children, and she lives with her husband, who is very responsible.  Her goals include improving her life, working hard, and getting along with her neighbors. The money from this loan will be used to buy construction materials to complete the finishing work on her kitchen. She is thankful for the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To complete construction on the finishing work for her kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tires and bodywork

loans.name: Douglas Anderson

texts.es:
Douglas de 22 años, es un joven emprendedor que con ayuda y apoyo de unos familiares ahora tiene su propio negocio. El comenzó a vender papelería ya que no encontraba trabajo formal. 

En la actualidad viviendo en una zona periurbana tiene un pequeño negocio en donde vende cuadernos, plumas, juguetes para los clientes de la zona. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende cuadernos a $ 2.00, plumas a $ 0.35, juguetes a $ 8.00 etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar comprando con el préstamo cuadernos, plumas, juguetes. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener mas clientela por el sector.
texts.en:
Douglas, age 22, is an enterprising young man.  With help and support from some relatives, he now has his own business.  He started selling stationery supplies because he could not find regular work.

He currently lives in a periurban zone.  He has a small business where he sells notebooks, pens, and toys to customers in the area.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day.  He sells notebooks for $2.00, pens for $0.35, and toys for $8.00, etc.

He has many aspirations for the future.  Therefore, he wants use the loan to buy notebooks, pens, and toys.  In the future he wants to expand his business and have more customers in the area.

loans.use: Notebooks, pens, and toys

loans.name: Narcisa Del Rocio

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 25-year-old entrepreneur. She lives with her partner and 3 children in Playas, a well known tourist area in Ecuador. She started selling products door-to-door but she made only a small percentage on the products she sold. She knew that the people from her area had to go far to buy groceries so she used her first loans to buy a variety of products and then set up a small store at her house. Since then, she has been expanding her business step by step.

Narcisa works mostly alone in her store from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. Her partner has been a bricklayer since he was 13 years old but when he comes home after work, he helps her in the store. Narcisa does not experience any difficulties at her store at the moment, although they deal with some delinquency in the area. She hopes to expand her store in the future and to have a stable business. Narcisa plans to use her $1,000 loan to buy more merchandise for her store. She hopes to have her own house one day and to live happily with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Yenis Lorenis

texts.es:
Yenis de 42 años, empezó hace aproximadamente 15 años atrás a vender comida a sus diferentes conocidos y vecinos. Como tenia trayectoria cocinando y los clientes que al comienzo de su negocio tuvo estaban muy satisfecho ella continuo con su negocio. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana continúo con su negocio de venta de comida trabajando desde las 09h00am que comienza a hacer la comida hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Uno de los inconvenientes que tuvo  hace años fue con su salud pero ella continuo trabajando para poder mantener a su hijo ya que es madre soltera. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio por eso quiere construir mejor su vivienda ya que es ahí donde hace la comida y atiende a sus clientes por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, pintura. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y mejorar el espacio de atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yenis, 42, began selling food about 15 years ago to her neighbors and acquaintances. The customers that she had at the beginning were very satisfied so she continued her business selling food.  

Living in a semi-urban area, she has kept up her business selling food.  She works from 9:00am, when she starts to cook, until 4:00pm every day. Years ago, her health became a challenge, but she continued working in order to take care of her son, since she is a single mother.

She has many aspirations for her business and for that reason would like to improve her home, since that is where she makes the food and serves her customers.  She would like to use the loan to buy cement, cinder blocks and paint.  In the future, she would like to improve the construction of her house and the space where she serves her customers.

loans.use: Cement, paint and cinder blocks

loans.name: Gonzalo Angel

texts.en: O. is 48 years old, married and has four children, ages 22, 21, 19 and 17. His youngest daughter studies in public school. They live in Isla Trinitaria, in the Southern part of Guayaquil. This area has scant basic services but luckily O.’s home, made of concrete, has electricity and water. O. is a businessman who always tries to find and sell products that are in high demand at the moment. At the time of this interview, O. was making monigotes with the help of his sons. These monigotes are dolls made of paper maché and stuffed with sawdust and fireworks. It is a tradition in Ecuador to burn these dolls on New Year’s Eve, symbolizing the ending of the old year and the beginning of the New Year. O. and his sons work every day from 8 am until 6 pm. They plan to invest this loan in paint and fireworks for the monigotes. Even though his business is doing fine, O. and his wife have had some health issues lately. O. suffers from swollen legs and his wife, who takes care of the house, recently had surgery. O.’s dream is to finish his house.

loans.use: To buy paint and fireworks for monigotes (dolls for New Year's Eve)

loans.name: Mariela Mirella

texts.es:
Mariela de 20 años, aprendió a coser y confeccionar ropa desde que era pequeña ya que su mama le enseño para que tenga una actividad económica y no la agobie la falta de oportunidades.  

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ya tiene varios años en esta actividad. Coser y confeccionar le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos de su único hijo ya que es madre soltera. Trabaja cosiendo y confeccionando desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días. Hasta ahora no ha tenido dificultades en su negocio por eso ha continuado trabajando para darle una buena vida a su hijo. 

En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para poder tener más producción comprando una maquina industrial. En el futuro quiere ampliar mas el taller para poder mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mariela, 20 years old, learned to sew and make clothes when she was very young.  Her mother taught her so that she would have a way to make money and so that she wouldn't lack for opportunities. 

Living in a peri-urban zone, she now has been sewing for many years.   Sewing and making clothes has helped her to pay for the costs of raising her only son as a single mother.  She works sewing and making clothes from 8:00am until 6:00pm every day.  So far she has not had difficulties with her business and has continued to work to be able to give her son a good life.

In the future she would like to continue with her business but right now she wants a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine so she can increase her production. In the future she would like to make her work space bigger so that she can bring in more income.

loans.use: Industrial Sewing Machine

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 100% Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana, tiene 27 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 7 años el mismo que estudia en escuela, en la actualidad está embarazada de su segundo hijo. El marido es chofer de cooperativa de transporte interprovincial. Ella es nacida en El Carmen pero hace años se vino a Charapoto.

Se dedica al comercio vende productos para el hogar como planchas, colchones, camas, licuadoras entre otras, también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en una  distribuidora. En estos momentos quiere comenzar con venta de zapatos por catalogo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y zapatos ya que espera vender estos productos para incrementar su negocio. Está en el  Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
The "100% Charapote" Communal Bank meets in the city of Charapoto every two weeks.  This place is known for its traditional culture.   It is also known for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente, in the province.

This is where we find Ana.  She is 27 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has a seven year old child who goes to school.  She is now pregnant with her second child.  Her husband is a driver for an interprovincial transportation cooperative.  She was born in El Carmen, but she came to Charapoto years ago.

She sells products for the home.  She sells things like irons, mattresses, beds, and blenders, among others.  She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week.  She leaves her products on credit, and she collects each week or every two weeks according to what her customers want.  She gets her products from a distributor.  She now wants to start selling shoes by catalog.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and shoes.  She plans to sell these products in order to increase her business.  She has been in the communal bank from the beginning.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.  

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and shoes

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 100% Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a María, ella tiene  27 años está soltera y vive en casa de familiares.  Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que la de los bancos.

Trabaja en el arreglo de una casa y además tiene un negocio en sociedad con un hermano en el cual venden  productos químicos, insumos agrícolas así como también semillas y fertilizantes, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sabados y domingos hasta el medio dia. En los actuales momentos lo que más se vende son los fertilizantes y las semillas. Los productos los reciben de laboratorios químicos desde Guayaquil.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, químicos y otros. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The 100% Charapote Communal Bank meets in the city of Charapoto every two weeks.  This place is known for its traditional culture.   It is also known for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches, San Jacinto and San Clemente, in the province.

This is where we find María.  She is 27 years old, single, and lives in her relatives’ house.  This is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because the interest is lower than it is with other banks.

She works as a domestic employee, and she also has a business with her brother.  They sell chemical products and agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers.  They work every day from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  On Saturdays and Sundays they work until midday.  Fertilizers and seeds are what are sold the most.  They get their products from chemical laboratories in Guayaquil.

This loan is to buy seeds, fertilizers, chemicals and other things.  Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chemical products, seeds, and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Sofía Mariela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 100% Charapoto. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Sofía, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 19, 18 y 12 años, los dos menores estudian estudian en colegio. El marido es agricultor.
