Mrs. Sam-ol T. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Yong, have been married since 2006 and have two young children: one son and one daughter.

Sam-ol is a scarf weaver. Her husband is a barber. She requested a $150 Kiva loan one time already. She hopes to continue her business, so she asks for another loan of $150 to purchase scarf-weaving materials, such as cotton thread.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her scarf-weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow his business and increase his monthly income

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn C. and her husband, Mr. Cheung Prach, live in a village along the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1988 and have six children: two sons and four daughters. 

Sarorn is a weaver. Her husband is a carpenter and a wooden house constructor. 

She asks for a loan of $800 to purchase a cow to raise. When the cows give birth, she will be able to get income from selling the calves or when the cows grow to full size, she will be able to sell the cows for beef. 

In the photo are Mrs. Sarorn C. and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 32 years old farmer married with two children. His spouse is Carolyn Koross who is a house wife. He is the sole breadwinner for his family.  He is in the small scale horticultural farming business in Elkeiyo-Marakwet County. He has been in the business for the last 15 years, when he first started tending fruits seedlings for sale and he later started growing them in his farm. From his farm, Stanley gets an average monthly income of Kshs 25,000. 

Stanley has borrowed a second loan of Kshs 13,500 from KADET LIMITED after successfully paying his first loan. He intends to use Kshs 7,000 to purchase fertilizers, Kshs 4000 for wages and Kshs 2500 for transport and miscellaneous expenses. He anticipates using his profits to save for the education of his children and to plow back into the business.

His future dream is to expand his business to a large scale and build a permanent residential house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Aisas

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisas S., who is pictured here, sells recycled materials in her village. Her husband, Mr. Korsoem S., sells traditional medicines. In the past, he was security guard. They have been married since 1997 and have three sons and two daughters. 

Aisas is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport traditional medicine and to buy more medicine to sell.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok M. is 54 and married with five children all of whom are single. She currently lives in Kompong Tom province. Mok M. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them to sell and also for slaughter. Mok M.’s husband sells firewood. Two of the couple’s children work in a garment factory and earn a formal salary every month. This rice harvesting season, Mok M. needs capital to purchase sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy rice to store and sell

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mr. Ban B.  and his wife, Mrs. Soeun Shun, live along National Road Number Six about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two children. 

Ban and his wife are vegetable farmers. When he is not at the farm, he also works for a brick kiln. He is requsting a loan of $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain his farm

loans.name: Jenelie

texts.en:
Jenelie, 23 years old, is married and supports her family by operating 2 businesses: fishing and selling fish. She lives in San Remegio, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,600. Jenelie is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jenelie hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang L. and her husband, Mr. Ny Souy, are both 45 years old and have been married since 1990. They have two daughters; one is in university and the other is in high school. 

Savang is a weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband sells mangoes. He buys them from his fellow villagers before harvest season. When the mangoes grow, he transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Savang is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to purchase more mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.use: to provide capital for her husband to purchase more mangoes

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua K. is a 46 years old man who is married to Miriam Chemjor, a housewife. He is the sole breadwinner in his family with six children aged between 18 years and 9 years old.  He practices farming where he plants fruits which he later cultivates and sells at a profit. He has been in business for two years right now, with a monthly income of Kshs 10,000.

Joshua has applied for a loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LIMITED and he plans to buy more pipes for irrigation on his farm to replace the old ones. This will improve the farming business and he plans to save the anticipated profits for future use in his children school fees.

His future dreams are to become a great farmer who will be supplying fruits to other parts of the country.

loans.use: To buy new pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Sipha

texts.en: Miss Sipha O. is single and lives with her mother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Sipha has been a weaver since she was 15 years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then sells them in a Phnom Penh market. She hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession and she does not want to change to another business. She is asking for another loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Kemboi

texts.en:
Kemboi S. is 28 years old and married to Joyline who is a house wife.  They are blessed with one child who is three months old. He is the sole bread winner in the family. 

Kemboi owns a matatu (public service minivan) which he uses to transport people and goods from one place to another. He has been in this business for five years and he get a monthly income of Kshs 6,000. 

He is borrowing his first loan of Kshs 15,000 from KADET LTD which he will use to purchase some spare parts and service his vehicle. He plans to save the anticipated profit in order to buy another Matatu in future. 

He hopes to excel in business and have a big company of matatus and even lead the matatu owners in future.

loans.use: To service his public service vehicle

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang S. is a 33-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province and is married to Poeang Phearn, age 40. This couple, who work together in the farming business, have three children, all single.

Eang S. has had great success growing crops. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop; however, Eang S. doesn’t have enough capital for her farm. She is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing pipes, a pump machine, gasoline and fertilizers. She plans to use the remainder to pay for plowing. Eang S. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase farming necessities

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David K. is a 45 years gentleman who is married to Milkah Cheptumo who supports him in the family income. His children are all under 22 years and above two years. He is a farmer and he also runs a retail shop and a butcher shop as his secondary businesses. He has been in these businesses for five years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 12,000.

He is borrowing his first loan of Kshs 15,000 from KADET LTD and he plans to use it as follows; Kshs 5000 to purchase goods for his retail shop and Kshs 10,000 to boost butchery animal stock. 

He hopes to be a prominent business man and to assist his family and the community at large.

loans.use: To boost the business

loans.name: Kiek's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen members who live in Preaek Kong Reach village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kiek P., 56 years old, has been selected village bank president by the members. All members of this village group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Kiek P. and her husband, Mr. Chea Siek, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice for a living. They don’t have enough money to continue farming, so Mrs. Kiek P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to cultivate rice. This couple currently doesn’t have any children living with them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline to cultivate rice

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn G. is 37 years old, married and has five children, all of whom attend school.  She is a farmer who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She plants and harvests rice crops. She rents a stall in the market to sell her harvest. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizers for her rice farm.  Emelyn hopes to be a successful entrepreneur. She wants to be able to provide for all her family's needs. She wishes for bright futures for her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people living in Krapeu Ha village in Kandal province. The group members selected Mrs. Bun V., a 39-year-old married woman, as group leader. Each member will use the loan to support her own purpose. 

Mrs. Bun V. earns her living selling different vegetables at the local market. Her husband, Mr. Oem Malis, 50 years old, works as a construction worker. With both their jobs, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase her income to improve the family’s living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to enlarge her business. This couple has a child who is a student in a local school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to enlarge her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma owns a rice field in the town of Sta. Josefa, where she lives with her family. Her husband, who is also a farmer, does the primary farming tasks while Emma sells their harvest. Emma does her part to sustain her family and their business. She wishes to be a good wife to her husband and a good mother to her children.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Emma is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Phan C., 45 years old, as village bank president. Each member of this group will use her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Phan C. earns her living selling bananas and fruit at the local market. However, since she doesn't earn enough income to support her family, she wants to expand her business and thereby increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy more bananas and fruit for selling. Mrs. Phan C. is a widow with four children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory and two attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and fruit

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia P., 61 years old, is married and supports her family by operating 2 businesses: a general store and dressmaking. She lives in Prk. Mubentanyo, Brgy. Dungga, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.

Cecelia now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 in order to purchase more stock for the general store. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cecelia hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who are located in ReA. Chuor village in Kandal province. The members selected Mrs. Bun S., 49 years old, as group leader. Each member of this group will use her portion of the loan to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Bun S. and her husband, Mr. Yann Sam Oeun, are farmers who own 2 hectares of land where they cultivate rice for a living. However, they don't have enough money to continue with the farming. Therefore, Mrs. Bun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating rice. This couple works hard on the farm to support their three children, one of whom is a farmer while the other two attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cultivating rice

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 25 years old married to Janet who does not produce any income.  He is supporting three members of the family; his kid is one year old. He runs a food kiosk and he has been in business for 2 years and right now his monthly income is Kshs 6,000.

He is borrowing a loan of Kshs 20,000 and he plans to use it as follows; Kshs 10,000 to purchase wheat flour and Kshs 10,000 to purchase hotel utensils. He will use the anticipated profit to buy cattle and resell them to the middle men who supply them to Kenya Meat Commission when the prices appreciate. When this interview was conducted he was at the group meeting venue and not his business thus we have not captured his business.

His dreams of owning a lorry(truck) so that he can supply cattle to the slaughter houses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and hotel utensils.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak Su is 52 years old and has been cultivating rice on her own farmland for many years. She plants rice in both the rainy season and the dry season, and she often receives a good return from her farming business. She is married to Samrate Moun, 55, who earns a living by fishing in and around the lakes of their community. They have three married children, and three single children. Three of the children are employed as sewing workers at the garment factory. Currently, Prak Su wishes to rent a piece of farmland from her neighbor at a low price.  She will use this land for growing more rice. Prak Su is seeking a loan from Kiva to rent the land. 

Note: Prak Su and her son are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To rent farmland from her neighbor

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  Farming and buying and selling rice. Her husband Nestor F. is 55 years old.  He works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 3 children between 26 and 32 years old.  One child has a family and the other 2 are working. 

Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future. Elisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its programs, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old and married. She has 11 children, and the younger ones still attend school. Guillerma is a rice grower. She and her husband work their best to maintain their farm, ensuring the rice crops are healthy and the farm is free of weeds and pests.

Guillerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for the tractor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and tractor fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To do necessary maintenance for his pickup

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha M. is the leader of this group. She lives in Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 55 and married. Her husband is a retiree. Together they have raised three sons and three daughters.  The youngest daughter studies at school and the other children are married and live with their families. To earn money, Aisha and her husband breed livestock. They resell the animals after fattening. In this way the family earns 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase feed for livestock. In the future, Aisha wants to increase the number of animals she raises and to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old and married. She has 3 children, the eldest 13 years old. Josefina owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Josefina wishes to have a successful business.

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en: Myagmarjav B. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two infant sons in Uvs province in western Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in a rented enclosure. Myagmarjav and his wife operate a shoemaking business in their home, a business which his wife started in 2008 with help of her mother. Before he began to help with his wife's business in 2010, Myagmarjav had been operating a raw materials sales business in a local market for ten years. For the future, he wants to expand their shoemaking business and have their own shoemaking factory. Myagmarjav is a modest man and is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials and supplies used in making shoes.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials and supplies

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo M. is from the village of Victoria, San Mateo. He is 57 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Alfredo owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Alfredo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Abasse

texts.ar:
عباس في عمر 40 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد نجار يعمل في تعهدات المنازل يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى تطوير نفسه وعمله 
يريد من خلال تحسين وضعه الى تحسين وضع عائلته لأنها من اولى اهتماماته فهو يريد تعليم اولاده وتأمين العيش الكريم
لهم خاصة انهم في ريعان طفولتهم عباس طموح محب لعمله ويريد دائما التطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى 
شراء بيك اب جديد لتحسين عمله ونقل البضائع الخاصة بهذا العمل
texts.en: Abasse is a 40-year-old husband and father of four who wants to develop himself and his work to advance his family and provide them with an excellent education, particularly since they are at a tender age. Abasse is a very assiduous carpenter who works in home contracting. He would now like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a new pickup truck to transport materials related to his work.

loans.use: To purchase pickup truck to transport construction materials

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie I. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years old and married. She has 4 children aged 16, 14, 13 and 5. Lenie owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lenie works hard to sustain her family's needs, especially her children's education. She hopes for a bright future for them.

Lenie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans M. is 30 years old and married to Miriam who is a house wife. He is the sole breadwinner for his two children and wife. He is a horticulture farmer and he has been in business for one year with a monthly income of Kshs 10,000.

He is borrowing a loan of Kshs 20,000 which he plans to use to purchase cereals and buy insecticides for his horticulture farming. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business to a higher level. 

His hopes to be a successful business man who takes risks that make him a real entrepreneur and one whom others will learn from.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and buy insecticides for horticulture farming

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar V. is a local farmer from the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband earn an average daily income of $7 per day to support their whole family. Sar V. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow rice crops. She has now decided to lease some land in order to plant peanuts to earn additional income. Because her savings are not sufficient, Sar V. would like a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to be used to lease a parcel of land for planting peanuts.

Note: Sar V., her husband and her granddaughter are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: to lease a parcel of land for planting peanuts

loans.name: Mirembe Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: 34-year-old Hawa N. has 6 children and is happily married.  She has been running her used-clothing sales business in Bugembe trading center in Jinja for 5 years. Before she embarked on this business, she was employed at a local women's non-governmental community organization. Ever since she began the business, she has been inclined toward diligence. This diligence has delivered results as manifested by the organized way she goes about her business.  This business generates her 200,000 shillings per month.  With this loan, she wants to buy more used clothing to resell. Hawa belongs to Mirembe Development group-Jinja.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar M. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter attends a local primary school while his wife stays at home with their youngest daughter. Munhbayar operates a taxi service using his own car in his town. He started his transportation business in 2004 and has gained a lot of experience as a driver. For the future, he plans to purchase another car and rent his old car to other people for profit. Munhbayar is a modest man and says, "All I want is to have my own fence for my family." 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Gulmairam's Group

texts.en:
Gulmairam S., 33, resides in Kadamjai. She is the leader of this group. She is divorced, and the single mother of  three daughters. All of her daughters attend school.  To earn a living,  Gulmairam is a commercial agent who sells medicine. She started this business two years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, and she now earns 1000 soms per month. With money received from the loan,  she wants to purchase kitchen furniture in order to improve the family’s living conditions. In the future she dreams of opening her own pharmacy. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen furniture

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des tissus, des produits cosmétiques et des condiments.                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                    
COUMBA K. s’approvisionne en produits cosmétiques à Bamako le plus souvent. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à domicile et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes passagers.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group, all married, have an average age of 35 and 4 children. They all live in large traditional families in the city of Fana, the neighbourhood of Banankabougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the republic of Mali). They met each other through kinship ties and do business in fabrics, cosmetic products and condiments.

The women of the Danaya group are requesting their first loan. 

Coumba Keita stocks up on cosmetic products in Bamako the most often. She makes her sales from home and at the Fana market for cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women who pass by. She foresees an average monthly profit of 15 000 CFA francs which will be used to pay back the loan, take care of health-related expenses, food, school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 21 سنة اعزب ويحب عمله يعمل في رسم الوشم على الاجساد في منزله له في عمله 4 سنوات طموح ويحب ان 
يساعد اهله ويحسن ضعه المالي والاجتماعي وتحقيق حلمه بأن يكون له مركز تجميل خاص له يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة
الى استئجار محل خاص له لكي يوسع المصلحة ويزيد من عدد زبائنه فهو محب للعمل وزبائنه يقصدونه ويسعى دائما الى
تأمين الاماكن لتتسع لأكبر عدد من الزبائن
texts.en: Hasan, 31, is single and self employed.  He has a passion for tattooing, an occupation he has been working at for 4 years.  Hasan supports his family and wants to improve his financial and social status.  Hasan is ambitious. He currently works from home but he wishes to fulfill his dream of having his own shop. He seeks a loan from Al Majmoua to rent a shop so as to expand his business and increase his clients. Hasan loves his work and enjoys his clients' trust. He wishes to be able to secure more room for more clients.

loans.use: To rent a shop for his tattoo business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
53-year-old Linda is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is a farmer who plants and harvests rice crops. She says she has been exposed to farming since she was a child because both her parents were farmers. Linda earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from growing and selling rice. Aside from farming, she also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells various kinds of products.

Linda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Linda is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de condiments, de savon et des chaussures plastiques.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, de savon et des chaussures plastique.                                    
SALI D. s’approvisionne en savon avec les grossistes du marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à domicile et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sabougnouman group are married women who average 38 years of age and seven children. They live in traditional families in the town of Fana, district of Banankabougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They sell condiments, soap and plastic shoes.

The Sabougnouman group members are on their first group loan, which will be used to stock up on merchandise.

SALI D. gets her stocks of soap from wholesalers at the Fana market. She conducts her sales daily from her home and at the Fana market, for cash and credit, to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to pay for healthcare, food and tuition, the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To purchase soap

loans.name: Try's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is being requested by four members who are located in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. The group selected Mrs. Try M.,  who is 43 years old, as the group leader. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. 
 
Mrs. Try M. and her husband, Mr. Choek Chi, are farmers who own 3 hectares of land where they cultivate corn and rice.  They are in need of some money to grow crops. So Mrs. Try M. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her farming crops. The couple works hard on the farm to support three children: Two attend the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Munhuu

texts.en:
Munhuu O. is 40 years old and lives with his wife in Uvs province, Western Mongolia in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.

Munhuu operates a meat trading business out of a stall at the local market in his town, helped by his wife. He travels to the countryside to purchase and transport livestock. He sells the meat at the local market at both wholesale and retail. He started his business in 1998 and has since built a stable operation. After many years in business he has gained a great deal of experience in his trade. 

In the future he plans to supply his products to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His earnings have enabled him to improve his home by purchasing furniture to replace that which was burned in 2008. Munhuu hopes to expand his meat trading business in the future. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of meat in order to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, 3 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de poisson, de condiments et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                          
FATOUMATA C., la présidente du groupe compte  s’approvisionne quotidiennement en poissons fumés avec les revendeurs de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village et pendant les jours de foires au marché de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi solidarity group are married women who average 28 years of age and three children each. They live with their husbands and children in extended traditional families in the village of Coulibalyla, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They sell fish, condiments and peanuts. The Benkadi group members are on their first loan.

Fatoumata C., president of the group, gets her daily stocks of smoked fish from the resellers of Dioïla. She sells on location, in the village, and on fair days at the Dioïla market, for cash and credit to a customer base of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and for personal expenses.

loans.use: Buying smoked fish

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar:
حسن في عمر 48 سنة متزوج وله 2 ولدان يريد لهم العيش الكريم الجيد في جو ملائم للأطفال فهو محب لعائلته وهي اولى 
اهتماماته يسعى دائما الى تطوير نفسه وعمله فهو يعمل في دهان السيارات ويريد ان يحسن دائما من عمله له في عمله
31 سنة زبائنه كثر هم من محيطه وجيرانه ليس لديه صعوبات في تطوير نفسه لكنه يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من النجموعة
الى تحسين وضع منزله من دهان الى خزائن للمطبخ فهو يحب ان تكون عائلته دائما في امان وراحة
texts.en: Hasan, 48, is married with 2 children. He loves his family which is his top priority. Thus he wishes to secure a decent life for his children. Hasan always seeks to improve himself and his car painting business. He always seeks to excel in his business, where he has been working for 31 years. Hasan has many clients from his neighbors and other people who know him. He is not facing any problem with developing his business but he wants a loan from Al Majmoua to improve his house's condition. He would like to paint it and buy kitchen cabinets as he always wants his family to live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: To paint his house and buy kitchen cabinets

loans.name: Enhtungalag

texts.en:
Enhtungalag D. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her three older children attend a local secondary school, while her husband supplements the family income by operating a transportation service using his own horse and cart.

Enhtungalag operates a firewood selling business at the local market. She started her business in 2005 and has since gained much experience. She sells firewood at 2500 MNT per bag to the local cafes and canteens. After years in business her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family. For the future Enhtungalag says, "We want to have our own car that will be used for our businesses." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase one truck of wood to re-sell at retail.

loans.use: To purchase one truck of wood

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Chhean C. is a hard-working man who has spent his life as a motor taxi driver in and around his community, Siem Reap province. He is an older man and can earn an average revenue of $3.00 per day from his motor taxi service.

Chhean C. has a life partner in his wife who, along with their two sons, works in the fishing business. They usually spend eight hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. They catch around ten kilos of fish per day and sell them in bulk to their customers who are retail sellers in the market. The couple is blessed with five children all of whom are married.

To support his wife’s business Chhean C. will use his loan to purchase nets, machinery and other fishing implements for catching more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, machinery and other fishing implements for catching more fish

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gouloukan, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de lait et des galettes.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier avec Soro Yiriwaso.
MAZE B. s’approvisionne en condiments avec les grossistes de Dioïla presque chaque semaine. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F  CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Benkadi Group („Harmony”) are all married. On average, they are 43 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Gouloukan, prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood. They trade with food condiments, milk and biscuits.

This is the first loan of the women of Benkadi Group with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Maze B. buys condiments nearly every week from the wholesalers in Dioïla. She sells them in her village, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Mrs B. expects to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to repay the loan and pay for healthcare, food and tuition, and any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret is a thirty eight year old single mother of one child, who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has a family dream of educating her child up to the university level.  She has a drug store and has been in business for seven years and this has enabled her to provide for her family.  Her business goal is to set up a pharmacy.  Gorret needs the loan to buy more pharmacy drugs for her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing pharmacy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Raila's Group

texts.en:
Raila Z. is the treasurer of this group.  She is 49 years old and lives in Kadamjai with her family.  Her husband is a pensioner. Together they have raised two sons and two daughters.  The younger son studies at university and the other children are married and live separately with their families. 

In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Raila and her husband breed livestock.  They have been doing it for 25 years.  Reselling livestock animals after fattening them earns 2,000 KGS per month.  With the money received from this loan Raila wants to purchase three sheep in order to increase the number of livestock.  In the future she wants to see her younger son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce de bétail, de savons et d’articles divers.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
DOUSSOU C. s’approvisionne en bétail auprès des éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes au niveau du village et au marché de Dioïla pendant les jours de foires au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women. On average, they are 38 years old, have 4 children and live with their husbands and children in extended traditional families in the village of Coulibalyla, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other through family and neighborhood ties. They are engaged in the restaurant business and in the sale of livestock, soaps and various other items.                                                                                     

The women of the Danaya group are on their first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 
                                                                         
DOUSSOU C. gets her supplies of livestock from cattle farmers in the village and its outskirts. She makes her sales in the village and at the market in Dioïla on fair days, for cash or credit, to a customer-base composed of women and men.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs that will be used to repay the loan and cover personal expenses.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en: Vuth M. is 39 years old and lives along the river in Siem Reap, Siem Reap Province.  Vuth M. and her husband are currently local fishermen.  They depend on catching fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake.  That is the core place where the fish shelter.  They have been fishing for a long time and earn at least $7 a day.  This profit is used to cover the family's living expenses and especially to make sure the five children get the highest education.  Vuth M. is applying for a loan in order to buy machines and nets for fishing.

loans.use: To buy machines and nets for fishing.

loans.name: Mongolmaa

texts.en:
Mongolmaa B. is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Tuv Province in Central Mongolia.  She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Her husband works as a construction worker for a local company since 2008 and earns monthly salary of 200,000 MNT during summer months. 

Mongolmaa operates a consumer goods trading business out of a rented stall at a local trade center.  She sells a variety of common household goods to her customers.  She started her business in 2008 after working for a private company for several years.  Based on her many years of business experience that was gained by helping her mother's grocery trading business, she has quickly established herself in the local business community. 

Her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family and decorate her home.  For the future, she hopes to build her own house for her family.  Mongolmaa is a modest and hard working person and says, "My main goal is to expand and enlarge my stall where I sell my products."  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to enlarge her current stall at the market.

loans.use: To enlarge her current stall at the market.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 54 سنة متزوج وله 2 ولدان يحب عائلته يعمل في نقل عام له في عمله 25 سنة يسعى جاهدا الى تحسين اوضاعه المادية
والاجتماعية فهو يريد لعائلته المستقبل الجيد وتأمين العيش الكريم وتحسين وضعهم الاجتماعي والمادي يريد من خلال طلب 
قرض له من المجموعة الى صيانة الفان خاصته حتى لا يضطر الى التوقف عن العمل لأن الفان هذا هو المعيل الوحيد له ولعائلته
يحلم دائما بالتجدد والتطور له زبائن يقصدونه من السواح يتميز بالصدق والامانة
texts.en: Ahmad is a 54-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family and who works hard to provide a secure future for them. For the past quarter century, Ahmad has been working in taxiing tourists around. Ahmad’s work is marked by responsibility and integrity. He would now like to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to have maintenance work conducted on his van, which is the sole source of income for him and his family.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on van

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is twenty nine years old and is a very hard working man who lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is a motorcycle transport driver and has been in business for eight months now and the business is profitable.  He faces challenges in change of weather and his ambition is to own at least three motorcycles.  Abed intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Vulamehlo Group

texts.en:
Gugu is 37 years old and a single mother with 4 children, between the ages of 11 and 22 years old.  She runs a retail business selling chickens and a decoration renting business for weddings in Mtubatuba, South Africa (KZN).  In the photo above, she is raising her left hand and wearing a pink skirt.

She's been selling chickens for three years and the wedding decoration rental business for six years and runs it from her home.  She also gets income from the government's child support grant.  She says that the main challenges to her business are customers who do not pay on time.

She requested this loan through the Women's Development Businesses and KIVA to buy a tent to rent with along with her wedding decorations.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her with the future education for her children. In the future, she would like to have more tents for her wedding decoration rental business.

She adds that WDB and Kiva are very helpful for her in her business.

loans.use: To buy a tent to rent with along with her wedding decorations rental.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gouloukan, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles font la couture, le commerce des tasses, de tubercules, d’arachides, la vente des galettes.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                 
SANATA D. s’approvisionne en merceries et tissus au marché de Dioïla. Après fabrication de draps, elle effectue ses ventes sur place au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’homme
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djekafo group, all married, have an average age of 43 and four children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Gouloukan, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted as relatives and as neighbors. They sew and do business selling cups, tubers, peanuts, and cakes. This is their first group loan.

Sanata D. gets her fabric and notions at the Dioïla market. After making sheets, she sells them in the village square, for cash and credit to both men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used to pay back the loan and for medical expenses, groceries, and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and sewing notions

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 36 year old man who has been manufacturing kitchen cabinets since 2004.  Eyad’s warehouse is well known in the region and most of his clients recommend him.  Eyad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to expand his business by buying extra wood for client projects.  

His clients can be contractors or any person who needs to renew his kitchen.  Eyad is a man with a good reputation.  He is well known in the region and most of his clients are loyal to him.  Eyad looks forward to expand his sawmill to a more advance and improved one.

loans.use: To buy extra wood for client kitchen cabinet projects.

loans.name: Sergelenbaatar

texts.en:
Sergelenbaatar O. is 26 years old and lives with his parents and sibling in Hovd Province of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  All of his family members have their own businesses.  

Sergelenbaatar operates a car repair and service business out of his own work place.  He began his own business in 2009 by operating a car wash service.  During the short period of operation, he has enlarged his business and operates a car repair service and was able to build his own work place in 2010. 

For the near future, he plans to solve a building heat problem so that he can provide car repairing and washing services in all seasons.  He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan in order to install heat and electricity in his working place.

loans.use: To install heat and electricity so that he can provide car repairing and washing services in all seasons.

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kototala sont des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de poissons, de condiments, des fruits, des tubercules et d’articles divers.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Kototala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
WAWA D. s’approvisionne quotidiennement en fruits avec les revendeurs de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place au village et pendant les jours de foires au marché de Dioïla, en détail,  au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Kototala group are married women, and they are, on average, 35 years old with three children. They live with their husbands and children in traditional extended families in the village of Coulibalyla, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted as relatives and as neighbors, and they do business in fish, condiments, fruits, tubers, and various other products. This is the first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso for these women.

Wawa D. gets her daily fruit supply from distributors in Dioïla. She sells in the village square and on Dioïla market days. Her sales are retail, for cash and credit to both men and women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used to pay the loan and for personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a fifty year old hardworking man, married to a nurse with five children. They live in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to secure a sustainable venture to earn income for the basic needs at home. For ten years he has been an employee of the Ministry of Health and also owns a drug shop. His major challenge is price fluctuation of drugs. In the future he hopes to set up a pharmacy. George needs the loan to buy drugs for resale.

loans.use: Buying drugs for resale

loans.name: Yaser

texts.ar:
ياسر في عمر 35 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في تعهدات منزلية له في مصلحته 14 سنة يحب عائلته ويريد لها التحسن 
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع للعمل يحب عمله ويسعى الى التطور دائما ليس لديه صعوبات
في العمل يريد تأمين خدمة جيدة ومستقبل جيد له خبرة واسعه في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصقدقائه
texts.en: Yaser is a 35-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family and wants to improve their condition. Yaser has 14 years of experience working in home contracting, his customers including his friends, neighbors, and general community. He very much enjoys his work, which he is always seeking to develop so as to provide excellent service. Accordingly, Yaser wanted to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase inventory for his work.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is from the village of Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old. Lourdes is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a business venture in the Agricultural sector in raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from Planting and Harvesting rice for sale in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional Fertilizer. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Qedumona Group

texts.en:
Ntombenhle is 34 years old and she is single with three children, aged between 9 and 15 years. She sells airtime and does photocopies at her home at Mtubatuba in South Africa (KZN). She also earns income from the government’s child support grant. 

She says that the she does not face any challenges because her business is small. She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to help purchase another photocopy machine for her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her business succeed and she would like to buy and operate public phones. She hopes to use her profits to make her house bigger. 

Ntombenhle is the leader of her group of five borrowers, and is raising her hand in the photo above.

loans.use: To buy a photocoping machine

loans.name: Saramaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Saramaya sont des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce de poissons et de condiments.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Saramaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des poissons et des condiments.                                                                          
SATA K. s’approvisionne hebdomadairement en condiments avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue ses ventes au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Saramaya group are married women, and on average, they are 47 years old with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Coulibalyla, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They are acquainted as relatives and as neighbors, and they do business in fish and condiments.

Sata K. get her weekly supply of condiments from wholesalers at the Dioïla market. She sells in the village for cash and credit to a clientele made up of both women and men.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA, which will be used to pay the loan and for personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Undrahbayar

texts.en: Undrahbayar D. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Tuv province of Mongolia. Both his two children attend a local school while his wife studies in the evening class in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a public transport service between Tuv province and Ulaanbaatar since 1998. After many years of owing this business, he has built a stable operation and has gained not only much experience but also a positive reputation among his customers. With his business profits, he was able to buy an apartment in 2006, where the family now lives. For the future, Undrahbayar plans to buy a larger bigger bus with 40 seats. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan for his business.

loans.use: To buy a larger bus

loans.name: Monic

texts.en: 38 year old N. Monic has been in the beauty salon business for the past 5 years. The business is located in Wanyange-Jinja. The happily married and amiable mother of 2 was previously worked in a close friend's salon. She says that is where she learned the hands-on skills in hair dressing. With her focused approach, she has been able to achieve a lot, given that her business requires good relationship skills. In that regard she has not shortchanged herself. Notwithstanding the successes Monic has achieved, she has also had to grapple with a lot of financial challenges that have in many ways dampened the smooth running of her business. Monic also has raises and sells goats on the side. With her optimism, the future looks bright. She says she wants to construct a family house and develop another income generating business. Weekly this business generates 30,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she wants to purchase more hair cosmetic products for use at her beauty salon.

loans.use: The purchase more hair cosmetic products for use at her beauty salon

loans.name: Radwan

texts.ar:
رضوان في عمرة52 سنة يعمل في تصليح ودهان الاحذية متزوج وله 3 اولاد يحب عائلته ويريد لهم العيش الكريم الجيد
يريد لهم تأمين مستقبلهم وحياتهم المهنية والعلمية فهم من اولى اهتماماته يريد لمصلحته التطور والازدهار له تاريخ
جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم في دعم عمله كثيرا وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من عائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة 
الى شراء ماكنة للدرز للأحذية جديدة حتى تزيد له في المدخول وتكون قد ادخل شيء متطور جديد في عمله
texts.en: Radwan is a 52-year-old husband and father of three who loves his family very much and wants to provide them with a good education and professional future and who in turn is greatly supported by them. Radwan is always seeking to develop his business as a cobbler. He has a good credit history with Al Majmoua, the last loan having been of great benefit. He now wants to request another loan to purchase a new sewing machine for shoes so that his store can be stocked with the latest equipment.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine for shoes

loans.name: Siguidolo Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Siguidolo sont des femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent avec leurs maris et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Coulibalyla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce de poissons, de l’arachide et des galettes.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Siguidolo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
SITAN F. s’approvisionne hebdomadairement en intrants de galettes avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla. Elle effectue sa vente au niveau du village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, et effectuer les dépenses personnelles.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguidolo group are married women, averaging 38 years old and four children each. They live with their husbands and children in traditional extended families in the village of Couibalyla, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali).

The women met through family and neighborhood connections and all work in food preparation, selling fish, peanuts and flat cakes. 

This is their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Sitan F. buys the ingredient for flat cakes weekly from wholesalers at the Dioïla market. She sells her goods locally in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. Sitan expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay back the loan and for personal expenses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for flat cakes

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong S. is a 28-year-old fisherwoman and the mother of four school-aged children. Every day in the early morning, Hong S. and her husband always go to fish in and around their village and then they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market to sell. In addition, Hong S.’s husband also uses his existing motorbike to pick up passengers for fees. Unfortunately, an existing motorbike is broken down. To help her husband, Hong S. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase a used motorcycle for replacing the broken one. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to buy equipment for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to replace a broken one, and to buy equipment for fishing

loans.name: Aichurek's Group

texts.en:
Aichurek J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 36 and married to a construction worker. Together they bring up a son and two daughters. The son and the first daughter attend school, and the youngest daughter is a baby. 

A year ago with the initial investment of 500 KGS, Aichurek started to breed poultry. She earns 1,000 KGS per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase feed and 10 hens for breeding. In the future Aichurek wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hens

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 19-year-old single man from Chtoura. He has owned an aluminum sales shop since 2009. Since Rami is fresh with his new business, he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his aluminum capital, to be able to meet most of his clients orders. Rami is an ambitious hard worker who started his business with a small amount of capital and is working hard to improve his business as much as he can. His dream is to enter the wholesale trade world. Then, he might think of making the family he always dreams of.

loans.use: To increase his aluminum capital

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Badenya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’habillements et de céréales.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des tissus, des habillements et des céréales.                                                                          
ROKIA D. s’approvisionne  en habillements en au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Badenya are all married and average 41 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in the city of Massigui, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they do commerce in clothing and in grains.  The group members are on their 15th solidarity loan, which will be used to buy cloth, clothing, and grain. 

Ms. ROKIA D. gets her supplies of clothing at the Massigui market.  Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men, she makes her sales locally and at surrounding fairs. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to cover expenses related to health care, food, and schooling.  The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Nabil

texts.ar:
نبيل في عمر 48 سنة يعمل في تصليح السيارات وبيع القطع المستعملة للسيارات متزوج وله ولدان له في مهنته 18 عاما
يحب عمله ويريد تحسين وضعه ووضع عائلته وعمله لأن مصلحته وعائلته من اولى اهتمامه فهو يلقى صعوبة وتنافس في محيطه العملي
لكن الصعوبات المادية هي اكثر المشاكل لديه في العمل حيث ساهم القرض السابق في تطوير مصلحته وهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له 
من المجموعة الى عدة جديدة للعمل ويتميز في عمله بالصدق والدقة والمثابرة على التطور
texts.en: Nabil is a 48-year-old husband and father of two for whom his family and work are the top priority. Nabil has 18 years of experience repairing automobiles and selling automobile spare parts, his work being marked by thoroughness and diligence. He is currently facing rather stiff competition. Given his financial difficulties at work, his last loan was very helpful in further developing his business. Nabil would now like to ask for another loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new equipment.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tiontala préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, grains, condiments, fruits etc.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
ROKIA S. s’approvisionnera en grains de céréales chez les revendeurs de Massigui et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et au marché pendant les jours de foires, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 24 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age, with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Tiontala, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family ties. They sell clothing, cereals, condiments, fruits etc. The members of the Benkadi group are on the first solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso. Rokia Sanagare buys her stock of cereals from resellers in Massigui and nearby markets. She sells out of her home and at the market on market days, retails for cash and on credit, mainly to direct consumers.
She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 24,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’habillements, de céréales et de condiments.                                                                        
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.
