MAFANTA T. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Massigui hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile et au marché de Massigui, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women, averaging 36 years of age, with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Massigui, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They sell clothing, cereals and condiments.

The members of the Danaya group are on their fifth solidarity loan, having properly repaid four prior loans. 
Mafanta T. stocks up on condiments at the weekly Massigui market. She sells out of her home and at the Massigui market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 90,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan, cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng N. is the leader of this four-member group; all the borrowers live in the province of Siem Reap.  N., 44, is currently a massage employee in a small club and earns a proper salary to contribute to her family’s well-being.  She is married to Saiy, 47, who is a temporary laborer.  

Heng N. is the mother of five children, all of whom are single.  One of her sons works driving a taxi.  Heng N. has an older house that often has problems and she hopes to repair it by using this loan from Kiva.

The other three members are: 

S., 59, who sells firewood to earn a living. She needs a loan to repair her broken motorcycle.
N., 56, who makes and sells various cakes and she is asking for a loan to help her business grow.
L., 64, who is a porter in the busy local market. She requests a loan to buy the a motor bike for traveling to work.

loans.use: To repair her older house.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil is a 44-year-old married man, living in Chtoura with his small family. Kamil has worked in the fruits and vegetables trade since 1999. His business is going fine and most of his clients are loyal to him. They wait for him to pass by their village each day to buy the goods they need. Kamil likes his business. He states that working through visiting the neighboring villages with his pickup made him famous among most fruit and vegetable dealers, and the good relations he made with his clients made him more trust worthy. Kamil is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital and to pay for what's left from the price of the furniture he bought. He hopes to go into the wholesale trade soon, but he believes that in order to do this, he has to do a detailed plan for every step to be taken.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habillements, de céréales et de condiments alimentaires.                                                                        
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                          
BATOMA H. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Massigui hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile et au marché de Massigui, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djiguisseme group are all married women, averaging 38 years of age, with  five children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Massigui, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the 2nd administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They sell clothing, cereals and food condiments.

The members of the Danaya group are on their 11th solidarity loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Batoma Haidara stocks up on condiments at the weekly Massigui market. She sells out of her home and at the Massigui market, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 50,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan, cover expenses related to healthcare, food, and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing food condiments

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is a 48 year old widow with six children. Her children are aged between 10 and 28 years. She runs a grocery business which has been operational for five years and gets a monthly income of Kshs 1,000. 

Esther is borrowing her fifth loan of Kshs 2,000 from KADET LIMITED to purchase more stock for her grocery shop. She plans to open a mitumba (second hand clothes) shop with the anticipated profit from the business. 

She has future plans of opening a clothes shop and developing the family plot.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her grocery shop

loans.name: Honronya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Honronya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Tiontala préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des grains de céréales, des condiments et des fruits.                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Honronya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre premiers.                                                                          
SARAN S. s’approvisionnera en fruits auprès des paysans producteurs de Massigui et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et au marché pendant les jours de foires, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de revendeurs.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Honronya group are all married, have an average age of 34 years, an average of 4 children and all live in large traditional families in the Tiontala village, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met each other through family ties and trade in grains, cereals, condiments and fruits. The women of the Honronya group are on their fifth solidarity loan after having repaid the other four on time.
Saran S. sources her fruits from farmers in Massigui and the surrounding areas. She makes her sales there and in the market on fair days, selling for cash and credit, to customers mostly consisting of retailers.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 30,000 XOF, which she will use to repay the loan, cover healthcare and education expenses. She will reinvest the rest into her business.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits

loans.name: Munduz's Group

texts.en:
Munduz S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 56 and married to a hoist man. She has raised a son and a daughter. In the near future the son plans to go to Russia to work there. The daughter is married. 

In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Munduz sells convenience goods. She started with the initial investment of 3,000 KGS and now she earns 10,000 KGS per month. She also breeds livestock to make additional money. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding. In the future Munduz wants to see her son get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S., 46, is married with four adult children. She is married to Pheng, 38, a military policeman. Two of the children are employed in a restaurant, while the other two help her with her business. Tep S. has a small shop in her home where she sells food to her nearby neighbors. In the morning she sells porridge and in the evening she sells beef soup. 

Tep S. will use her loan to purchase a motorcycle for her kids to drive to their work place.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Kabende Centre  Tukorehamu Group

texts.en: Robert is a 31-year-old married man with four children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He longs to build a permanent house and educate his children. He has been operating a retail shop for four years and the business is still profitable. His goal is to become a wholesale trader. Robert needs this loan to buy sugar, rice and paraffin for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and paraffin

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font la restauration, le commerce d’habillements et des fruits.                                                                         
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire et tous les quatorze précédents furent remboursés sans aucune difficulté.                                                                          
AWA C. s’approvisionne en fruits au marché de Massigui hebdomadairement avec les forains. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile et au marché de Massigui, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who form the Kotognontala group are all married, averaging 35 years of age with four children, and live in traditional extended families in the town of Massigui Prefecture of Dioila, Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors. They cook food for sale and retail clothing and fruits. The Kotognontala group members are on their 15th group loan, having repaid the previous 14 loans without any issues.

Awa C. buys her stock of fruits from the sellers at the weekly Massigui market. She sells retail out of her home and at the Massigui market,   for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 30,000 West African Francs, which will be used for repaying the loan and  covering healthcare and food expenses, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en: Bathuyag A. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and adult daughter in a house and enclosure in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a salesperson at the night market in the city while his daughter is a receptionist for the Palace Hotel. Bathuyag works as a contract driver for a taxi company. He began his business in 2008 with his own car but sold it due to a life-related problem. Currently he drives a rented taxi and pays 22,000 MNT daily to the company. For the future, he plans to have his own car in order to expand his business. Bathuyag is a modest and hardworking person who works very hard to improve his family's standard of living. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to have his own car after finishing his contract with the taxi company.

loans.use: to have his own car

loans.name: Davud

texts.ru: Хасанов Давуд проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en:
Davud H. lives in the Shahritus region. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. He completed secondary education.

He earns his living by raising livestock. He has been engaged in these types of activities for 15 years. The loan will be used to buy young animals, in order to increase their quantity. 

He wants to expand his business and to improve the financial situation in his family.

loans.use: To purchase young animals

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 50 years old married to Lucy C. who is also a business lady and this brings additional income to the family. they are blessed with six children.He does a coblar work whereby he repairs shoes,and he has been doing this for the last 22 years,and earns a monthly profit of KES. 22,000.

Peter has applied for his fourth loan from KADET LIMITED of Kshs 80,000 which he plans to use to materials for repairing shoes like threads, shoe glue e.t.c. He plans to buy a pick-up van with the anticipated profits which he will use to hire for transport business that he desires to venture into in the near future. 

He hopes to be able to support his family and the necessary basic needs.

loans.use: To buy assorted materials for repairing shoes e.g shoe glue,thread e.t.c

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Massigui préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’habillements et de céréales.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire  après avoir correctement remboursées les quatorze précédents.                                                                          
SITAN H. s’approvisionne en habillements au marché de Massigui. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who are members of the Benkola group are all married, averaging 45 years of age and 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Massigui Prefecutre of Dioila, Region of Koulikoro (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors and are in business selling clothing and cereals.

The members of the Benkola group are on their 15th loan, having duly repaid the previous 14 loans. Sitan H. stocks up on clothing at the Massigui market. She sells out of her home and at the nearby markets, for cash and on credit, to a client base composed of women and men. 
She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 90,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan and take care of healthcare expenses, with the rest reinvested in her business

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice T. is a 28 year old businesswoman married with three children aged between 6 and 2 years. She supports a family of five people. Her spouse who is a primary school teacher also supports her in the running of the business as well as in providing for the family from his salary.
  
Alice runs a clothing shop in Mogotio town which she started three years ago. From this business she gets a monthly income of Kshs 8,000. 

Alice has borrowed her second loan of Kshs 40,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying for her first loan. She intends to use the loan to purchase new cloths for resale and a sewing machine for her business. She anticipates saving her profits for the education of her children. Her photo was taken at the groups meeting point.

Her dream is to have a successful business and be resourceful and be of help to young entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase stock of materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Suvderdene

texts.en: Suvderdene A. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in the Yaarmag of Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband currently works in a train station, her eldest daughter attends secondary school and her youngest two daughters are both in kindergarten. Suvderdene operates a hair salon in a rented space in her district. She started the hair and beauty salon in 2009 and has developed her business in a short time with many clients. She graduated from a vocational training course with a professional certificate. In addition, she operates a dance and calisthenics service to supplement her earnings. For the future, she hopes to expand both of her businesses. Suvderdene is a very kind and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary supplies and materials such as hair cream, face cream, makeup, towels etc. and to make repairs to her dancing hall workspace.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies and materials

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim C. is a 49-year-old who lives in the province of Siem Reap. She earns her daily income by working in a private organization and is able to make a profit from her monthly salary. She now lives with her niece who sells a few items such as food, soft drinks and shampoo for additional income. Tim C.'s existing motorbike is getting old and is always breaking down. She wants to buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one but does not have enough money in her personal savings. Therefore, Tim C. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle to drive to her work location.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Nzailu

texts.en:
Nzailu K. C. is a 54 year old man. He is married to Monica and together they have been blessed with four children. His wife is a farmer. 

Nzailu owns a boutique and has been in this business for the last nine years. He is able to meet the needs of his family from this business.

This marks his sixth loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase dresses and shirts for resale to his customers. He plans to us the anticipated profits to expand his business. His dream is to succeed through KADET loans.

loans.use: purchase dresses and shirts for resale

loans.name: Gulbahar's Group

texts.en:
Gulbahar S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39 and married to a driver. She has a son and a daughter, who both attend school. Gulbahar works as a teacher of Russian at school. She also breeds livestock to earn additional money. She makes 3,000 KGS per month reselling livestock animals after fattening. With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase five more animals for breeding. In the future, Gulbahar wants to expand her business and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon Z. C. is a 36 year old businessman. He is married to Florence and together they have been blessed with three children. Simon owns a butcher shop and has been in this business for the last ten years. His other source of income comes from selling hides and skin from goats and other animals.

This marks Simon’s third loan from KADET, and he plans to buy fifteen goats for slaughter in his butcher.  The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business. His dreams and hopes are to become a successful businessman through KADET loans.

loans.use: to buy fifteen goats for slaughter and sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David Z. J. is a 27 year old man. He is married to Mary and together they have been blessed with three children. David has been in the transport sector for the last one year with the use of his motorbike although he also has a retail shop that he operates as a secondary business. 

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to repair his motor bike and purchase sugar and flour for his retail shop. The anticipated profits will be directed to the expansion of his business.

His dream is to invest more in the transport sector so that he can maximize on more profits.

loans.use: repair his motor bike and purchase sugar and flour for his retail shop

loans.name: Chhoeung

texts.en: Chhoeung S. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Siem Reap province. Before she was married, she began a business catching fish from the river. Now, her husband works with her in her fishing business. This is a great season; almost all of the fishermen are very happy that they can catch a lot of fish. But Chhoeung S. doesn't have all the essential machines and nets with which to fish, which is why she is requesting a loan via Kiva’s partner HKL to buy the required equipment.

loans.use: To buy machines, nets, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne J. N. is a single mother of twenty eight years. She has one child of six years old and they live in Milimani in the outskirts of Kitale. She sells used clothes in the same area and gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings and she has been in this business for four years now.

This will be Yvonne's first loan with KADET which she plans to use to buy one bail of second-hand clothes worth 10,000. With the income she is going to get, she plans to add more clothes for selling and also start saving to buy a plot to invest in future. 

In future she wants to educate her child to the highest level and also buy her own house.

loans.use: To add stock like buy more T-shirts for resale

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 31-year-old married man from Bint Jbeil. Since 1996, he has worked in construction with a specialization in tile. Abbass is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a tile polishing machine and a power generator. Both of these tools are important to improve his business. This is Abbass's second loan from Al Majmoua; he is a client in good standing. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. Most of his clients are neighbors, relatives, and friends. He is working hard to provide his family with the best education and tools to live healthy lives. He hopes to open a full construction services company in the future, and to maintain it as a family business for his children.

loans.use: To buy a tile polishing machine and a power generator

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anelly

texts.en:
Anelly K. D. is a 44 year old lady. She is married to Charo and they have been blessed with two children. Anelly has been a clothes vendor for the last one year in Mombasa area. 

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD which she plans to use to purchase more clothes for reselling into her business. From the anticipated profits, she plans to re-invest the profit by adding more stock into the business. 

Her dream is to expand her business and employ more workers.

loans.use: purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child. 

In 2005, Ahmad decided to open his own business, a mobile phone shop. The business is located in an area where competition is minimal; this makes him well known in the market. He has an excellent reputation as well.

He is requesting a $2000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for the shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab J. is a young man from Tulkarem, a warm city famous for its citrus fruits. Ihab is a single young man living with his parents, sisters and brothers. He helps his family with the income he makes working in an auto repair workshop.

As Ihab wants to increase his income, he has come to FATEN to request a loan to start a small vegetable and fruit stall. Ihab is a respected young man known in the city for his good reputation, which he thinks will help him attract a good number of customers and so increase his family's income.

loans.use: To start a fruit and vegetable stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand mobile phone business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 38 years old and the married father of three kids. Since 2009, he has been working in the transportation field and he has over 10 years of related experience. Mohamad owns a van to transport tourists throughout Lebanon and he also transports employees and students to and from home, work, and school. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to change his van’s engine and seats to improve his business, although Mohamad’s clients are satisfied with what he has. In the future, Mohamad hopes to open a small transportation company with branches in the region.

loans.use: to improve and update van

loans.name: Jinan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 29 years old, married and has four children.

In 2008, Jinan opened her own sewing project for women and children clothes. She is very experienced in this field and now she is becoming well known and has a good reputation in her local community.

She is requesting a $2,500 loan to buy a new big sewing machine to increase her production. She uses a room in her house for her sewing and she wants to renovate this room. She is aiming to grow bigger in the future and increase her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new big sewing machine and renovate her work room

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen J. is 37 years old and married to Lucas Kibwamboe who is 41 years old and a farmer.  They are blessed with two children sharon Jerop aged 16 years and Gloria Jepngetich who is eight years old.  

Hellen owns a shop in Ndurio trading centre, she has been operating this business for a period of nine years and she is doing well and her monthly profits is Ksh.6300. She has borrowed a loan of Ksh. 20,000 from KADET this being her first loan.  Hellen intends to use this loan to purchase soap, sugar, tealeaves and salt for her shop.  

Hellen says that the profits plowed back from her business will be used as savings for her two school going children and also she hopes to open a supermarket in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase more stock bread, rice ,flour e.t.c  for sale

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.en:
K. Kurbonali is 40 years old, married, and has 8 children. He grows wheat and potatoes and sells them in the market for income. He has been working in this business for almost 5 years and has gained much experience. Kurbonali has a large family, considering that he is living with his parents. He works almost every day to generate revenue to support his family. Since his family relies on his crops, Kurbonali needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for his current harvest. This will be his third loan with IMON International and his previous credit history shows he is qualified to receive the loan.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to solve her husband's business problems

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil is married and has 5 children. He makes a living selling foodstuffs at his grocery store. His location is very good and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. Ismoil has been in this business for 8 years and knows a good deal about it. He is also very punctual and detail-oriented, character traits that help him in his business. Ismoil can always figure out how much stock he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs yet it is always fresh. Ismoil has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff to increase the range of product offerings

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel K. B. is a 47 year old man, married to Suphilina Sang and together they have four children. His wife buys and sells clothes and therefore adds income to the family. Samwel is a shop keeper and milk seller and his businesses are in Ngenyilel in the outskirts of Eldoret. He has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Samwel's Second loan with KADET and he continues to say that he did not have any problems in repaying the first loan but rather he made profits which enabled him to repay the first loan well. With this current loan he plans to add stock to his retail shop business with items like rice, sugar, milk and other fast moving shop items.He is pictured here transporting goods. 

In future Samwel wants to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock like buy sugar, milk, rice for resale

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.ar:
محمود في عمر 57 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يحب عمله فهو يعمل في مجال الخياطة من اكثر من 35 سنة يعمل في تصميم وتصليح الستائر
محمود يحب عائلته وعمله كثيرا وهو طموح وصاحب افكار خلاقة في مجال البرادي ما يميزه هو الاتقان والصدق في المواعيد
كان يعاني صعوبة في المنافسة والتسويق لنفسه يريد قرض من خلال المجموعة الى شراء اكسسوار خاص بصناعة الستائر وزيادة البضائع
الموجودة وهو يجاري تطورات العصر في صناعة البرادي
texts.en: Mahmoud is a 57-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family very much. Mahmoud has been working as a sewing professional for the past 35 years designing and mending curtains. He is very driven, perfectionist, and punctual, in addition to which he is full of creative ideas. He also always keeps up with the latest developments in the drape industry. Because he faces problems trying to market himself in the midst of intense competition, he is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase curtain accessories and more inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more curtain material and accessories

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia J. is 21 years old and married to Richard Sum who is a driver. They have 3 children whose ages are six, three, and two years old. Slyvia runs a shop in Ndurio trading centre where she sells industrial goods.  She gets a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000 from her shop. She has been in this business for a period of three years and she is doing well as she has good potential customers buying from her shop.

She has borrowed a loan of Kshs 50,000 from KADET this being her first loan. She intends to use this money to purchase stock for her shop with items like flour, sugar and rice.  

Sylvia anticipates saving the profits she gets so that she can be able to educate her children as well as expanding her business in future.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more tools for his business

loans.name: Abubakari

texts.en:
Abubakari K. G. is a 34 year old man. He is married to Esther and together they have been blessed with two children. He has been a retail shop trader for the last two years.

This marks his second loan from KADET, and he plans to purchase cereals, vegetables and sodas (soft drinks) for his business. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of his business. 

His future dream is to expand his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: purchase cereals, vegetables and soda for his business

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 37-year-old single man from Qana. He has owned a mobile phone shop since 2005, with 8 years of experience in this field. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the fourth time, in order to buy extra mobile recharge cards to improve his income. The previously requested loans had a good impact on his business, and he hopes for the same with this loan.

Hasan is doing well in his business. Since his major education was in electronics maintenance, he specializes in doing mobile phone maintenance, in addition to selling the phones. This gives him an important advantage among competitors, who use his help in doing the necessary maintenance on their clients' mobile phones. Hasan hopes to open a larger shop, which he plans to divide into two sectors: one specialized in mobile selling and the other in maintenance.

loans.use: to buy extra mobile recharge cards

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد متزوج في عمر 34 سنة له ولد يعمل في مجال النقل العام له في عمله 15 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى دائما
الى تطويره فهو يريد ان يزداد مدخوله المادي له خبرة في عمله فهو له زبائن كثيرة من محيطه وجيرانه وسواح
يقصدونه لتعريفه على المناطق اللبنانية يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع سيارته وتحسين وضع المحرك
حتى يستطيع تطوير عمله يريد لعائلته التطوير والتحسين وزيادة مدخولهم
texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old husband and father of one who wants to increase his family’s income. Ahmad has 15 years of experience operating a taxi around Lebanon for the many neighbors and tourists who make up his clientele. He is always seeking to further develop his work and further increase revenues. Accordingly, he wanted to ask for a loan from A. Majmoua to have some maintenance work performed on his car and his car engine in particular.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca W. N. is a 27 year old business lady from Mariakani. She has one dependant who is her sister. Prisca is a shoe supplier and seller and she also owns a motorbike which is used to transport goods and people to various places. She has been in these businesses for the last two years.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the funds from this loan in addition to her savings to buy a piece of land in which she will build rental houses. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of her shoe supply and motorbike business. Her dream is to own more plots in future.

loans.use: buy a piece of land

loans.name: Mirzohokim

texts.en:
S. Mirzohokim is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. Her wife is a housekeeper and the business of Mirzohokim is the main source of income of his large family. Mirzohokim is providing the services of transportation for the last 3 years. Each day on his lorry he is transporting different products of his clients. Mirzohokim is dreaming all of his children to be well-educated so that he is why he is working hard. As a result the business generates the significant income allowing him supporting his large family. In order to provide the better service for his clients and with that way to earn more, Mirzohokim needs to purchase the spare parts for his lorry to fix it. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose he requests $1500 USD.  Being loaned for the second time Mirzohokim is sure that he will repay the loan in time with no violation.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of spare parts in order to fix his lorry (truck) and continue his transportation service .

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K. is 40 years and married to Musa Kipkule. Together with her husband they have been blessed with ten children whom she and her husband bring up.  She runs a hotel and a grocery stall and she has been in business three years with a monthly income of Kshs 4,000. 

She is borrowing her second loan of Kshs 10,000 which she plans to use to purchase more stock for the retail shop and grocery. She plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to expand the grocery. 

She hopes is to have a big shop in the near future.

loans.use: To add stock to the hotel

loans.name: Usmonali

texts.en:
K. Usmonali is 61 years old, is married, and has 3 children. All of his life he has devoted to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Usmonali the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting potatoes and carrots that he will sell, because the price will depend on the size of the potato. Sorted, the potato is more profitable, although the potatoes he sells are not in great shape. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. With the money requested, Usmonali will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm. The part of the loan he will also spend for purchasing young cattle.         



More about Tajikistan and IMON International



Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 


IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, fertilizer and the young cattle

loans.name: Ameen

texts.ar:
امين في عمر 51 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في توزيع الخبز والكعك له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب ان يتطور وان يزيد
من مدخوله له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم القرض الاول في زيادة مدخوله ودعم مصلحته وقد كان يلقى
الدعم الكامل من عائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء معلبات وتوزيعها لزيادة المدخول
اوضاعه المادية لم تكن مستقرة لأنه يلقى منافسة في عمله ولكنه يلقى دعم من محيطه العملي حيث ان زبائنه
هم من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Ameen is a 51-year-old husband and father of two who is greatly supported by his family. Ameen has a decade of experience working in bread and pastry distribution. Although his financiA. situation has not been entirely stable because of the stiff competition, he has found great support among his friends and neighbors, who make up his customer base. He is eager to further develop his business to increase revenues. Ameen enjoys a good credit history with A. Majmoua, and his last loan was very helpful. He is now looking for another loan to purchase canned goods to add to his inventory.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods to sell

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Cattle farming is an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Husein has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has a small child that, according to Husein’s words, he is his reason for living. It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural aren't enough to maintain a family and for this reason, Husein works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his family. Husein urgently needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of $1500 USD. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle

loans.name: Abdusami

texts.en:
K. Abdusami, 46, is a farmer who lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1996. He is married with 3 children. Unfortunately, Abdusami's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of 13000 Somoni to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to use on his potato crop. With the part of the loan he will also buy additional cattle for his business. Abdusami hopes the loan will allow him to increase his yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs.
